2. Idealization . This may be romantic or paradoxical. Thus, a winner may say: ‘My grandmother was a wonderful housekeeper,’ or ‘My grandfather lived to be ninety-eight and had all his teeth and no gray hair.’ There is a clear indication that the speaker would like to follow in the romantic grandparent’s footsteps and is basing her or his script on that. A loser will express paradoxical idealization: ‘My grandmother was a tough, down-to-earth woman, but she became senile in her old age.’ There is a clear implication that she may have been senile, but she was the smartest woman in the state hospital; and furthermore, that that is also the speaker’s script: to be the smartest woman in the state hospital. Unfortunately, this setup is so frequent that the competition in state hospitals to be the smartest woman on the ward can become quite strenuous, turbulent, and discouraging.

2. 理想化。这种理想化可能是浪漫的，也可能是自相矛盾的。例如，获胜者可能会说：“我的祖母是一位出色的家庭主妇”，或者“我的祖父活到了九十八岁，牙齿齐全，头发也没有白发”。这清楚地表明，说话者希望效仿这位浪漫的祖父母，并以此为基础构建自己的故事。失败者则会表达自相矛盾的理想化：“我的祖母是一位坚强、务实的女性，但她晚年患上了老年痴呆症。”这清楚地暗示着，她可能患有老年痴呆症，但她却是州立医院里最聪明的女人；此外，这也暗示着说话者自己的故事：成为州立医院里最聪明的女人。不幸的是，这种情况非常普遍，以至于州立医院里争夺“病房里最聪明的女人”的竞争会变得异常激烈、混乱，甚至令人沮丧。

3. Rivalry . ‘My grandfather dominated my grandmother,’ or ‘My grandfather was a weakling who let everyone push him around.’ These are often the ‘neurotic’ responses interpreted by psychoanalysts as expressing the child’s desire to be more powerful than his parents. ‘Grandfather is one person who can talk back to my mother – I’d like to be him,’ or ‘If I were my father’s father I wouldn’t be a coward, I’d show him.’ Karl Abraham’s case report shows the scripty nature of such attitudes, where the boy indulges in daydreams of being the prince of an imaginary kingdom whose king is like his father. Then along comes the king’s father, who is far more powerful than the king. Once, when the boy was punished by his mother, he said ‘Now I’ll marry granny.’ Thus, his secret (but not unconscious) planning at that time was based on a fairy tale in which he becomes more powerful than his parents by becoming his grandfather.

3. 竞争。“我的祖父支配着我的祖母”，或者“我的祖父是个软弱的人，任人摆布”。精神分析学家通常将这些“神经质”的反应解读为孩子渴望超越父母的愿望。“祖父是唯一一个敢顶撞我母亲的人——我想成为他”，或者“如果我是我父亲的父亲，我就不会是个懦夫，我会让他刮目相看”。卡尔·亚伯拉罕的案例报告揭示了这种态度的脚本化特征：男孩沉浸在白日梦中，幻想自己是一个虚构王国的王子，国王像他的父亲一样。然后，国王的父亲出现了，他比国王强大得多。有一次，男孩被母亲惩罚后，他说：“现在我要娶奶奶。”因此，他当时秘密（但并非无意识）的计划是基于一个童话故事：他通过成为祖父而超越父母。

4. Personal Experiences . These concern actual transactions between children and their grandparents, which are strong influences in molding the child’s script. A grandmother can send a little boy forth to be a hero, 11 or on the other hand, a grandfather can seduce a schoolgirl and turn her into a Little Red Riding Hood.

4. 个人经历。这指的是孩子与祖父母之间的实际互动，这些互动对塑造孩子的性格脚本有着强大的影响。祖母可以鼓励小男孩成为英雄，而祖父则可以诱惑女学生，把她变成小红帽。

In general, grandparents, as mythology and clinical experience show, are regarded with awe or terror, just as parents can be regarded with admiration or fear. The more primitive feelings of awe and terror are influential in forming the child’s picture of the world during the early stages of script-building. 12

一般来说，正如神话和临床经验所表明的那样，祖父母会让人感到敬畏或恐惧，就像父母会让人感到钦佩或害怕一样。这种更为原始的敬畏和恐惧感，在儿童早期构建世界观的过程中发挥着重要作用。

C • The Conceptive Scene

C • 概念场景

The context in which Jeder was conceived may have a strong influence in deciding his life plan and his ultimate fate. This context starts off with his parents’ marriage, if there was one. Sometimes the young couple gets married with a strong urge to have a son and heir. This is particularly apt to happen if the marriage is arranged or encouraged by their families, especially if there is something to inherit, such as a kingdom or a corporation. The son is then reared in accordance with his station in life, and learns all the arts and crafts suitable for kings or presidents. Thus, his script is handed to him already written, and to abdicate from it may require an act of heroic renunciation. If the first-born in such cases is a girl instead of a boy, she may run into difficulties; this is often seen in the first-born daughters of bankers, who may be cast adrift to become homosexuals, strip-tease artists, or the wives of improvident and irresponsible Bohemians or trust-fund bums. In some situations, the father may even divorce the mother if she doesn’t produce a boy, leaving the daughters with a keen sense of original guilt for having been born female.

杰德的出生背景或许对其人生规划和最终命运有着深远的影响。这首先要从他父母的婚姻说起（如果他们结婚的话）。有时，年轻夫妇结婚时会强烈渴望生个儿子作为继承人。如果婚姻是由双方家庭安排或鼓励的，这种情况就尤为常见，特别是当有遗产可继承时，例如王国或公司。儿子会按照其社会地位接受教育，学习所有适合国王或总统的技艺。因此，他的人生剧本早已写好，想要放弃或许需要英雄般的舍弃。如果在这种情况下，长子是女孩而非男孩，她可能会遇到困难；这种情况在银行家的长女身上尤为常见，她们可能会被抛弃，最终沦为同性恋者、脱衣舞娘，或是挥霍无度、不负责任的波西米亚人或信托基金游手好闲之徒的妻子。在某些情况下，如果母亲没有生男孩，父亲甚至可能会与她离婚，这会让女儿们因为生为女孩而产生强烈的负罪感。

On the other hand, the father may have no intention of marrying the mother, and flees the scene, never to be heard from again, as soon as she announces her pregnancy. This leaves the young hero to make his own way almost from the day of his birth. Sometimes it is the mother who runs away. But even grudging parents may accept an unwanted child because he is an income-tax deduction or a welfare claim. The teen-ager may be well aware of this, and when asked who he is, or what his script is, he will reply ‘I’m an income-tax deduction (a welfare claim).’

另一方面，父亲可能根本没打算娶母亲，一旦母亲宣布怀孕，父亲便会逃之夭夭，从此杳无音信。这样一来，这个年轻的主人公几乎从出生之日起就得独自谋生。有时，逃跑的是母亲。但即便心怀不满的父母，也可能因为孩子能抵税或领取福利而勉强接受这个不想要的孩子。这个青少年可能很清楚这一点，当被问及他是谁，或者他的人生剧本是什么时，他会回答：“我是个抵税的（领取福利的）。”

If the child is long in being conceived, his parents’ longing may lead them to dedicate him before his birth, as is the case in many legends of famous people, and in fairy tales such as Rapunzel: another way in which real life resembles literature, or as Oscar Wilde put it, nature imitates art. This raises other interesting script questions running the whole gamut of tragedy and romance. What if Romeo had fathered a child, or Ophelia given birth, or Cordelia become pregnant? What would have become of these offspring? Medea’s children, and the Little Princes in the tower of London, are the most celebrated examples of children being the victims of their parents’ scripts, just as the little girls and boys sold as sodomistic slaves in certain Arab countries are the most obscure. 13

如果孩子受孕时间很长，父母的渴望可能会驱使他们在孩子出生前就将其献祭，正如许多名人的传说和童话故事（例如《长发公主》）中所描述的那样：这是现实生活与文学相似之处的又一例证，或者正如奥斯卡·王尔德所说，自然模仿艺术。这引发了其他有趣的剧本问题，涵盖了悲剧和浪漫的各个方面。如果罗密欧有了孩子，或者奥菲莉娅生了孩子，或者科迪莉亚怀孕了呢？这些孩子会怎么样？美狄亚的孩子和伦敦塔里的小王子们是孩子成为父母剧本受害者的最著名例子，而那些在某些阿拉伯国家被卖为鸡奸奴隶的小女孩和小男孩则是最鲜为人知的例子。

The bedside manner of the actual impregnation may be called the conceptive attitude. Was it due to accident, passion, love, violence, deception, spite, or resignation? If any of these, what was the background and preparation for such an event? If it was planned, was it planned coldly or warmly, simply or bookishly, with lots of talk, or by strong, silent communion? The child’s script may have the same qualities. Is sex regarded as dirty, casual, sacred, or fun? The offspring may be treated the same way. Was an abortion attempted? Were several attempts made? How many abortions or attempts were there during previous pregnancies? There is almost an infinite number of questions of varying degrees of subtlety possible here, and all these factors can influence the script of the still unborn baby. One of the most common situations is nicely summarized in a popular limerick:

实际受孕时的床边情境可以称为受孕态度。它是意外、激情、爱情、暴力、欺骗、怨恨还是无奈所致？如果是上述任何一种情况，那么发生这样的事情的背景和准备是什么？如果是计划好的，计划是冷漠的还是热情的？是简单的还是书卷气的？是滔滔不绝的交谈，还是默契十足的默契？孩子的剧本可能也具有同样的特质。性被视为肮脏的、随意的、神圣的还是有趣的？孩子可能也会受到同样的对待。是否尝试过堕胎？是否尝试过多次？之前的怀孕期间有多少次堕胎或尝试堕胎？这里几乎可以提出无数个微妙程度不一的问题，所有这些因素都会影响未出生婴儿的剧本。一种最常见的情况可以用一首流行的五行打油诗来概括：

There was a young (fellow, lady) named Horn

有个名叫霍恩的年轻人（小伙子，姑娘）。

Who wished (he, she) had never been born.

谁希望自己从未出生过？

(He, she) wouldn’t have been

（他，她）本来不会是

If (his, her) (father, mother) had seen

如果（他的，她的）（父亲，母亲）看到

That the end of the rubber was torn.

橡胶末端破了。

Even this homely genealogy is not of such somber simplicity as it seems, since there are several possibilities. For example, it is one thing if neither parent knew the condom was defective; another if the mother knew and didn’t mention it to the father; and still a third if the father knew and didn’t mention it to the mother.

即使是这样看似简单的家谱，也并非如表面看起来那么沉重，因为其中存在多种可能性。例如，如果父母双方都不知道避孕套有缺陷，这是一回事；如果母亲知道却没有告诉父亲，又是另一回事；如果父亲知道却没有告诉母亲，则还有第三种可能。

On the cheerful side, there are the cases where both parents want children and will take their genders as they come. If a woman who decided as a little girl that her ambition was to get married and raise children meets a man who made the same decision when he was little, then the offspring has a good start. Biological difficulties which arise here may make the child even more precious: if the woman has repeated miscarriages, or the man has a low sperm count so that impregnation is delayed through the years, then, as we have already noted, the infant may be regarded as a real miracle. On the other hand, the seventh girl in a row, or even the seventh boy, may be greeted with mixed feelings, and perhaps start life as a family joke.

从令人欣慰的角度来看，有些情况下，父母双方都渴望孩子，并且能够接受孩子的性别。如果一个从小就立志结婚生子的女孩，遇到一个同样从小就立志结婚生子的男人，那么他们的孩子就拥有一个美好的开端。而由此产生的生理困难，反而可能让孩子更加珍贵：如果女方反复流产，或者男方精子数量少，导致多年难以受孕，那么正如我们之前提到的，这个婴儿或许会被视为一个真正的奇迹。另一方面，如果连续生了第七个女孩，甚至是第七个男孩，则可能会引发复杂的情绪，甚至可能成为家庭中的一个笑柄。

D • Birth Position

D • 出生姿势

The most important factor here is the parents’ scripts. Does Jeder fit in, or is he the wrong sex, or badly timed? Does his father’s script call for a scholar, and he turns out to be, instead, a football player? Or vice versa? Does his mother’s script go along with his father’s, or is it opposite in this respect? There are also traditions that he will hear about from fairy tales and real life. The youngest of three sons is supposed to act stupid until the showdown comes, and then he wins over his brothers. If he happens to be the seventh son of a seventh son, he is almost compelled to be a prophet. More particularly, the parents’ scripts may call for them to be glorified or punished by one of their children, who must therefore turn out to be either a colossal success or a colossal failure. Often the first-born son is chosen for this honor. 14 If the mother’s script calls for her to be a spouseless invalid in her declining years, then one of the children must be raised from birth to stay and care for her, while the others must be taught to wander off and fill the role of ingrates. If the forty-year-old bachelor son or spinster daughter decides to break the script by moving out of the house, or worse, by getting married, the mother will respond, understandably and pitiably, by having severe attacks of illness. The scripty nature of such setups is demonstrated by the frequent switch whereby mother ‘unexpectedly’ wills the bulk of her money to the ingrates, cutting off the devoted one with a pittance.

这里最重要的因素是父母的剧本。杰德是否符合他们的期望？他的性别是否不符？或者他出生的时机是否不对？他父亲的剧本期望他成为一名学者，而他却成了一名足球运动员？反之亦然？他母亲的剧本与父亲的剧本一致，还是恰恰相反？他还会从童话故事和现实生活中听到一些传统。三兄弟中最小的那个，应该在决战到来之前装傻充愣，然后赢得兄弟们的认可。如果他恰好是第七个儿子的第七个儿子，他几乎注定要成为一位先知。更具体地说，父母的剧本可能要求他们通过某个孩子来荣耀或惩罚自己，因此，这个孩子最终要么会取得巨大的成功，要么会彻底失败。通常，长子会被选中承担这项重任。如果母亲的剧本设定是晚年孤苦伶仃、卧病在床，那么子女中必须有一个从出生起就留下来照顾她，而其他子女则必须被教导离家出走，扮演忘恩负义的角色。如果四十岁的单身儿子或未婚女儿决定打破剧本，搬出家门，或者更糟的是，结婚，那么母亲的反应——可以理解，也令人同情——就是患上严重的疾病。这种安排的剧本性体现在经常出现的转变上：母亲“出人意料地”将大部分财产遗赠给忘恩负义的子女，只给忠心耿耿的子女留下一点点。

The general rule is that, other things being equal, children will follow their parents’ script regarding family constellation, and this is best shown by taking the simplest factors: number and spacing of children. (The sex of the children cannot be considered, since that is still beyond the parents’ control – fortunately, since that is one way that scripts are broken up from generation to generation, so that some children, at least, get a new chance.) A careful inquiry among a number of families will reveal a surprising number of ‘coincidences’ in this respect.

一般来说，在其他条件相同的情况下，子女会遵循父母在家庭结构方面的既定模式，这一点可以通过最简单的因素来体现：子女的数量和间隔。（子女的性别暂不考虑，因为这仍然超出父母的控制范围——幸运的是，这也是家庭结构模式代代相传、打破常规的一种方式，至少能让一些孩子获得新的机会。）仔细调查多个家庭，就会发现这方面存在着许多令人惊讶的“巧合”。

Figure 5 shows such a scripty family tree. There were three boys in the Able family: Cal, Hal, and Val. When Val was born, Hal was four and Cal was six, so that their spacing is 0–4–6. Their father, Don, was the oldest of three children spaced 0–5–7. Their mother, Fan, was the oldest of three girls spaced 0–4–5. Her two sisters, Nan and Pan, also had three children each. Fan’s mother was the older of two girls spaced 0–6, with a miscarriage in between. It can be seen that all of these threesomes were spaced within five to seven fertile years. 15

图 5 展示了这样一棵手写体家谱树。艾布尔家有三个男孩：卡尔、哈尔和瓦尔。瓦尔出生时，哈尔四岁，卡尔六岁，因此他们的年龄间隔为 0-4-6。他们的父亲唐是家中三个孩子中的老大，年龄间隔为 0-5-7。他们的母亲范是家中三个女儿中的老大，年龄间隔为 0-4-5。她的两个姐妹南和潘也各自育有三个孩子。范的母亲是家中两个女儿中的老大，年龄间隔为 0-6，中间有一次流产。可以看出，所有这些三胞胎的出生间隔都在五到七年的生育年龄范围内。

This type of family tree shows how some people tend to follow their parents’ example in family planning as far as number and spacing of offspring are concerned. Let us consider some of the possible ‘script directives’ that might have come from Gramp and Granny to Don and Fan in this particular case.

这种类型的家谱表明，有些人倾向于在子女的数量和生育间隔方面效仿父母的生育模式。让我们来探讨一下，在这个特定的案例中，爷爷奶奶可能对唐和范下了哪些“指示”。

a. ‘When you grow up, have three children, and then you are free to do as you please.’ This is the most flexible, and involves no hurry or constraint. Fear of ‘script failure’ and loss of mother’s love can occur only if Fan approaches menopause without having produced the required three offspring. But note that Fan is not free until she has the third child. This is an ‘Until’ script.

a.“等你长大后，生三个孩子，你就可以随心所欲了。”这是最灵活的方案，不涉及任何仓促或限制。只有当范在更年期临近时仍未生育三个孩子，她才会担心“剧本失败”和失去母爱。但请注意，范只有在生下第三个孩子后才能真正自由。这是一个“直到”剧本。

b. ‘When you grow up, have at least three children.’ There is no constraint here, but there may be a sense of hurry, particularly if Gramp or Granny make jokes about Don and Fan’s fertility. This is an ‘Open End’ script, since Fan is free to have as many children as she likes after the third.

b.“等你长大了，至少要生三个孩子。”这里并没有硬性规定，但可能会给人一种紧迫感，尤其当爷爷奶奶拿唐和范的生育能力开玩笑时。这是一个“开放式结局”的剧本，因为范在生完第三个孩子后，想生多少就生多少。

c. ‘When you grow up, have no more than three children.’ There is no hurry, but there is constraint, and Don and Fan may be uneasy about further pregnancies after the three children are born. This is an ‘After’ script, since it implies that there will be trouble if there are any children after the third.

c.“等你长大了，最多只能生三个孩子。”虽然不着急，但确实有所顾虑，唐和范在生完三个孩子后，或许会对再次怀孕感到不安。这是一句“之后”的台词，暗示着如果第三个孩子之后还有孩子，就会出现问题。

FIGURE 5

图 5

Now let us consider Fan’s point of view if she should have a fourth child, Pedwar, under any of these directives. (a) means ‘The first three children belong to Granny, and must be brought up her way.’ Pedwar then becomes Fan’s very own boy, and he may or may not be brought up the same as Cal, Hal, and Val. Fan can use her own autonomy with him, and he may grow up to be more free and autonomous than the others. Fan may treat him as she did her Raggedy Ann doll. Raggedy Ann was her own very special doll to love as she pleased when she was little, while her other dolls had to be cared for Granny’s way. In other words, Raggedy Ann may have prepared a ‘script slot’ for Pedwar which Fan could fill after she had done her duty by Granny. (b) is similar to (a) except that Granny has more hold over Pedwar than under plan (a) because he may be considered an extra bonus granted by Granny, rather than a free choice. Under (c) Pedwar is in trouble because Fan has disobeyed Granny in having him; he must therefore be raised as an ‘unwanted’ child, defiantly, uneasily, or guiltily. In such a case, if our working principle is correct, the people around him will remark again and again how different he is from his three older brothers.

现在让我们从范的角度来考虑，如果她按照这些指示中的任何一条生下第四个孩子佩德瓦尔，她会作何感想。(a) 意味着“前三个孩子属于奶奶，必须按照奶奶的方式抚养”。佩德瓦尔就成了范的亲生儿子，他的抚养方式可能与卡尔、哈尔和瓦尔相同，也可能不同。范可以自主地抚养他，他长大后可能会比其他孩子更加自由和独立。范可能会像对待她的拉格迪·安娃娃那样对待他。拉格迪·安是她小时候非常特别的娃娃，可以随心所欲地爱护，而她的其他娃娃则必须按照奶奶的方式照顾。换句话说，拉格迪·安可能为佩德瓦尔预留了一个“角色”，范在履行了对奶奶的义务之后，就可以把这个角色赋予他。(b) 与 (a) 类似，只是奶奶对佩德瓦尔的控制权比方案 (a) 更大，因为他可能被视为奶奶额外赐予的礼物，而不是自由选择的结果。在(c)中，佩德瓦尔陷入困境，因为范违背了奶奶的意愿生下了他；因此，他必须被当作一个“不受欢迎的”孩子抚养，这让他感到叛逆、不安或愧疚。在这种情况下，如果我们的工作原则正确，他周围的人会反复注意到他与他的三个哥哥有多么不同。

The next item to consider is the games parents play about the size of their families. For example, Ginnie was the oldest of eleven children, and her mother, Nanny, complained that the last five were unwanted. The naive assumption would be that Ginnie would be programed to have six children, but that was not so. She was programed to have eleven children and complain that the last five were unwanted. In that way she would be able to play ‘There I Go Again,’ ‘Harried,’ and ‘Frigid Woman’ in her later years, just as her mother did. In fact, this example can be used as a test of psychological sophistication. Given the question: ‘A woman had eleven children and complained that five of them were unwanted. How many children will her oldest daughter most probably have?’ the script analyst would answer ‘Eleven.’ People who answer ‘Six’ will have difficulty in understanding and predicting human reactions, since this answer assumes that important behavior, like trivial behavior, is ‘rationally’ motivated, which is not so. It is usually decided by the Parental directives of the script.

接下来要考虑的是父母们围绕家庭规模玩的游戏。例如，吉妮是家中十一个孩子中的老大，她的母亲南妮抱怨说，最后五个孩子都是不受欢迎的。人们可能会天真地认为，吉妮会被设定为生六个孩子，但事实并非如此。她被设定为生十一个孩子，并抱怨最后五个孩子是不受欢迎的。这样，她晚年就能像她母亲一样，玩“我又来了”、“疲惫不堪”和“冷漠女人”的游戏了。实际上，这个例子可以用来检验心理学家的理解能力。假设问题：“一位母亲生了十一个孩子，并抱怨其中五个是不受欢迎的。她的大女儿最有可能生几个孩子？” 剧本分析家会回答“十一个”。回答“六个”的人则难以理解和预测人类的反应，因为这个答案假设重要的行为和琐碎的行为一样，都是出于“理性”动机，而事实并非如此。这通常由剧本中的父母指示决定。

In investigating this aspect, the parents of the patient are asked, first, how many brothers and sisters they each have; second, how many children they want to have; and third (since as any obstetrician knows, there is many a slip ’twixt the cup and the lip), how many they actually expect to have. If the parents understand how to distinguish correctly between their ego states, a great deal more information can be gained by asking the second and third questions in structural form: ‘How many children does your (Parent, Adult, Child) (want, expect) to have?’ This may bring out otherwise hidden conflicts among the three ego states, and between the two parents, which have an important bearing on the script directives they are giving the patient. An even more sophisticated version of this, with a corresponding increase in information gained (providing the parents are properly educated to understand the question), is to ask it in a twelve-barreled instead of a six-barreled form: ‘How many children does your (nurturing, controlling) Parent, Adult and (natural, adapted, rebellious) Child (want, expect) to have?’ 16

在调查这一方面时，首先要询问患者父母，他们各自有多少兄弟姐妹；其次，他们想要几个孩子；第三（因为任何产科医生都知道，计划赶不上变化），他们实际预期会生几个孩子。如果父母能够正确区分他们的自我状态，那么通过以结构化的方式询问第二和第三个问题，就能获得更多信息：“您（父母/成人/儿童）想要/预期生几个孩子？”这可能会揭示出三种自我状态之间以及父母双方之间原本隐藏的冲突，而这些冲突对他们给予患者的指导话语有着重要的影响。一个更复杂的版本，可以获得更多信息（前提是父母受过适当的教育，能够理解这个问题），就是用十二个问题而不是六个问题的形式来问：“你们（养育型、控制型）父母、成年子女和（天性、适应型、叛逆型）子女（想要、期望）生几个孩子？”

With the patient himself, the most profitable question to ask, since it is the one he is most likely to have the answer to, is: ‘What is your position in the family?’ followed by ‘When were you born?’ The exact birthdays of the next older and the next younger must be obtained so that the differences can be calculated in months, if the children came close together. If the speaker comes into a world which is already occupied by a sister or a brother, it will make a considerable difference in his script decisions whether that sibling is older by eleven months, thirty-six months, eleven years, or twenty years. This difference will depend not only on his relationship with that sibling, but also on his parents’ attitude toward that particular spacing of children. The same two considerations apply concerning the next born: it is important to know the speaker’s exact age – for example, eleven months, nineteen months, five years, or sixteen years, at the time the next child arrived on the scene. In general, all siblings born before the speaker reaches his seventh birthday will have a decisive influence on his script, and one of the important factors is the number of months’ difference in age between them, since as noted above, this will affect not only his own attitude but that of his parents as well. Notable variations occur if the speaker is a twin, or came before or after twins.

对患者本人而言，最有价值的问题是：“您在家庭中的地位是什么？”因为他最有可能回答这个问题。紧接着是“您是什么时候出生的？”。必须获得排行第二和排行第三的兄弟姐妹的确切生日，以便计算出年龄差（以月为单位），尤其是在孩子们出生时间相近的情况下。如果说话者出生时家中已有兄弟姐妹，那么兄弟姐妹比他大11个月、36个月、11岁还是20岁，都会对他的剧本选择产生显著影响。这种差异不仅取决于他与兄弟姐妹的关系，还取决于他父母对这种子女出生间隔的态度。对于下一个出生的孩子，也需要考虑同样的两个因素：重要的是要知道说话者在下一个孩子出生时的确切年龄——例如，11个月、19个月、5岁或16岁。一般来说，说话者七岁之前出生的所有兄弟姐妹都会对其语言风格产生决定性影响，其中一个重要因素是他们之间的年龄差（以月为单位），因为如上所述，这不仅会影响说话者自身的态度，还会影响其父母的态度。如果说话者是双胞胎，或者出生在双胞胎之前或之后，则会出现显著差异。

In some cases, where the patient is interested in astrology, meteorology, or hagiology, the exact date of his own birth will have a strong script significance. This is especially important if his parents had a similar interest in the calendar.

在某些情况下，如果患者对占星术、气象学或圣徒传记感兴趣，那么他/她的确切出生日期将具有重要的命理意义。如果他/她的父母也对历法感兴趣，这一点就尤为重要。

E • Birth Scripts

E • 出生脚本

Otto Rank believed that the circumstances of birth itself, the ‘birth trauma,’ are imprinted on the psyche of the infant and often reappear in symbolic form in later life, particularly as a desire to return to the blissful peace of the womb, as described by his disciple Fodor. 17 If that were so, the fears and longings which arise from passing under that arch through which no man can ever pass again, nature’s original one-way street, would certainly appear as important elements in the script. Perhaps they do, but there is no reliable way to check it, even by comparing Caesarean births with normal ones. Hence the influence of the ‘birth trauma’ on the life script remains in the realm of speculation. As a matter of fact, real-life scripts said to be based on the actual occurrence of Caesarean birth, like their theatrical counterparts, are unconvincing. As in Macbeth , the event is exploited as a mere play on words or a conundrum, a foetus ex machina , rather than forming the serious basis for a script. It is quite likely, however, that a child who is told later that he was a Caesarean birth, and can understand what that means, might incorporate that fact somehow into his script and elaborate upon it further when he learns who his distinguished predecessors were. A decision on this point awaits the collection of some good case histories.

奥托·兰克认为，出生时的境况，即“出生创伤”，会深深烙印在婴儿的心灵深处，并常常以象征性的形式在日后的生活中重现，尤其表现为渴望重返子宫的宁静祥和，正如他的弟子福多所描述的那样。如果真是如此，那么从那道无人能够再次通过的“拱门”（自然界最初的单行道）中产生的恐惧和渴望，无疑会成为人生剧本中的重要元素。或许它们确实如此，但即便通过比较剖腹产和自然分娩，也无法可靠地验证这一点。因此，“出生创伤”对人生剧本的影响仍然停留在推测的层面。事实上，那些声称基于真实剖腹产经历的人生剧本，就像戏剧中的剧本一样，都缺乏说服力。如同《麦克白》中那样，这一事件仅仅被当作一种文字游戏或谜题，一种“机械降神”式的情节，而非剧本的严肃基础。然而，一个孩子如果后来得知自己是剖腹产出生的，并且能够理解这意味着什么，那么他很可能会将这一事实融入到自己的剧本中，并在得知自己显赫的前辈是谁之后，进一步展开叙述。关于这一点，还需要收集一些合适的案例才能得出结论。

In practice, the two most common ‘birth scripts’ are the ‘Foundling Script’ and the ‘Torn Mother Script.’ The Foundling Script arises from the fantasies of adopted or even natural children about their ‘real’ parents, and comes out as some version of the Myth of the Birth of the Hero described by Otto Rank in his book of that name. 18 The Torn Mother Script is also common, and in my experience occurs with about equal frequency in both sexes. The foundation for this script is the mother telling the child that she has been sickly ever since he was born; or in a more vicious form, that she was so badly torn by his birth that she has never been the same. His reaction, and his script, is based on his own observations in the matter. If mother has indeed been invalided or crippled all his life, then he feels compelled to take the full responsibility, and no amount of Adult reasoning will convince his Child that it is not his doing. If the impairment is not visible, however, and particularly if someone in the family, such as the father, implies or states that her illness is a fake, then the patient’s script will be heavily loaded with ambiguity, hypocrisy, and exploitation. Sometimes the mother does not make the accusation, but leaves it to father, grandmother, or an aunt. The script which evolves is then a three-handed one, with important messages and announcements, usually ‘bad news,’ coming from a third party. It is easy to see that where the Foundling Script comes out as the Myth of the Birth of the Hero, the Torn Mother Script is the Myth of the Birth of the Villain, one saddled from birth with the horrendous crime of matricide, or, more precisely, matriclasty. ‘Mother died in childbirth (mine)’ is almost too much for anyone to bear without good help. If mother was injured or has a cystocele, it is never too late to have it repaired, and the less said about it the better.

实际上，最常见的两种“出生脚本”是“弃婴脚本”和“破碎母亲脚本”。弃婴脚本源于被收养的孩子，甚至是亲生孩子，对他们“亲生”父母的幻想，其表现形式类似于奥托·兰克在其同名著作中描述的“英雄诞生神话”。“破碎母亲脚本”也很常见，根据我的经验，男女发生的频率大致相同。这种脚本的基础是母亲告诉孩子，自从他出生以来，她就一直体弱多病；或者更恶毒地说，她因为生他而遭受了巨大的痛苦，从此一蹶不振。孩子的反应和脚本都基于他对这件事的观察。如果母亲真的一生体弱多病，那么孩子就会感到自己必须承担全部责任，无论成年人如何解释，都无法让孩子相信这不是自己的错。然而，如果这种缺陷并不明显，尤其是当家人（例如父亲）暗示或声称她的疾病是装的，那么患者的叙述就会充满暧昧、虚伪和利用。有时，母亲不会直接指责，而是将责任推给父亲、祖母或姑姨。这样一来，叙述就变成了三方参与，重要的信息和声明（通常是“坏消息”）都来自第三方。显而易见，弃婴的叙述是英雄诞生的神话，而破碎母亲的叙述则是恶人的诞生神话，她从出生起就背负着弑母（或更准确地说是弑母）的可怕罪行。“我的母亲死于难产”这句话，如果没有人能提供有效的帮助，几乎是任何人都难以承受的。如果母亲受伤或患有膀胱膨出，即使受伤也为时不晚，而且越少提及此事越好。

F • Forenames and Surnames

F • 名字和姓氏

Roger Price, in his book What Not To Name The Baby , lists some common American forenames and gives a one-sentence description of the kind of personality that goes with each. The uncanny accuracy, or at least plausibility of his descriptions are of great interest to script analysts. There is no doubt that in many cases given names, short names, and nicknames, or whatever praenomen is bestowed or inflicted on the innocent newborn, is a clear indication of where his parents want him to go; and he will have to struggle against such influences, which will be continued in other forms as well, if he is to break away from the obvious hint. 19 Names as script indicators are most likely to take hold in high school, where the boy or girl reads about famous namesakes in myth and history, or where his or her classmates bring home to them with more or less brutality the hidden meanings in their names. This is something parents have control over and should be able to foresee.

罗杰·普莱斯在他的著作《不该给孩子取什么名字》中列举了一些常见的美国名字，并用一句话描述了每个名字所对应的性格类型。他描述的惊人准确性，或者至少是合情合理性，引起了性格分析学家的极大兴趣。毫无疑问，在很多情况下，父母给新生儿取的名字，无论是正式名字、昵称还是其他任何形式的称谓，都清晰地表明了父母希望他将来成为什么样的人；如果他想要摆脱这种显而易见的暗示，就必须与这些影响作斗争，而这些影响还会以其他形式延续下去。名字作为性格指标最有可能在高中阶段形成，在那里，男孩或女孩会阅读神话和历史中与名人同名的故事，或者他们的同学会或多或少地直白地向他们揭示名字中隐藏的含义。这是父母可以控制并且应该能够预见的事情。

There are four ways in which a forename can become scripty: purposefully, accidentally, inadvertently, and inevitably.

名字变成手写体有四种方式：有意为之、无意中、无可避免地。

1. Purposeful . The name may be a very specialized one, such as Septimus S. (who became a professor of classical philosophy), Galen E. (who became a physician), fn1 Napoleon (who became a corporal), or Jesus, a common name in Central America. Or it may be a variant of a common name. Charles and Frederick were kings and emperors. A boy who is steadfastly called Charles or Frederick by his mother, and insists that his associates call him that, lives a different style of life from one who is commonly hailed as Chuck or Fred, while Charlie and Freddie are likely to be horses of still another color. Naming a boy after his father or a girl after her mother is usually a purposeful act on the part of the parents, and puts an obligation on the offspring which they may not care to fulfill, or may even actively rebel against, so that their whole life plan is permeated by a slight bitterness or an active resentment.

1. 有目的性。这个名字可能非常特殊，例如塞普蒂默斯·S（后来成为古典哲学教授）、盖伦·E（后来成为医生）、拿破仑（后来成为下士），或者耶稣——一个在中美洲很常见的名字。也可能是常见名字的变体。查尔斯和弗雷德里克都是国王和皇帝。一个被母亲坚定地称为查尔斯或弗雷德里克，并且坚持让同伴这样称呼他的男孩，其生活方式与那些通常被称作查克或弗雷德的男孩截然不同；而查理和弗雷迪则可能是完全不同的另一类人。给男孩取父亲的名字，或给女孩取母亲的名字，通常是父母有意为之，这给子女带来了一种他们可能并不愿意履行，甚至可能积极反抗的义务，以至于他们的整个人生规划都弥漫着一丝苦涩或怨恨。

2. Accidental . A girl called Durleen or Aspasia, and a boy called Marmaduke, may get along smoothly in one state or country or high school, but if their parents chance to move elsewhere, they may be made acutely conscious of their names and be forced to take a position about it. Similarly with a boy called Lynn or a girl named Tony.

2. 偶然因素。一个名叫杜琳（Durleen）或阿斯帕西亚（Aspasia）的女孩，一个名叫马默杜克（Marmaduke）的男孩，在一个州、一个国家或一所高中里可能相处融洽，但如果他们的父母碰巧搬到别的地方，他们可能会对自己的名字格外在意，并被迫对此做出选择。男孩名叫林恩（Lynn）或女孩名叫托尼（Tony）的情况也是如此。

3. Inadvertent . Pet names such as Bub, Sis, and Junior may not be intended to stick, but quite often they do, so that the person remains Bub, Sis, or Junior for life, willingly or unwillingly.

3. 无意中。像 Bub、Sis 和 Junior 这样的昵称可能并非有意为之，但往往会如此，以至于这个人一辈子都被称为 Bub、Sis 或 Junior，无论他是否愿意。

4. Inevitable . Surnames are a different matter, since the parents have little option but to pass on what they got from grandfather. There are many honorable European names which become obscenities in English; as one man morosely remarked: ‘I’m so lucky. I’ve got only one dirty word in my name.’ This was brought to his attention most clearly in high school, where he suffered not only the indignities bestowed on immigrants, but in addition offered a ready-made handle for ribaldry. But he felt that his name was no asset in the business world either. Some people in this predicament feel that they are cursed by their ancestors from birth to be losers. On the other hand, Christ is a not uncommon surname, and this also poses a script problem, albeit of a different kind, especially for church-going boys. It is no wonder that H. Head and W. R. Brain both became well-known neurologists.

4. 无可避免。姓氏的情况则有所不同，因为父母几乎别无选择，只能将祖父的姓氏传承下去。许多原本体面的欧洲姓氏在英语中却变成了不雅之词；正如一位男士沮丧地说道：“我真是太幸运了，我的名字里只有一个脏字。”他在高中时对此感受最为深刻，不仅遭受了移民所遭受的种种侮辱，还因为这个名字成了人们取笑的对象。但他觉得自己的名字在商界也毫无用处。一些身处这种困境的人感觉自己仿佛从出生起就被祖先诅咒，注定要失败。另一方面，Christ（基督）是一个并不罕见的姓氏，这也带来了书写上的难题，尽管与上述情况有所不同，尤其对于经常去教堂的男孩来说更是如此。难怪H. Head和W. R. Brain后来都成为了著名的神经学家。

Besides being asked ‘Who chose your name?’ and ‘Where does your surname come from?’ the patient should also be asked in every case: ‘Have you ever actually read your birth certificate?’ If he has not, he should be instructed to do so, or even better, bring it in for the therapist to see. About fifty per cent of people find surprises on their birth certificates when they read them carefully for the first time: omissions, misapprehensions, or information they were not aware of. Often the name on the certificate is different from what they have been called all their lives, much to their astonishment or chagrin. Almost all of these surprises will throw additional light on the scripts of the parents and the context of the patient’s birth.

除了询问“谁给你取的名字？”和“你的姓氏从何而来？”之外，还应该询问患者：“你真的看过你的出生证明吗？”如果没有，应该指导他阅读，或者更好的是，让他把出生证明带过来给治疗师看。大约有50%的人在第一次仔细阅读出生证明时会发现一些令人惊讶的内容：遗漏、误解或他们之前不知道的信息。通常，出生证明上的名字与他们从小到大一直被称呼的名字不同，这常常让他们感到惊讶或懊恼。几乎所有这些令人惊讶的内容都能帮助我们更好地理解父母的言辞以及患者的出生背景。

Notes & References

注释与参考文献

1 Witt, P. N. and Reed, C. F. ‘Spider-Web Building,’ Science 149:1190–1197, September 10, 1965.

1 Witt, P. N. 和 Reed, C. F.“蜘蛛网的构建”，《科学》149:1190–1197，1965 年 9 月 10 日。

2 Lorenz, K. Z. King Solomon’s Ring . Thomas Y. Crowell Company, New York, 1933.

2 Lorenz, K. Z. 所罗门王的戒指。Thomas Y. Crowell 公司，纽约，1933 年。

3 Bateson, G. ‘The Message “This is Play”’. In Group Processes: Transactions of the Second Conference . (Bertram Schaffner, ed.) Josiah Macy, Jr. Foundation, New York, 1956.

3 Bateson, G.“‘这就是游戏’的信息”。载于《群体过程：第二届会议论文集》（Bertram Schaffner 编辑）。Josiah Macy, Jr. 基金会，纽约，1956 年。

4 Zuckerman, S. Functional Affinities of Man, Monkeys, and Apes . Harcourt Brace & Company, New York, 1933.

4 Zuckerman, S. 人类、猴子和猿的功能亲和力。Harcourt Brace & Company，纽约，1933 年。

5 Simons, E. L. ‘Some Fallacies in the Study of Hominid Phylogeny.’ Science 141: 879–889, September 6, 1963.

5 Simons, E. L.“人类系统发育研究中的一些谬误。”《科学》141: 879–889，1963 年 9 月 6 日。

6 Cf. Freud, S. Moses and Monotheism , Alfred A. Knopf, New York, 1939.

6 参见弗洛伊德，《摩西与一神论》，阿尔弗雷德·A·克诺夫出版社，纽约，1939 年。

From the present point of view, this deals with the effect of Ikhnaton’s script on Moses’ script. In script language, it places Ikhnaton as the euhemerus or ‘grandparent’ of all Israelites, and their script follows his: his temples were destroyed and his followers persecuted or killed. The Israelis of today have the correct antithesis to this script, which is to employ the necessary hardware to avert the tragic ending.

从目前的角度来看，这探讨的是伊赫那顿的文字对摩西文字的影响。在文字语言中，伊赫那顿被视为所有以色列人的祖先，他们的文字也遵循他的文字：他的圣殿被摧毁，他的追随者遭到迫害或杀害。今天的以色列人拥有与此文字截然相反的正确做法，那就是采取必要的措施来避免悲剧的结局。

Amenhotep-haq-Uast’s other name (besides Ikhnaton) was Nefer-kheperu-Ra-ua-en-Ra, whose hieroglyphs roughly translate as ‘Take your lute and your scarab and enjoy the sun,’ while, according to the Ikhnaton cartouche, he has traded this in for a cake and a feather (Line Character #12 and Trees and Plants #33 in Holzhausen’s classification of hieroglyphs). This is like a modern, hippie, script switch, either way: people with guitars get a yen for cake, or people with cake turn it in for a guitar.

阿蒙霍特普·哈克·乌阿斯特（Amenhotep-haq-Uast）的另一个名字（除了伊赫那顿之外）是尼弗尔·赫佩鲁·拉·乌阿·恩·拉（Nefer-kheperu-Ra-ua-en-Ra），其象形文字大致翻译为“带上你的鲁特琴和圣甲虫，享受阳光吧”。然而，根据伊赫那顿的铭文，他却用这些东西换取了一块蛋糕和一根羽毛（霍尔茨豪森象形文字分类中的第12行字符和第33行树木植物）。这就像现代嬉皮士的文字转换，无论哪种方式：拥有吉他的人渴望蛋糕，或者拥有蛋糕的人用蛋糕换取吉他。

7 Jones, E. ‘The Phantasy of the Reversal of Generations.’ Papers on Psycho-Analysis , Fifth edition. Beacon Press, Boston, 1961. Here Jones describes the ‘grandfather complex,’ the desire of children to become the parents of their own parents, based on the belief that as they grow bigger their parents will grow smaller.

7 Jones, E.《世代逆转的幻想》。《精神分析论文集》，第五版。Beacon Press，波士顿，1961 年。Jones 在这里描述了“祖父情结”，即孩子们渴望成为自己父母的父母，这种渴望基于这样的信念：随着他们长大，他们的父母就会变小。

8 Abraham, K. ‘Some remarks on the role of grandparents in the psychology of neuroses.’ Clinical Papers and Essays on Psycho-Analysis . Basic Books, New York, 1955. What Abraham describes here is exactly what is meant by a ‘script fantasy,’ where the boy plans his life on a fairy-tale level.

8 Abraham, K.《关于祖父母在神经症心理学中的作用的一些评论》。《精神分析临床论文和论文集》。纽约：基础书籍出版社，1955 年。Abraham 在这里描述的正是“剧本幻想”的含义，男孩在这种幻想中按照童话故事的模式规划自己的人生。

9 Erikson, E. Childhood and Society. Loc. cit .

9 埃里克森，E.《童年与社会》。同上。

10 Berne, E. The Structure and Dynamics of Organizations and Groups. Loc. cit ., pp. 98–101.

10 Berne, E. 组织和群体的结构和动态。同上，第 98-101 页。

11 Helene Deutsch describes three types of ‘good grandmother’ and the dreaded ‘wicked grandmother,’ or witch, in her chapter on the climacterium in The Psychology of Women , Volume Two. Grune & Stratton, New York, 1945.

11 海伦·德意志在《女性心理学》第二卷中关于更年期的章节里描述了三种“好祖母”和可怕的“恶祖母”或女巫。格鲁内和斯特拉顿出版社，纽约，1945年。

12 Anthropologists, more than most other groups, are aware of the important influence of the grandparents on the child’s career, an influence which is not only clearly recognized, but also highly ritualized in small primitive societies, especially those which have totems. See, for example, Ashley-Montagu, M. F. Coming Into Being Among the Australian Aborigines . George Routledge & Sons, London, 1937, and Roheim, G. Psychoanalysis and Anthropology. Loc. cit .

12. 与其他大多数群体相比，人类学家更清楚地认识到祖父母对子女职业生涯的重要影响。这种影响不仅被明确认可，而且在小型原始社会中，尤其是在那些拥有图腾的社会中，还被高度仪式化。例如，参见 Ashley-Montagu, M. F.，《澳大利亚土著居民的形成》（Coming Into Being Among the Australian Aborigines），伦敦：George Routledge & Sons，1937 年；以及 Roheim, G.，《精神分析与人类学》（Psychoanalysis and Anthropology），同上。

13 O’Callaghan, S. The Slave Trade Today . (Including a debate in the House of Lords, Thursday, July 14, 1960.) Crown Publishers, Inc., New York, 1961.

13 O’Callaghan, S.《今日奴隶贸易》（包括1960年7月14日星期四在上议院的辩论）。纽约皇冠出版社，1961年。

14 There is a considerable body of literature about birth position. The first systematic study was probably F. Galton’s English Men of Science (1874). He found a preponderance of only sons and first-born sons in his population. Adler, on the other hand, in his paper on ‘The Family Constellation,’ states that ‘the youngest child is usually a peculiar type.’ ( Understanding Human Nature ) One of the most interesting discussions is that of W. D. Altus in Science 151:44–48, January 7, 1966. This was followed by a series of ‘Letters to the Editor,’ Science 152: 1177–1184, May 27, 1966.

14 关于出生位置的研究文献相当丰富。最早的系统性研究可能是F. Galton的《英国科学家》（1874年）。他发现，在他研究的人群中，独生子和长子占多数。另一方面，Adler在其论文《家庭星座》中指出，“最小的孩子通常是一种特殊的类型。”（《理解人性》）其中最有趣的讨论之一是W. D. Altus发表在1966年1月7日《科学》杂志151卷44-48页的文章。随后，他又发表了一系列“致编辑的信”，刊登在1966年5月27日《科学》杂志152卷1177-1184页。

15 It is difficult to get adequate census data to evaluate statistically the significance of the coincidences in the Able family. One set of figures, obtained by the President’s Research Committee on Social Trends (1933) is quoted by Pressey, S. L., Janney, J. E., & Kuhlen, R. G. in Life: A Psychological Survey (Harper & Brothers, New York, 1939). In metropolitan Chicago at that time, only 42 per 1000 families consisted of a husband, a wife, and three children, so that the probability of the occurrence of six such sets in collateral and direct ascendancy, which (except for the miscarriage) is the import of Figure 5 , is not great by chance alone. Excluding families with no children at all from the Chicago figures, the prevalence of the cited constellation rises to 90 per 1000, or about one in ten. On this basis, the crude probability that the family tree of Figure 5 is due to chance alone is therefore of the order of one in 10 6 , while the actual occurrence of similar improbabilities in my own patient population is about one in five. This indicates that we are dealing here with the influence of ‘information’ or programing, and it is just that kind of behavior programing that we are calling the ‘script.’ If we consider, in addition, the regular irregularity of the unusually short fertile periods in Figure 5 , this indication is strongly reinforced.

15. 很难获得足够的普查数据来对艾布尔家族的巧合进行统计评估。普雷西、詹尼和库伦在《生活：一项心理调查》（哈珀兄弟出版社，纽约，1939年）一书中引用了总统社会趋势研究委员会（1933年）的一组数据。当时在芝加哥都市区，每1000个家庭中只有42个是夫妻三人，因此，仅凭偶然因素，出现六组这样的旁系和直系长子/女的情况（图5所示，流产除外）的概率并不高。如果从芝加哥的数据中排除没有子女的家庭，上述家庭结构的出现率将上升到每1000个家庭90个，即大约十分之一。基于此，图 5 所示家谱纯属偶然的粗略概率约为十万分之一，而类似概率极低的情况在我自己的患者群体中实际发生的概率约为五分之一。这表明我们在此讨论的是“信息”或程序的影响，而我们称之为“脚本”的正是这种行为程序。此外，如果我们再考虑图 5 中异常短暂的排卵期的规律性不规则性，这一结论就得到了强有力的佐证。

16 This may seem far out, but students of family size are quite unable to come up with reliable projections by assuming a unified or ‘integrated’ personality. They use terms like ‘ideal,’ ‘desired,’ and ‘intended’ families in interviews. These roughly correspond to Parent, Child, and Adult ideas. But ‘many wives who said that they had not “really wanted” another child before the last conception also said … that if they could have just the number they wanted and then stop, they would have the same number they had and even more.’ The debate is whether ‘excess fertility’ can be equated with ‘unwanted’ pregnancies. But the transactional analyst knows that there are at least three different people in each person interviewed who may ‘want,’ ‘really want,’ or ‘not want’ more babies, and they may all feel differently about it, so questionnaires on this subject that do not take ego state into account are missing something of decisive importance. For a discussion of such questionnaires, see Barish, N. H. ‘Family Planning and Public Policy: Who is Misleading Whom?’ Science 165:1203–1204, September 19, 1969.

16 这或许听起来有些离谱，但研究家庭规模的学者们却无法通过假设人格统一或“整合”来做出可靠的预测。他们在访谈中使用“理想家庭”、“期望家庭”和“预期家庭”等词汇。这些词汇大致对应于父母、子女和成人的概念。但是，“许多妻子在上次怀孕前表示她们‘并不真正想要’另一个孩子，但她们也表示……如果她们可以只生自己想要的孩子数量，然后就停止生育，她们最终会拥有和现在一样多的孩子，甚至更多。”争论的焦点在于“生育过多”是否可以等同于“非意愿”怀孕。但人际沟通分析师知道，每个受访者身上至少存在三个不同的人格，他们可能“想要”、“非常想要”或“不想要”更多的孩子，而且每个人对此的感受可能都不相同。因此，如果关于这个主题的问卷调查没有考虑到自我状态，就会遗漏一些至关重要的信息。有关此类问卷的讨论，请参阅 Barish, N. H.《家庭计划与公共政策：谁在误导谁？》Science 165:1203–1204，1969 年 9 月 19 日。

17 Fodor, N. The Search for the Beloved . Hermitage Press, New York, 1949.

17 Fodor, N.《寻找挚爱》。纽约赫米蒂奇出版社，1949 年。

18 Rank, O. The Myth of the Birth of the Hero. Loc. cit .

18 Rank, O.英雄诞生的神话。同上。

19 Price, R. What Not To Name the Baby . New York, 1904. H. L. Mencken gives many revealing examples of ‘scripty’ names in The American Language , Alfred A. Knopf, New York (1919), 4th edition, 1949, Chapter 10, especially pp. 518 ff.

19 Price, R.《不要给婴儿取什么名字》。纽约，1904 年。H. L. Mencken 在《美国语言》中给出了许多“手写体”名字的启发性例子，Alfred A. Knopf，纽约（1919 年），第 4 版，1949 年，第 10 章，特别是第 518 页及后续页。

fn1 The current editor of Gray’s Anatomy is Charles Mayo Goss.

fn1 《格雷氏解剖学》的现任编辑是查尔斯·梅奥·戈斯。

#↩

CHAPTER FIVE

第五章

Early Developments

早期发展

A • Early Influences

A • 早期影响

The first script programing takes place during the nursing period, in the form of short protocols which can later be worked into complicated dramas. Usually these are two-handed scenes between the baby and his mother, with little interference from the onlookers, if any, and with such breastfed titles as ‘Public Performance,’ ‘It’s Not Time Yet,’ ‘Whenever You’re Ready,’ ‘Whenever I’m Ready,’ ‘Hurry Up,’ ‘He Who Bites Gets Brushed Off,’ ‘While Mother Smokes,’ ‘Pardon Me, the Phone Rang,’ ‘What’s He Fussing About?,’ ‘There’s Never Enough,’ ‘First One Then the Other,’ ‘He looks Pale,’ ‘Let Him Take His Time,’ ‘Isn’t He Amazing?,’ ‘Golden Moments of Love and Content,’ and ‘Lullaby.’

第一个剧本编程发生在哺乳期，以简短的指令形式出现，这些指令之后可以发展成复杂的戏剧。通常，这些是婴儿和母亲之间的双人场景，几乎没有旁观者的干扰，甚至没有。这些场景的标题也充满了母乳喂养的温馨感，例如“公开表演”、“还没到时间”、“你准备好了就来”、“我准备好了就来”、“快点”、“谁咬谁不挠”、“妈妈抽烟的时候”、“不好意思，电话响了”、“他在闹什么？”、“永远都不够”、“先一个，再一个”、“他脸色苍白”、“让他慢慢来”、“他真棒！”、“充满爱与满足的黄金时刻”以及“摇篮曲”。

Slightly more complicated are the corresponding bathroom scenes in the same families: ‘Come and See How Cute,’ ‘It’s Time Now,’ ‘Are You Ready,’ ‘You Can Just Sit There Till You Do,’ ‘Hurry Up,’ ‘Naughty Naughty,’ ‘While Mother Smokes,’ ‘While Mother Is on the Telephone,’ ‘Enema Tube,’ ‘If You Don’t I’ll Give You Castor Oil,’ ‘Here’s Your Laxative,’ ‘You’ll Get Sick If You Don’t,’ ‘Let Him Do It His Own Way,’ ‘That’s a Good Boy,’ ‘That’s a G-o-o-d Boy,’ and ‘I’ll Sing While You’re Doing It.’ Three-handed protocols are more frequent at this stage, including: ‘I Told You He Wasn’t Ready,’ ‘Don’t Let Him Get Away With That,’ ‘I’ll Make Him Do It,’ ‘You Try,’ ‘You’re Disturbing Him,’ ‘Why Don’t You … Yes, But,’ and ‘He’s Sure Coming Through This Time.’ The Phantom in the Bathroom, who will some day be the Phantom in the Bedroom, may begin to appear: ‘Dr Spock Says,’ ‘Tessie Had Hers Trained by the Time,’ and ‘Sister Mary Was Only.’ In later life these will become ‘Freud Says,’ ‘Nancy Always Has One,’ and ‘Helen Has It Every Night.’

稍微复杂一些的是同一家庭中相应的浴室场景：“快来看他多可爱”、“时间到了”、“准备好了吗”、“你就坐在那儿等着”、“快点”、“淘气鬼”、“趁妈妈抽烟的时候”、“趁妈妈打电话的时候”、“灌肠管”、“如果你不配合我就给你蓖麻油”、“这是你的泻药”、“如果你不配合你会生病的”、“让他按自己的方式来”、“真乖”、“真是个好孩子”、“我会唱歌给你听”。在这个阶段，三人配合的指令也更常见，包括：“我早就说过他还没准备好”、“别让他得逞”、“我会让他配合”、“你试试”。 “你在打扰他了”，“你为什么不……是的，但是”，以及“他这次肯定能挺过去”。浴室里的幽灵，总有一天会变成卧室里的幽灵，可能会开始出现：“斯波克医生说”，“泰西早就训练好了”，以及“玛丽修女只是”。晚年，这些会变成“弗洛伊德说”，“南希总是有一个”，以及“海伦每晚都有”。

It is already fairly predictable who the winners and the losers will be. ‘Isn’t He Amazing?’ reinforced two years later with ‘That’s a Good Boy’ will usually do better than ‘What’s He Fussing About?’ reinforced one year later by ‘Enema Tube’; similarly, ‘Lullaby,’ first at nursing and later in the bathroom, will probably prevail over ‘While Mother Smokes.’ Already the feeling of OKness or not-OKness, which separates the now and future princes from the now and future frogs, is being implanted, and several types of frogs and princes (or for the ladies, goose girls and princesses) are being set up. ‘Isn’t He Amazing?’, the Forever Prince with the success script, is often but not always the first-born. The Conditional Prince, ‘Come and See How Cute,’ or ‘Hurry Up,’ for example, can remain a prince as long as he stays cute or hurries up. The Conditional Frogs, ‘He Who Bites,’ ‘Naughty Naughty,’ or ‘He Looks Pale, Needs a Laxative,’ can stop being frogs by not biting or not looking pale; the Doomed Frogs, on the other hand, will hardly ever make it with anybody. Touching are the frogs who try not to care ‘While Mother Smokes’ or ‘Has a Highball.’ Only a disaster can turn the Forever Princes into frogs; only a miracle can transform the Doomed Frogs into princes.

谁会赢谁会输，其实已经相当容易预测了。“他真棒！”两年后加上“真乖！”通常比“他怎么闹？”一年后加上“灌肠管”效果更好；同样，“摇篮曲”，先是在哺乳时说，后来在卫生间里说，可能比“妈妈抽烟的时候”更受欢迎。这种“好”或“不好”的感觉，区分了现在和未来的王子与现在和未来的青蛙，已经被植入其中，几种类型的青蛙和王子（或者对女士来说，是鹅女和公主）正在形成。“他真棒！”，这个拥有成功剧本的“永远的王子”，通常（但不总是）是第一个被选中的。“有条件的王子”，比如“快来看他多可爱！”或“快点！”，只要他保持可爱或快点，就能一直被称为王子。那些条件蛙，比如“咬人的那只”、“淘气鬼”或“脸色苍白，需要泻药”，只要不咬人或不脸色苍白，就能摆脱青蛙的身份；而那些注定失败的青蛙，几乎永远无法与任何人建立关系。那些试图对“妈妈抽烟时”或“喝着高球酒”漠不关心的青蛙，令人感动。只有灾难才能让永远的王子变成青蛙；只有奇迹才能让注定失败的青蛙变成王子。

B • Convictions and Decisions

B • 信念与决定

By the time he gets to ‘I Guess I’d Better Drive You, Dear’ or ‘Getcher Ass Outa Bed’ or even ‘I’ll Beatcher Goddam Brains Out If You Don’t,’ the child already has certain convictions about himself and the people around him, especially his parents. These convictions are likely to stay with him the rest of his life, and may be summarized as follows: (1) I’m OK, or; (2) I’m not-OK; (3) You’re OK or; (4) You’re not-OK. On the basis of these he makes his life decision. ‘It’s a good world, some day I’ll make it a better one’ – through science, service, poetry, or music. ‘It’s a bad world, someday I’ll kill myself’ – or kill someone else, go crazy, or withdraw. Perhaps it’s a mediocre world, where you do what you have to do and have fun in between; or a tough world, where you make good by putting on a white collar and shuffling other people’s papers; or a hard world, where you sweep or bend or deal, or wiggle or fight for a living; or a dreary world, where you sit in a bar hoping; or a futile world, where you give up.

当他唱到“我想我最好开车送你，亲爱的”、“赶紧起床”甚至是“你要是不起床，我就揍扁你”的时候，孩子已经对自己和周围的人，尤其是父母，形成了某种信念。这些信念很可能会伴随他一生，可以概括为以下几点：（1）我很好，或者；（2）我不好；（3）你很好，或者；（4）你不好。基于这些信念，他会做出人生选择。“这是一个美好的世界，总有一天我会让它变得更美好”——通过科学、服务、诗歌或音乐。“这是一个糟糕的世界，总有一天我会自杀”——或者杀人、发疯、或者隐居。也许这是一个平庸的世界，你得做你该做的事，并在间隙找点乐子；或者，这是一个残酷的世界，你穿上白领衬衫，整理别人的文件，以此谋生；或者，这是一个艰辛的世界，你为了生存，不得不扫地、弯腰、交易、扭打或争斗；或者，这是一个沉闷的世界，你只能坐在酒吧里空想；或者，这是一个徒劳的世界，你只能放弃。

C • Positions – The Pronouns

C • 位置 – 代词

Whatever the decision is, it can be justified by taking a position based on the now deeply ingrained convictions, a position which involves a view of the whole world and all the people in it, who are either friends or enemies: ‘I’ll kill myself because it’s a lousy world where I’m no good and neither is anyone else, my friends are not much better than my enemies.’ In position language this reads ‘I’m not-OK, You’re not-OK, They’re not-OK. Who wouldn’t kill himself under such conditions?’ This is a futility suicide. Alternatively, ‘I’ll kill myself because I’m not-OK and everybody else is OK’ – the melancholic suicide. (Suicide here can mean anything from jumping off a bridge or car-crashing, to overeating or alcoholism.) Or ‘I’ll kill them or turn them out because I’m OK and they are very not-OK.’ Or ‘Since we’re all OK, I and you both, let’s get the job done and then go out and have some fun.’

无论做出何种决定，都可以用根深蒂固的信念来为其辩护。这种信念包含着对整个世界及其所有的人的看法，这些人要么是朋友，要么是敌人：“我要自杀，因为这是一个糟糕的世界，我一无是处，其他人也一样，我的朋友也好不到哪里去。”用立场语言来说，就是“我不好，你不好，他们都不好。在这种情况下，谁不想自杀呢？”这是一种徒劳的自杀。或者，“我要自杀，因为我不好，而其他人都很好”——这是一种忧郁的自杀。 （这里的自杀可以指跳桥、车祸、暴饮暴食或酗酒等任何行为。）或者“我要杀了他们或者把他们赶出去，因为我没事，而他们非常不好。”或者“既然我们都没事，你我都行，那就把事情办完，然后出去玩玩吧。”

‘But,’ says someone, ‘I know we’re OK, but those other fellows aren’t so hot.’ ‘Very well, then, I’m OK, you’re OK, and they are not-OK, so let’s get the job done now and we’ll attend to them later.’ In child language, this translates as ‘We’re going to play house, but you can’t play with us,’ which in its most extreme form and with more sophisticated equipment can be parlayed in later years into an extermination camp.

“但是，”有人说，“我知道我们没事，但那些家伙就不好说了。”“好吧，那我没事，你也没事，他们就不好说了，所以我们先把事情办完，以后再管他们。”用孩子的语言来说，这相当于“我们要玩过家家，但你们不能和我们一起玩”，而这种玩法如果发展到极端，再加上更先进的手段，长大后就可能演变成一个种族灭绝营。

The simplest positions are two-handed, You and I, and come from the convictions which have been fed to the child with his mother’s milk. Writing as shorthand + for OK and – for not-OK, the convictions read: I + or I –; You + or You –. The possible assortments of these give the four basic positions from which games and scripts are played, and which program the person so that he has something to say after he says Hello.

最简单的姿势是双手并用，即“你”和“我”，源于孩子从小就被灌输的观念。如果用简写符号“+”表示“可以”，“-”表示“不可以”，那么这些观念可以写成：“我+”或“我-”；“你+”或“你-”。这些词语的各种组合构成了四种基本姿势，游戏和剧本都以此为基础展开，并引导人们在说“你好”之后有话可说。

1. I + You +. This is the ‘healthy’ position (or in treatment, the ‘get well’ one), the best one for decent living, the position of genuine heroes and princes, and heroines and princesses. People in the other positions have more or less frog in them, a losing streak put there by their parents, which will drag them down again and again unless they overcome it; in extreme cases they will waste themselves if they are not rescued by a miracle of psychiatric or self-healing. I + You + is what the hippies were trying to tell the policeman when they gave him a flower. But whether the I + is genuine or merely a pious hope, and whether the policeman will accept the + or will prefer to be – on this particular scene, is always in doubt. I + You + is something the person either grows into in early life, or must learn by hard labor thereafter; it cannot be attained merely by an act of will.

1. 我+你+。这是“健康”的状态（或者在治疗中，是“康复”的状态），是体面生活的最佳状态，是真正英雄、王子、女英雄和公主的状态。处于其他状态的人或多或少都有些“青蛙”的特质，这是父母灌输给他们的失败基因，除非他们克服它，否则它会一次又一次地拖垮他们；在极端情况下，如果他们得不到精神治疗或自我疗愈的奇迹拯救，他们就会自我毁灭。嬉皮士送给警察一朵花时，他们试图传达的就是“我+你+”的信息。但是，这个“我+”究竟是真诚的，还是仅仅是一种虔诚的希望，以及警察是否会接受这个“+”，或者更愿意保持现状——在这个特定的场景中——始终是个未知数。“我+你+”的状态要么是人在早年生活中逐渐培养出来的，要么是之后必须通过艰苦的努力才能习得的；它不能仅仅依靠意志力就能获得。

2. I + You –. I’m a prince, you’re a frog. This is the ‘get rid of’ position. These are the people who play ‘Blemish’ as a pastime, a game, or a deadly procedure. They are the ones who sneer at their spouses, send their children to juvenile hall, and fire their friends and retainers. They start crusades and sometimes wars, and sit in groups finding fault with their real or imagined inferiors or enemies. This is the ‘arrogant’ position, at worst a killer’s, and at best a meddler’s for people who make it their business to help the ‘not-OK others’ with things they don’t want to be helped with. But for the most part it is a position of mediocrities, and clinically it is paranoid.

2. 我+你——我是王子，你是青蛙。这是“清除”的立场。这些人把“挑剔”当成消遣、游戏，甚至是致命的手段。他们会嘲笑配偶，把孩子送进少年管教所，解雇朋友和助手。他们发动十字军东征，有时甚至发动战争，聚在一起挑剔自己真实或想象中的下属或敌人。这是“傲慢”的立场，往坏了说是杀人犯的立场，往好了说是爱管闲事的人的立场，他们热衷于帮助那些“不正常的人”处理他们不想被帮助的事情。但大多数情况下，这是一种平庸者的立场，从临床角度来说，这是一种偏执的立场。

3. I – You +. This is psychologically the ‘depressive’ position, politically and socially a self-abasement transmitted to the children. Occupationally, it leads people to live by choice on favors large and small and enjoy it with a vengeance, that being the poor satisfaction of making the other pay as much as possible for his OK stamp. These are melancholic suicides, losers who call themselves gamblers, people who get rid of themselves instead of others by isolating themselves in obscure rooming houses or canyons or by getting a ticket to prison or the psychiatric ward. It is the position of the ‘If Onlys’ and ‘I Should Haves.’

3. 我 – 你 +。这是一种心理上的“抑郁”状态，在政治和社会层面上是一种会传递给孩子的自我贬低。在职业层面上，它导致人们选择依靠大大小小的恩惠生活，并乐在其中，这种乐此不疲的满足感来自于让对方为他们的“好”付出尽可能多的代价。这些人是忧郁的自杀者，是自称赌徒的失败者，他们选择逃避自己而不是他人，把自己孤立在偏僻的旅馆或峡谷里，或者干脆锒铛入狱或送进精神病院。这是一种“如果当初……”和“我本该……”的状态。

4. I – You –. This is the ‘futility’ position of the Why Notters: Why not kill yourself, Why not go crazy. Clinically, it is schizoid or schizophrenic. 1

4. 我 – 你 –。这是“为什么不”者的“徒劳”立场：为什么不自杀？为什么不发疯？临床上，这是一种分裂型人格或精神分裂症。

These positions are universal among all mankind, because all mankind nurses at his mother’s breast or bottle and gets the message there, and later has it reinforced when he learns his manners, whether in the jungle, the slum, the condominium, or the ancestral halls. Even in the small unlettered communities which anthropologists study for their ‘cultures,’ where everyone is raised according to the same long-established rules, there are enough individual differences between mothers (and fathers) to yield the standard harvest. For winners, there are chiefs and medicine men, captains and capitalists who own a thousand head of cattle or are worth a hundred thousand yams. The losers can be found in the mental hospital at Papeete or Port Moresby or Dakar, or perhaps in Her Majesty’s Gaol at Suva. For each position already carries with it its own kind of script and its own kinds of endings. Even in this country, where there are ten thousand ‘cultures,’ there are only a few endings, none different, really, from any other country’s.

这些地位在全人类中是普遍存在的，因为全人类都从小就吮吸母乳或奶瓶，从中汲取信息，并在日后学习礼仪的过程中不断强化，无论是在丛林、贫民窟、公寓楼还是祖堂。即使在人类学家研究其“文化”的小型文盲社群中，尽管每个人都按照同样的古老规则长大，但母亲（和父亲）之间的个体差异仍然足以产生标准的结局。对于成功者而言，有酋长和巫医，有船长和资本家，他们拥有上千头牛或价值十万个山药。失败者则可能在帕皮提、莫尔兹比港或达喀尔的精神病院，或者苏瓦的女王陛下监狱里。因为每一种地位都自带其独特的剧本和结局。即使在这个拥有上万种“文化”的国家，结局也只有几种，而且实际上与其他任何国家的结局都没有太大区别。

Because each person is the product of a million different moments, a thousand states of mind, a hundred adventures, and usually two different parents, a thorough investigation of his position will reveal many complexities and apparent contradictions. Nevertheless, there can usually be detected one basic position, sincere or insincere, inflexible or insecure, on which his life is staked, and from which he plays out his games and script. This is necessary so that he can feel that he has both feet on solid ground, and he will be as loath to give it up as he would the foundation of his house. To take one simple example, a woman who thinks it very important that she is poor while others are rich (I – They +) will not give this up merely because she acquires a lot of money. That does not make her rich in her own estimation; it merely makes her a poor person who happens to have some assets. Her classmate who thinks it is important to be rich in contrast to the underprivileged poor (I + They –) will not abandon her position if she loses her money; this does not make her a poor person, but merely a rich person who is temporarily embarrassed financially.

因为每个人都是无数个瞬间、无数种心境、无数次冒险经历的产物，而且通常还来自两位不同的父母，所以深入探究一个人的立场会揭示出许多复杂性和明显的矛盾之处。然而，通常都能发现一个基本的立场，无论真诚与否，固执与否，他的生命都建立在这个立场之上，并以此为基础展开他的人生游戏和剧本。这是必要的，因为他需要这种立场才能感到自己脚踏实地，他会像舍弃房屋地基一样舍不得放弃它。举个简单的例子，一个认为自己贫穷而别人富有的女人（我-他们+）不会仅仅因为获得了大量金钱就放弃这种立场。在她看来，这并不能让她变得富有；这仅仅让她成为一个碰巧拥有一些资产的穷人。而她的同学，如果认为自己富有而与贫困潦倒的人形成对比（我+他们-），即使失去了金钱，也不会放弃自己的立场；这并不意味着她是个穷人，而只是一个暂时在经济上感到尴尬的富人。

This tenacity, as we shall see later, accounts for the life led by Cinderella after she married her prince, and it also accounts for the fact that men in the first position (I + You +) make good leaders, for even in utmost adversity they maintain their universal respect for themselves and those in their charge. Thus the four basic positions, (1) I + You + (success); (2) I + You – (arrogant); (3) I – You + (depressive); and (4) I – You – (futility), can rarely be changed by external circumstances alone. Stable changes must come from within, either spontaneously or under some sort of ‘therapeutic’ influence: professional treatment, or love, which is nature’s psychotherapy.

正如我们稍后将看到的，这种韧性解释了灰姑娘嫁给王子后的生活，也解释了为什么处于第一位置（我+你+）的男性往往能成为优秀的领导者，因为即使在最大的逆境中，他们也能保持对自身和下属的普遍尊重。因此，四种基本位置——（1）我+你+（成功）；（2）我+你-（傲慢）；（3）我-你+（抑郁）；以及（4）我-你-（徒劳）——很少能仅靠外部环境改变。稳定的改变必须来自内心，要么是自发的，要么是在某种“疗愈”因素的影响下发生的：例如专业治疗，或者爱——自然的心理疗法。

But there are those whose convictions lack conviction, so that they have options and alternations between one position and another; from I + You + to I – You –, or from I + You – to I – You +, for example. These are, as far as position is concerned, insecure or unstable personalities. Secure or stable ones are those whose positions, good or deplorable, cannot be shaken. In order for the idea of positions to be of any practical use, it must not be defeated by the changes and instabilities of the insecure. The transactional approach – finding out what was actually said and done at a certain moment – takes care of that. If A behaves at noon as though he were in the first position (I + You +), then we say that ‘A is in the first position.’ If he behaves at 6:00 P.M. as though he were in the third position (I – You +), then we say ‘In the noon setup A is in the first position and under 6:00 P.M. circumstances he is in the third.’ From this we can conclude (1) that A is insecure in the first position, and (2) that if he has symptoms they occur under special conditions. If he behaves under all circumstances as though he were in the first position, then we say that ‘A is stable in the first position,’ from which we predict (1) that A is a winner, (2) that if he has been in treatment, he is now cured, and (3) that he is game free, or at least that he is not under a compulsion to play games, but has social control – the option of deciding for himself at each moment whether or not he wants to play. If B behaves under all circumstances as though he were in the fourth position, we say that ‘B is stable in the fourth position’ from which we predict (1) that B is a loser, (2) that it will be difficult to cure him, and (3) that he will be unable to stop himself from playing those games which prove that life is futile. All this is done by careful analysis of actual transactions engaged in by A and B.

但有些人缺乏坚定的信念，因此他们会在不同的立场之间摇摆不定；例如，从“我+你+”到“我-你-”，或者从“我+你-”到“我-你+”。就立场而言，这些人属于不安全或不稳定的人。而那些立场坚定或稳定的人，无论立场好坏，都不会动摇。为了使立场的概念具有任何实际意义，它不能被不安全者的立场变化和不稳定性所破坏。交易式方法——即探究在特定时刻实际说了什么、做了什么——可以解决这个问题。如果A在中午时分表现得像处于第一立场（我+你+），那么我们就说“A处于第一立场”。如果他在下午6点时表现得像处于第三立场（我-你+），那么我们就说“在中午时分，A处于第一立场；而在下午6点时分，A处于第三立场”。在某些情况下，他处于第三位置。由此我们可以得出以下结论：（1）A 处于第一位置时缺乏安全感；（2）如果他出现症状，这些症状会在特定条件下出现。如果他在任何情况下都表现得如同处于第一位置，那么我们说“A 处于第一位置且稳定”，由此我们可以预测：（1）A 是赢家；（2）如果他接受过治疗，那么他现在已经痊愈；（3）他不再沉迷于游戏，或者至少他没有被迫参与游戏，而是拥有社会控制权——他可以随时自主决定是否参与游戏。如果 B 在任何情况下都表现得如同处于第四位置，那么我们说“B 处于第四位置且稳定”，由此我们可以预测：（1）B 是输家；（2）治愈他将十分困难；（3）他将无法停止参与那些证明人生毫无意义的游戏。所有这些都是通过仔细分析 A 和 B 的实际交易行为得出的。

Once the predictions are made, they are easily tested by more observation. If later behavior does not confirm them, then either the analysis was faulty or the theory of positions is wrong and will have to be changed. If it does confirm the predictions, then the theory is strengthened. The evidence so far supports it.

一旦做出预测，就可以通过更多观察轻松验证。如果后续行为与预测不符，那么要么是分析有误，要么是位置理论本身有误，需要修正。如果后续行为与预测相符，则理论得到加强。目前的证据支持这一理论。

D • Winners and Losers

D • 赢家和输家

In order to verify predictions, it is necessary to define success, that is, winners and losers. A winner is someone who succeeds in what he says he is going to do. A loser is someone who fails to accomplish what he sets out to do. A man who says: ‘I’m going to Reno and gamble,’ is only committed to getting there and betting, regardless of whether he wins or loses. If he says: ‘I’m going to Reno and this time I’m going to win,’ then he comes out a winner if he wins and a loser if he doesn’t, depending upon how much money he has in his pockets when he gets back on the pavement. A woman who gets a divorce is not a loser unless she has said ‘I will never get a divorce.’ If she has declared: ‘Some day I’m going to quit my job and I’ll never work again,’ then her alimony will signify that she is a winner, because she has accomplished what she set out to do. Since she made no statement as to how she would do it, no one can fault her with being a loser.

为了验证预测，必须先定义成功，也就是区分赢家和输家。赢家是指实现了自己承诺的事情的人。输家是指未能完成自己设定目标的人。一个人如果说：“我要去里诺赌博”，那么他只承诺到达那里并下注，无论输赢。如果他说：“我要去里诺，这次我一定要赢”，那么他赢了就是赢家，输了就是输家，这取决于他回到赌场时口袋里有多少钱。一个离婚的女人并非输家，除非她曾说过“我永远不会离婚”。如果她宣称：“总有一天我会辞职，再也不工作了”，那么她获得的赡养费就意味着她是赢家，因为她实现了自己的目标。既然她没有说明她将如何做到这一点，那么就没有人能指责她是失败者。

E • Three-handed Positions

E • 三手姿势

So far we have dealt mainly with two-handed positions, ‘I’ and ‘You.’ But the idea of position is like an accordion, and can expand enough to include a vast assortment of attitudes besides the basic four, almost as many different ones as there are people in the world. Thus, if we move on to consider three-handed positions, we have the following combinations:

到目前为止，我们主要讨论的是双手姿势，即“我”和“你”。但姿势的概念就像手风琴一样，可以无限扩展，除了基本的四种姿势之外，还可以包含种类繁多的姿态，几乎和世界上的人口数量一样多。因此，如果我们继续考虑三手姿势，就会有以下几种组合：

1a. I + You + They +. This is the democratic community position of a neighborly family, a sort of ideal to be striven for in the eyes of many people, stated as ‘We love everybody.’

1a. 我 + 你 + 他们 +。这是邻里家庭的民主共同体立场，是许多人眼中值得追求的理想，表述为“我们爱每个人”。

1b. I + You + They –. This is the prejudiced snob- or gang-position of a demagogue, stated as ‘Who needs them?’

1b. 我 + 你 + 他们——。这是煽动者带有偏见的势利眼或团伙立场，他们会说：“谁需要他们？”

2a. I + You – They +. This is the position of the agitator or malcontent, and sometimes of missionaries of various kinds. ‘You people here are no good compared to the ones over there.’

2a. 我+你-他们+。这是煽动者或不满者的立场，有时也是各种传教士的立场。“你们这里的人跟那边的人比起来差远了。”

2b. I + You – They –. This is the position of the solitary, self-righteous critic, the arrogant position in pure form. ‘Everybody must bow before me and be as much like me as inferior people can.’

2b. 我 + 你 – 他们 –。这是孤立自以为是的批评家的立场，是纯粹的傲慢立场。“每个人都必须向我俯首称臣，并且尽可能地像我一样，哪怕是低人一等的人。”

3a. I – You + They +. This is the self-punishing saint or masochist, the melancholic position in pure form. ‘I am the most unworthy person in the world.’

3a. 我 – 你 + 他们 +。这是自我惩罚的圣人或受虐狂，是纯粹的忧郁姿态。“我是世界上最不配的人。”

3b. I – You + They –. This is the servile position of people who choose to work for gratuities out of snobbishness rather than necessity. ‘I abased myself and you rewarded me well, not like those other inferior ones.’

3b. 我 – 你 + 他们 –。这是一种奴性地位，指的是那些出于势利而非必要而选择为报酬而工作的人。“我卑躬屈膝，你却给了我丰厚的回报，不像那些低贱的人。”

4a. I – You – They +. This is the position of servile envy, and sometimes of political action. ‘They hate us because we are not as well off.’

4a. 我 – 你 – 他们 +。这是一种奴性嫉妒的立场，有时也是一种政治行动。“他们恨我们，因为我们不如他们富裕。”

4b. I – You – They –. This is the pessimistic position of cynics or of those who believe in predestination and original sin. ‘We are none of us any good anywhere.’

4b. 我 – 你 – 他们 –。这是愤世嫉俗者或相信预定论和原罪之人的悲观立场。“我们无论在何处都毫无用处。”

There are also three-handed positions which are insecure, and some which are flexible and give the other fellow a chance. For example:

也有一些三人姿势不太稳固，而有些则比较灵活，能给另一位参与者机会。例如：

1? I + You + They ? This is an evangelistic position. ‘I and you are OK, but we don’t know about them until they show their credentials or come over to our side.’

1？我+你+他们？这是一种传福音的立场。“我和你没问题，但我们对他们一无所知，直到他们出示资历或加入我们这边。”

2? I + You ? They –. This is an aristocratic class position. ‘Most other people are no good, but as for you, I’ll wait until I see your credentials.’

2？我+你？他们——。这是一种贵族阶级的立场。“其他人大多都不行，但至于你，我会等到看到你的资历再说。”

Thus we have four two-handed positions and eight three-handed ones, twelve in all, with a mathematical possibility of an equal number of flexible ones with one ?, six more with two ?? (I + You ? They ?, I – You ? They ?, etc.) and one with three ???, the last a person who would find it difficult to function in relation to other people. This gives a total of thirty-one possible types, quite enough to make life interesting. This variety is enormously multiplied when we start to consider the meanings of the +s and –s, which stand, we remember, for OK and not-OK. Here we are immediately confronted with pairs of good-bad adjectives, qualities or combinations which were emphasized in the family, and which fill out the formulas and give them real-life meanings.

因此，我们有四种双手姿势和八种三手姿势，总共十二种。此外，还有数量相同的灵活姿势，其中一种带有一个问号（?），另外六种带有两个问号（??）（例如“我+你-他们？”、“我-你-他们？”等等），还有一种带有三个问号（???），最后一种情况的人可能难以与他人相处。这样总共就有三十一种可能的类型，足以让生活充满乐趣。当我们开始考虑加号和减号（+s 和 -s）的含义时，这种多样性会成倍增加。我们记得，它们分别代表“可以”和“不可以”。在这里，我们立刻会遇到一些好坏形容词、品质或组合，这些形容词、品质或组合在家庭中被强调，它们丰富了公式，并赋予它们现实生活中的含义。

F • Positions – The Predicates

F • 位置 – 谓词

The simplest positions, the most difficult to deal with, and the most dangerous for society, are those which are based on a single pair of OK-not-OK adjectives: Black-White, Rich-Poor, Christian-Pagan, Bright-Stupid, Jew-Aryan, Honest-Crooked. Each of these pairs can be sorted in four ways, any one of which may be emphasized in a given family and set for life by early training. Thus, the Rich-Poor polarity sorts into four variants, depending on parental attitudes.

最简单的立场，最难处理，也对社会最危险，都基于一对简单的“可以接受”或“不可以接受”的形容词：黑人-白人、富人-穷人、基督徒-异教徒、聪明人-愚笨人、犹太人-雅利安人、诚实人-奸诈人。每对形容词都可以分为四种类型，任何一种都可能在特定的家庭中被强调，并通过早期教育而终身定型。因此，贫富二元论根据父母的态度可以分为四种变体。

1. I Rich = OK, You Poor = not-OK. (Snobbish, Supercilious)

1. 我富有=没问题，你贫穷=不行。（势利眼，傲慢自大）

2. I Rich = not-OK, You Poor = OK (Rebellious, Romantic)

2. 我富有 = 不行，你贫穷 = 可以（叛逆，浪漫）

3. I Poor = OK, You Rich = not-OK (Resentful, Revolutionary)

3. 我穷 = 没问题，你富有 = 不行（心怀怨恨，具有革命精神）

4. I Poor = not-OK, You Rich = OK (Snobbish, Servile)

4. 我穷 = 不行，你有钱 = 可以（势利，谄媚）

(In a family where money is not a decisive standard, then Rich-Poor is not a polarity, and the above schedule does not apply.)

（在一个金钱并非决定性标准的家庭中，贫富并非截然对立的两极，上述情况也不适用。）

The more adjectives included in each + and –, the more complex and flexible the position becomes, and the more intelligence and discrimination is required to deal with it securely. Sets of adjectives may be added together for emphasis (not only, but also), subtracted from each other for softening (but at least he also), weighed for fairness (but which is more important?), and so on. Thus to some black people, Rich Crooked White may be very not-OK (he’s all bad – – –) compared to Rich Crooked Black (at least he’s Black – – +), or to Rich Honest White (at least he’s honest – + –), or to Poor Crooked White (at least he’s poor like us + – –). But in some cases, Crooked White may be worst of all if he is Poor, but tolerable if he is Rich. This is because of the intrusion of another pair: Gets Away with it +, Doesn’t Get Away with it –. In this case, Poor Crooked White gets – – –, while Rich Crooked White gets + – –. In other cases, there may be a condition, as when Rich White (the Finance Company) may be OK unless he’s Crooked, and then he is shifted to not-OK (+ + + → + + –).

每个加号和减号中包含的形容词越多，情况就越复杂、越灵活，也就越需要智慧和辨别力才能妥善处理。形容词组可以组合在一起以强调（不仅如此，而且），也可以相互减去以缓和语气（但至少他也如此），还可以权衡以求公平（但哪个更重要？），等等。因此，对一些黑人来说，富有的奸诈白人可能非常糟糕（他一无是处——），相比之下，富有的奸诈黑人（至少他是黑人——+），或者富有的诚实白人（至少他诚实——+——），或者贫穷的奸诈白人（至少他和我们一样贫穷——+——）。但在某些情况下，如果奸诈白人很穷，他可能是最糟糕的，但如果他很富有，他就可以容忍。这是因为另一对形容词的介入：逍遥法外+，没能逍遥法外-。在这种情况下，可怜的歪曲白人得到 - - -，而富有的歪曲白人得到 + - -。在其他情况下，可能存在某种条件，例如，富有的白人（金融公司）可能原本没问题，除非他很歪曲，一旦他歪曲了，他的状态就会变为不正常（+ + + → + + -）。

It appears that his particular selection of pronouns, I, You, and They, + or – or ?, determines the ultimate fate of the individual, including the end of his script, regardless of what adjectives or predicates he uses for + and –. Thus I + You – They – (2b) will almost always end up alone, perhaps in a hermitage, prison, state hospital, or morgue, no matter what he is supercilious about: religion, money, race, sex, etc., while I – You + They + (3a) will nearly always end up feeling miserable and perhaps suicidal no matter what particular qualities he feels unworthy about. Hence the pronouns decide the ending of the script, the winners and the losers. The predicates decide what the script will be about, the life style: religion, money, race, sex, etc., but have nothing to do with the outcome.

看来，他选择的代词——我、你、他们，以及加号、减号或问号——决定了个人的最终命运，包括他人生剧本的结局，而与他为加号和减号使用的形容词或谓语无关。因此，“我+你-他们-”（2b）几乎总是以孤独告终，或许身处隐居处、监狱、州立医院或停尸房，无论他傲慢于什么：宗教、金钱、种族、性别等等；而“我-你+他们+”（3a）几乎总是以痛苦不堪甚至自杀告终，无论他觉得自己不配拥有什么特质。因此，代词决定了剧本的结局，决定了赢家和输家。谓语决定了剧本的内容，决定了生活方式：宗教、金钱、种族、性别等等，但与结局无关。

It must be admitted that there is nothing in all this so far which cannot be understood by a six-year-old child, at least as far as it applies to himself. ‘My mommy says I’m not supposed to play with you because you’re (dirty, common, bad, Catholic, Jewish, Italian, Irish, etc.),’ is simply I + You –. ‘I’ll play with you but I don’t want to play with him because he cheats’ is I + You + He –, to which the excluded one responds: ‘I wouldn’t play with you guys anyway because you’re sissies,’ = I + You – He –. It takes a great deal of sophistication, however – more than most people have – to understand the key principle of positions: the pronouns and the signs (+ –) are the only things that count; the predicates or adjectives are just there for convenience in structuring time. The predicates merely give people something to talk about after they say Hello, but have no bearing on what is going to happen, how well or badly their lives will be conducted, or what their final payoffs will be.

必须承认，到目前为止，所有这些内容对于一个六岁的孩子来说都是可以理解的，至少就他自身而言是如此。“妈妈说我不应该和你玩，因为你（脏兮兮的、俗气的、坏的、天主教徒、犹太人、意大利人、爱尔兰人等等）”，这其实就是“我+你-”。“我会和你玩，但我不想和他玩，因为他作弊”，这其实是“我+你+他-”，被排除在外的一方会回应：“反正我也不会和你们玩，因为你们都是娘娘腔”，这其实是“我+你-他-”。然而，要理解位置的关键原则，则需要相当的理解力——远超大多数人的理解力：代词和符号（+-）才是最重要的；谓语或形容词只是为了方便构建时间结构而存在的。这些谓语只是让人们在打招呼之后有话可说，但与将要发生的事情、他们的生活会过得好还是坏，或者他们最终的回报如何，都没有任何关系。

For example, many people are unable to understand how ardent Nazi policemen in East Germany could become equally ardent Communist policemen, since the two parties seem directly opposed. But all that is opposed are adjectives. The Nazi position was I + (Nazi), He – (Traitor), therefore, kill him. The Communist position is I + (Communist), He – (Traitor), therefore, kill him. In both cases, although the predicates are contrary, the position is the same: I + He –, therefore, kill him. The rule is that a change in predicates, no matter how radical, does not change the position, or the script: in both cases, the person will end up a killer, and that is what is important to him, not what kind of people he kills. For this reason nothing is easier then for a fanatic, under proper guidance, to change sides.

例如，许多人无法理解东德那些狂热的纳粹警察怎么会变成同样狂热的共产主义警察，因为这两个党派看起来截然对立。但实际上，对立的仅仅是形容词。纳粹的立场是：我+（纳粹），他-（叛徒），因此，杀了他。共产主义的立场是：我+（共产主义者），他-（叛徒），因此，杀了他。在这两种情况下，尽管谓词相反，但立场却是一样的：我+他-，因此，杀了他。规律是，谓词的改变，无论多么剧烈，都不会改变立场或剧本：无论哪种情况，最终都会成为杀人犯，而对他来说重要的是杀人，而不是杀的是什么样的人。正因如此，对于一个狂热分子来说，在适当的引导下，改变立场是再容易不过的了。

This example also illustrates the fact that positions are very important in everyday social encounters. The first things people sense about each other are their positions, and here, for the most part, like attracts like. People who think well of themselves and the world (+ +) usually prefer to be with others of their kind, rather than with people who are going to complain. People who feel superior (+ –) also like to congregate together in clubs and organizations. And if misery loves company, then people who feel inferior (– +) will also get together, usually in not-OK bars. The ones who feel futile (– –) gather in coffeehouses or on the street to deride the squares. In Western countries, clothing indicates like position even more clearly than it does social position. + + dresses neatly but not gaudily; + – likes uniforms, decorations, jewels, and special designs which flaunt his or her superiority; – + is threadbare or negligent, but not necessarily sloppy, or he may wear an ‘inferior’ uniform; while – – tends to wear a ‘fuck you’ uniform which shows his disdain of clothes and all that they stand for. The schizophrenic uniform, which combines threadbare with elegant, lumpy with svelte, purple with gray, the scuffed shoes with the diamond ring, falls into this class.

这个例子也说明了身份在日常社交中的重要性。人们首先感知到的就是彼此的身份，而且在大多数情况下，物以类聚。那些自视甚高、对世界充满自信的人（++）通常更喜欢和同类人在一起，而不是和那些爱抱怨的人在一起。那些感觉优越的人（--）也喜欢聚集在俱乐部和组织里。如果说痛苦的人喜欢找伴，那么那些感到自卑的人（-+）也会聚在一起，通常是在一些不太好的酒吧里。那些感到无力的人（--）则聚集在咖啡馆或街头，嘲笑那些自以为是的人。在西方国家，穿着打扮比社会地位更能体现一个人的身份。++穿着整洁但不浮夸；+-喜欢制服、装饰品、珠宝和特殊的设计来炫耀自己的优越感；-+衣着破旧或邋遢，但不一定邋遢，或者他可能穿着“低人一等”的制服。而——则倾向于穿着一种“去你的”式制服，这体现了他对服装及其所代表的一切的蔑视。这种精神分裂式的制服，将破旧与优雅、臃肿与苗条、紫色与灰色、磨损的皮鞋与钻戒混搭在一起，就属于此类。

We have already mentioned the tenacity with which people cling to their positions when circumstances change – the rich woman who does not become poor if she loses her money, but remains a rich person who is merely embarrassed financially; or even more poignant, the poor girl who gets a lot of money, but does not thereby become rich. This fixity of position can come out in everyday life in a way that is exasperating and confusing: ‘I’m a good person (in spite of the fact that I do bad things).’ Someone who takes this position expects to be treated at all times as though he were good, and feels insulted if he is regarded otherwise.

我们之前已经提到过，当环境发生变化时，人们往往会固执地坚持自己的立场——比如，一位富婆即使失去财富也不会变穷，她依然是富人，只是在经济上感到尴尬；又比如，一位贫穷的女孩虽然得到了很多钱，却并没有因此变得富有。这种固执己见在日常生活中会以一种令人恼火和困惑的方式表现出来：“我是一个好人（尽管我做了坏事）”。抱持这种观点的人期望自己始终被当作好人看待，如果受到非议，他们会感到受到了侮辱。

This is a common source of marital strife. Thus Marty Collins insists that he is a good husband in spite of the fact that he beats his wife every Saturday night when he is drunk. What is even more astounding is that his wife, Scottie, supports him, with the famous protest: ‘How can you be mad at a man who sent you flowers last Christmas?’ On the other hand, Scottie is firmly convinced that she is a completely honest person, even though she lies openly and steals money from her husband’s wallet. And he supports her in her position during the week. It is only on Saturday night that she calls him a bum and he calls her a liar. Since the marriage is based on a bilateral contract to overlook the discrepancies, each of them is indignant when the lapses are brought up, and if the threat to the OK position is too great, a divorce will result. The divorce happens because (1) one spouse can’t stand being exposed, or (2) the other spouse can’t stand the bald-faced lying that is necessary to avoid exposure.

这是婚姻冲突的常见根源。马蒂·柯林斯坚称自己是个好丈夫，尽管他每个星期六晚上喝醉后都会殴打妻子。更令人震惊的是，他的妻子斯科蒂竟然支持他，还提出了那句著名的抗议：“你怎么能生一个去年圣诞节送你花的男人的气呢？”另一方面，斯科蒂坚信自己是个完全诚实的人，尽管她公然撒谎，还偷丈夫钱包里的钱。而且，马蒂在工作日也支持她。只有到了星期六晚上，她才会骂他是个混蛋，他才会骂她是个骗子。由于他们的婚姻建立在双方都同意忽略彼此差异的基础上，所以当这些缺点被提及时，他们都会感到愤慨。如果这种“还算不错”的状态受到太大威胁，最终就会走向离婚。离婚的原因有二：(1)一方配偶无法忍受被揭穿，(2)另一方配偶无法忍受为了避免被揭穿而不得不撒的弥天大谎。

G • Selection of the Script

G • 剧本选择

The next step in the development of the script is to find a plot with the proper ending, an answer to the question: ‘What happens to someone like me?’ The child knows, because he is so taught, whether he is going to be a winner or a loser, how he is supposed to feel about other people, and how other people are going to treat him, and that is what is meant by ‘someone like me.’ Sooner or later he hears a story about ‘someone like me,’ and that tells him what he is headed for. It may be a fairy tale read to him by his mother, an African Nancy story told to him by his grandmother, or a street-gang legend he hears on the corner. But wherever he hears it, when he hears it he knows it, and he says: ‘That’s me!’ That story will then be his script and he will spend the rest of his life trying to make it come to pass.

剧本创作的下一步是找到一个合适的结局，一个能够回答“像我这样的人会怎么样？”这个问题的故事。孩子从小就被灌输这样的观念：他是会成功还是会失败，他应该如何看待他人，他人又会如何对待他。这就是“像我这样的人”的含义。他迟早会听到一个关于“像我这样的人”的故事，这个故事会告诉他自己的未来走向。这可能是母亲给他讲的童话故事，祖母给他讲的非洲南希的故事，或者是他在街角听到的街头帮派传说。但无论他在哪里听到这个故事，只要听到，他就知道，他会说：“那就是我！” 这个故事就成了他的剧本，他将用余生去努力让它成为现实。

Thus, on the basis of early experience with the breast or the bottle, in the bathroom or outhouse, in the bedroom and kitchen and living room, the child acquires his convictions, makes his decision, and takes his position. Then from what he hears and reads, he chooses a prediction and a plan: how he will go about being a winner or a loser, on what grounds, and what the payoff will be; and that is the first clear version of his lifelong script. We are now ready to consider various forces and elements from which the script is constructed. In order to accomplish this he has to have a script apparatus to work with.

因此，基于早期在母乳或奶瓶喂养、在浴室或厕所、在卧室、厨房和客厅等场所的经历，孩子形成信念，做出决定，并确立立场。然后，根据他所听到和读到的内容，他选择一种预测和计划：他将如何成为赢家或输家，依据是什么，以及回报是什么；这就是他终身剧本的第一个清晰版本。现在，我们可以开始探讨构成这一剧本的各种力量和要素。为了完成这项工作，他必须拥有一个可供使用的剧本机制。

References

参考

1 See Berne, E. ‘Classification of Positions.’ Transactional Analysis Bulletin 1:23, July 1962, and Principles of Group Treatment. Loc. cit. , pp. 269–277. Compare Harris, T. I’m OK – You’re OK, A Practical Guide to Transactional Analysis. Harper & Row, New York, 1969. Harris, however, numbers the positions in a different order. Our 1 is his 4, our 2 his 3, our 3 his 1, and our 4 his 2: 4-3-1-2.

1 参见 Berne, E.，《位置分类》，载《人际沟通分析公报》1:23，1962 年 7 月，以及《团体治疗原则》，同上，第 269-277 页。另见 Harris, T.，《我很好——你也很好：人际沟通分析实用指南》，哈珀-罗出版社，纽约，1969 年。然而，Harris 对位置的编号顺序不同。我们的 1 是他的 4，我们的 2 是他的 3，我们的 3 是他的 1，我们的 4 是他的 2：4-3-1-2。

#↩

CHAPTER SIX

第六章

The Plastic Years

塑料年代

A • Parental Programing

A • 家长指导

By the time he is six, our typical human being has left kindergarten (in America at least), and is pushed into the more competitive world of first grade. There he will be on his own to deal with teachers and the other boys and girls. Fortunately by this time he is no longer a babe, thrust helpless into a world he never made. From the little suburb of his home, he ventures into the great metropolis of the bustling school with whole sets of social responses ready to offer the various kinds of people around him. His mind is all wired up with his own ways of getting along, or at least of surviving, and his life plan has already been made. This was well known to priests and teachers of the Middle Ages, who said: ‘Give me a child until he is six, and you can have him thereafter.’ A good kindergarten teacher can even predict what the outcome will be, and what kind of life the child will have: happy or unhappy, winning or losing.

到了六岁，我们通常意义上的孩子（至少在美国是这样）就离开了幼儿园，进入了竞争更加激烈的小学一年级。在那里，他将独自面对老师和其他同学。幸运的是，此时的他不再是懵懂无知的婴儿，不再被推入一个他从未创造过的世界。他从家附近的小郊区走进熙熙攘攘的学校这座大都市，已经准备好应对周围形形色色的人。他的大脑里早已构建起一套与人相处，或者至少是生存之道，他的人生规划也早已制定完毕。中世纪的牧师和教师们对此深有体会，他们常说：“把孩子给我，直到他六岁，之后就归你了。”一位优秀的幼儿园老师甚至可以预测孩子未来的命运：快乐或不幸，成功或失败。

Thus the comedy or tragedy of each human life is that it is planned by an urchin of pre-school age, who has a very limited knowledge of the world and its ways, and whose heart is filled mainly with stuff put there by his parents. Yet this wonder child is precisely who determines in the long run what will happen to kings and peasants and whores and queens. He has no way to tell the facts from the delusions, and the most everyday events are distorted. He is told that if he has sex before marriage he will be punished and that if he has sex after marriage he will not be punished. He believes that the sun sets, and it takes him ten or forty years to discover that he is running away from the sun; and he confuses his belly with his stomach. He is much too young to be deciding much beyond what he wants for dinner, but he is the Emperor of Life who determines how each person will die.

因此，每个人的人生喜剧或悲剧在于，它是由一个学龄前孩童策划的，他对世界及其运行规律知之甚少，他的内心也主要被父母灌输的观念所占据。然而，正是这个神奇的孩子，最终决定了国王、农民、妓女和王后的命运。他无法分辨事实与幻想，最日常的事件在他眼中都被扭曲了。他被告知，婚前性行为会受到惩罚，婚后性行为则不会受到惩罚。他相信太阳会落山，却要花十年或四十年才能发现自己是在逃离太阳；他把肚子和胃混淆了。他年纪尚小，除了晚餐吃什么之外，根本无暇顾及其他，但他却是生命的主宰，决定着每个人的死亡方式。

The plan he makes for the eternal future is drawn to the family specification. Some of the key ones can often be uncovered very quickly, perhaps in the first interview, by asking: ‘What did your parents tell you when you were very little?’ or ‘What did your parents tell you about life when you were little?’ or ‘What did your parents say to you when they were angry?’ Often the answer will not sound like a directive, but with a little Martian thinking it can be stated in that form.

他为永恒未来制定的计划是根据家庭的具体情况量身定制的。一些关键信息往往可以很快挖掘出来，或许在第一次访谈中就能通过询问以下问题获得：“你小时候父母跟你说过什么？”或者“你小时候父母跟你讲过关于人生的什么道理？”或者“你父母生气的时候会跟你说什么？”答案通常听起来不像指令，但只要稍加思考，就能用指令的形式表达出来。

For example, many of the training slogans mentioned at the beginning of Chapter Five are actually parental commands. ‘Public Performance’ is, in effect, a command to show off. The child soon learns that by observing his mother’s pleasure when he does and her disappointment when he fails to do so.
