(1) The olfactory area of the rabbit contains 100,000,000 olfactory cells, each with six or twelve hairs, so that the olfactory receptor area is equal to the total skin area of the animal. 10 (2) It can be presumed that electrical discharges occur in the olfactory system long after adaptation to a given odor occurs; that is, although the odor can no longer be smelled, it continues to affect the electrical activity of the nervous system. The experimental evidence for this is not decisive, but is strongly suggestive. 11 (3) Smells can affect dreams without being perceived as smells. (4) The perfumes most sexually provocative to human beings are chemically related to the sex hormones. (5) The odor of the breath and of the sweat can change with a change in emotional attitude. (6) The olfactory nerves lead into the rhinencephalon, a ‘primitive’ part of the brain which is probably heavily involved in emotional reactions.

关于这一点，有几点需要注意。(1) 兔子的嗅觉区域包含1亿个嗅觉细胞，每个细胞有6到12根毛发，因此嗅觉受体的面积等于兔子的皮肤总面积。(2) 可以推测，即使在适应某种气味之后，嗅觉系统中仍会发生放电活动；也就是说，即使无法再闻到这种气味，它仍然会影响神经系统的电活动。这方面的实验证据尚不充分，但具有很强的提示性。(3) 气味可以影响梦境，即使人们无法感知到气味。(4) 对人类最具性刺激性的香水在化学成分上与性激素相关。(5) 呼吸和汗液的气味会随着情绪的变化而变化。 （6）嗅神经通向嗅脑，嗅脑是大脑中一个“原始”的部分，可能与情绪反应密切相关。

The hypothesis here then would be: the human being is continually stimulated by a variety of subtle chemical stimuli of which he is not aware, but which affect his emotional responses and his behavior toward various people in various situations. While there may be special (so far unknown) receptors for this, the structure of the olfactory tract itself is sufficient to deal with these effects. Such stimuli can be called odorless smells. There is no firm evidence that odorless smells actually exist; but if they did exist, they would conveniently account for many behavioral phenomena and responses which are otherwise difficult or impossible to understand in the present state of our knowledge. Their influence on the script would be durable, as in the case of fascination, fetishism, and imprinting. Newborn kittens may ‘smell’ their mother’s teats without being ‘aware’ of it, and the ‘memory’ of this odorless smell, or something like it, evidently affects their behavior for the rest of their lives.

因此，这里的假设是：人类持续受到各种微妙化学刺激的影响，而这些刺激本身却不为人知，却会影响其情绪反应以及在不同情境下对不同人群的行为。虽然可能存在一些特殊的（目前尚未发现的）受体来接收这些刺激，但嗅觉系统本身的结构足以应对这些影响。这类刺激可以被称为无味气味。目前尚无确凿证据表明无味气味确实存在；但如果它们真的存在，就能很好地解释许多在我们现有认知水平下难以理解甚至无法理解的行为现象和反应。它们对行为模式的影响是持久的，例如迷恋、恋物癖和印刻行为。新生小猫可能在不知不觉中“闻到”母猫的乳头，而这种无味气味或类似气味的“记忆”显然会影响它们终生的行为。

E • The Reach-back and the After-burn

E • 后退和余燃

The reach-back and the after-burn are similar to transactional ‘rackets’ in that they are developed mainly, although not entirely, under instructions from the parents. They differ from rackets because they are triggered internally rather than by specific stimuli from other people.

“回溯”和“后燃效应”与交易性“骗局”类似，它们主要（但不完全）是在父母的指导下形成的。它们与骗局的不同之处在于，它们的触发因素是内在的，而不是来自他人的特定刺激。

Reach-back is defined as that period of time during which an impending event begins to have an independent influence on the individual’s behavior. It is most dramatically seen in people with phobias, whose whole functioning may be disturbed for days ahead at the prospect of getting into a feared situation, such as a medical examination or a journey. Actually, however, phobic reach-back is less damaging than the reach-backs of everyday life, which may in the long run (I think) result in ‘psychosomatic’ physical diseases.

“预感期”指的是即将发生的事件开始对个体行为产生独立影响的那段时间。恐惧症患者最能明显地表现出这种现象，他们一想到要面对恐惧的情境，例如体检或旅行，就会在接下来的几天里完全无法正常生活。然而，实际上，恐惧症引起的“预感期”比日常生活中的“预感期”危害要小，后者从长远来看（我认为）可能会导致“心身”疾病。

In Dr Q’s case, when he had to give a professional lecture on Tuesday in a distant city, reach-back began when the impending trip started to interfere with his everyday activities. The preceding Thursday, he lay awake for a while planning what he had to do before he left. To make up for the lost working days, he would have to go to the office on Saturday, which day he usually took off. He made a mental list of the things he would have to take care of on Friday, such as picking up his tickets, since that was the last business day before he took the plane on Monday. Friday’s schedule was slightly disturbed by the errands he had to do, and his appointments with his patients were not as relaxed or as productive as usual because he had to prepare them for his absence. Friday night at home was not as relaxed as usual either because he had to go to bed earlier than was his custom in order to get up earlier than he usually did on Saturday. Saturday evening was slightly off because he had not had his usual weekend exercise nor seen his family that day, and he was also distracted by plans for packing on the morrow. Although making an outline for the lecture itself would take less than fifteen minutes, he was preoccupied with that during Saturday’s dinner. Sunday afternoon he spent at the beach, but this was not as relaxing as usual because he had to get home early to pack, which disturbed his peaceful Sunday evening. On Monday he took the airplane and that night he went to bed early at his hotel. Tuesday morning he gave the lecture and returned home.

Q医生的情况是，他周二要去外地做专业讲座，而当他即将到来的行程开始影响到他的日常生活时，他就开始着手准备了。周四，他辗转反侧，计划着出发前要做的事情。为了弥补耽误的工作日，他必须在周六去办公室上班，而周六通常是他的休息日。他列了一张清单，上面写着周五要处理的事情，比如取机票，因为那是周一登机前的最后一个工作日。周五的日程安排因为这些琐事而略有被打乱，由于要为他的缺席做准备，他与病人的会面也不像往常那样轻松高效。周五晚上在家也并不像往常那样放松，因为他不得不比平时早睡，以便周六能比平时早起。周六晚上也有些心不在焉，因为他既没有像往常一样进行周末锻炼，也没有和家人见面，而且还要忙着准备第二天的行李。虽然准备讲稿只需要不到十五分钟，但他周六晚饭时却一直在忙着这件事。周日下午他去了海滩，但因为要早点回家收拾行李，所以不像往常那样放松，也因此错过了宁静的周日晚上。周一他乘飞机出发，当晚在酒店早早入睡。周二早上他讲完课后返回家中。

The most frequently occurring expression in the above account is ‘not as usual,’ and it is interspersed with qualifying words such as ‘since,’ ‘because,’ and ‘but.’ All these, especially the first, are reach-back words. In summary, in order for him to give a one-hour lecture on Tuesday, which required only fifteen minutes of preparation at home, he, his family, and his patients were tensed up for several days in advance: not seriously, but enough to affect their behavior perceptibly.

上述描述中最常出现的表达是“与往常不同”，其中穿插着“因为”、“由于”和“但是”等限定词。所有这些词，尤其是第一个词，都是回溯词。总而言之，为了让他能在周二进行一个小时的讲座（而这只需要在家准备十五分钟），他、他的家人和他的病人提前几天就都紧张起来：虽然不是很严重，但足以明显影响他们的行为。

Reach-back must be distinguished from Adult planning and preparation. What Dr Q did Thursday night before he fell asleep was planning, and of itself was an Adult procedure. If he had been able to plan during his waking hours without disturbing his normal schedule, that would not be called reach-back. But because of his busy day, he did have to lose some sleep Thursday night, and that was reach-back. Some of the errands he went on on Friday were preparation and not reach-back, since he did them on his lunch hour, but others interfered with his usual schedule, including one phone call that came while he was talking to a patient, which disturbed his train of thought. The repeated disturbances of his train of thought were part of the reach-back. Thus, planning and preparation are Adult activities as long as they do not conflict with the person’s usual patterns, but if they do, they become part of the reach-back, particularly if they disturb the Child (with apprehension, for example) or the Parent (by making him neglect his usual duties).

必须将“回溯”与成人的计划和准备区分开来。Q医生周四晚上睡前所做的事情属于计划，本身就是一项成人行为。如果他能在清醒时进行计划而不影响其正常作息，那就不能称之为“回溯”。但由于他当天很忙，周四晚上不得不牺牲睡眠，这就是“回溯”。他周五处理的一些杂事属于准备工作，而非“回溯”，因为这些事情是在午休时间完成的；但其他一些杂事则干扰了他的正常作息，例如，在他与病人交谈时接到的一个电话打断了他的思路。这种反复打断思路的行为就是“回溯”的一部分。因此，只要计划和准备不与个人的正常模式相冲突，它们就是成人活动；但如果与正常模式相冲突，它们就变成了“回溯”，尤其当它们干扰了“儿童”（例如，引起焦虑）或“父母”（例如，导致其忽视日常职责）时。

Each impending event influences the individual’s behavior in some way, but it need not have an effect independent of his usual patterns. For example, most people are waiting for Santa Claus, as discussed in Chapter Ten , but this expectation is integrated into their ways of life and their usual ways of behaving. Again, impending puberty reaches far back into the life of the child, and in a certain sense its influence extends back into the womb. It is often quite evident that the approaching onset of puberty influenced what a twelve-year-old girl or boy did yesterday, but it did not do so independently of everything else that happened, so it does not meet the definition of reach-back.

每件即将发生的事件都会以某种方式影响个体的行为，但这种影响并非必然独立于其惯常的行为模式。例如，正如第十章所述，大多数人都在期待圣诞老人的到来，但这种期待已经融入了他们的生活方式和日常行为模式之中。同样，青春期的临近对儿童的影响可以追溯到很远以前，在某种意义上，它的影响甚至可以追溯到子宫时期。我们常常可以明显地看到，青春期的临近影响了十二岁男孩或女孩昨天的行为，但这并非独立于其他所有发生的事情，因此它并不符合“追溯性影响”的定义。

It is manifest that the remedy for reach-back is Adult organization: to arrange one’s time as far as possible so that planning and preparation can be carried on without disturbing normal patterns of behavior. It is also necessary to look ahead. After Dr Q learned that a one-hour lecture in a distant city had a reach-back of five days, he no longer accepted such engagements, except on one occasion when it fitted in with his vacation plans to take five days off in order to give a one-hour lecture.

显然，解决时间安排滞后问题的办法是成人式的组织：尽可能合理安排时间，以便在不干扰正常行为模式的情况下进行计划和准备。同时，也需要提前规划。Q博士得知在远方城市进行一小时的讲座会滞后五天后，便不再接受此类邀请，除非有一次正好符合他的假期计划，可以请五天假去讲一小时的课。

After-burn is defined as that period of time during which a past event has an independent influence on the individual’s behavior. In some way, each past event does influence behavior, but after-burn refers only to those occasions when it disturbs normal patterns for an appreciable period rather than being assimilated into them or excluded from them by repression and other psychological mechanisms.

“后遗症”指的是过去事件对个体行为产生独立影响的一段时间。虽然每个过去事件都会在某种程度上影响行为，但“后遗症”仅指那些在相当长的一段时间内扰乱正常行为模式，而不是被压抑或其他心理机制同化或排除在外的情况。

After he returned from giving the lecture, Dr Q had to face a clean-up. He had to answer the mail and telephone calls which had piled up during his absence, and take care of the accumulated problems brought to him by his family and patients. He also had to balance the accounts and fill out the vouchers connected with his trip. Most of this clean-up was an Adult procedure, and he managed to fit it in without disturbing his normal schedule. But when one of the vouchers was returned three weeks later because he had submitted it in duplicate instead of in triplicate, he became irritated, and this distracted him slightly during his next hour with a patient. There was also the matter of the black militant. In the question period after the lecture, a black militant (who shouldn’t have been there anyway because he was not a professional therapist) had asked some questions and brought out some points which troubled Dr Q for several days afterward. Here, the paper work (so long as it did not interfere with business as usual) was an Adult clean-up job, while his irritation about the vouchers and his conflicts about the black militant were part of the after-burn, in which his Parent and Child were involved.

讲完课回来后，Q医生不得不面对一系列的善后工作。他必须回复在他不在期间积压的邮件和电话，处理家人和病人带来的各种问题。他还得核对账目，填写与此次行程相关的凭证。这些工作大多属于成人诊疗范畴，他设法在不影响正常作息的情况下完成了。但三周后，其中一张凭证因为他提交了两份而不是三份而被退回，这让他很恼火，也影响了他接下来一个小时的病人诊疗。此外，还有那位黑人激进分子的事。在讲座后的问答环节，一位黑人激进分子（他本来就不应该出现在那里，因为他并非专业治疗师）提出了一些问题，其中一些观点让Q医生在接下来的几天里一直耿耿于怀。在这里，文书工作（只要不影响正常业务）是成年人的清理工作，而他对代金券的恼怒以及他对黑人激进分子的冲突则是余波的一部分，他的父母和孩子都卷入其中。

All in all, the Adult activities, including the planning, the preparation, the task itself (the lecture), and the clean-up, extended over a period of twelve days or so. The reach-back and the after-burn, which involved his Parent and Child, lasted somewhat longer. The after-burn, as it often is, was reactivated much later when he got the letter about the voucher, which he had to do over and then grumble about at home.

总的来说，包括计划、准备、任务本身（讲座）和善后工作在内的成人活动，持续了大约十二天。而涉及他父母和孩子的后续工作和余波则持续了更长时间。余波常常如此，在他收到关于代金券的信后再次被激活，因为他不得不重新做一遍，然后回家后又为此抱怨了一番。

The remedy for after-burn is to prepare oneself in advance to tolerate trivial upsets, and then forget them.

缓解事后情绪低落的办法是提前做好承受轻微挫折的准备，然后忘记它们。

The lecture episode is an example of normal reach-back and after-burn. With encouragement from the parents, however, both of these can become seriously disturbing and can contribute to the outcome of the script, particularly if it is a tragic one. Either of them, in an exaggerated form, can lead to alcohol addiction, psychosis, suicide, or even homicide. Thus, both examination reach-back, and impotence after-burn, can contribute to adolescent suicide, and stage-fright reach-back contributes to excessive drinking in actors and salesmen. The following is an example of scripty after-burn.

讲座片段是正常“回溯”和“余热”的一个例子。然而，在父母的鼓励下，这两种情况都可能变得非常令人不安，并可能影响剧本的结局，尤其是在剧本本身是悲剧的情况下。任何一种情况，如果表现得过于极端，都可能导致酗酒、精神病、自杀甚至杀人。因此，“考试回溯”和“阳痿余热”都可能导致青少年自杀，而“舞台恐惧症回溯”则会导致演员和销售人员过度饮酒。以下是一个剧本“余热”的例子。

A twenty-three-year-old executive named Cyril came for treatment, with diarrhea as one of his chief complaints. One day he mentioned in the group that he had difficulty falling asleep at night. He would lie awake reviewing his decisions and his transactions with his staff, picking faults in what he had done, and counting the day’s collection of guilt, hurt, and anger trading stamps. From his early history, it was clear that this was all done under a script directive from his mother. This after-burn lasted an hour or so, or on special occasions, two or three hours, before he could fall asleep. The therapist and the other members of the group gave him permission to end his working day without any after-burn, and go right to sleep when he wanted to, against the opposition of his nagging critical Parent, and the insomnia stopped. Soon after that, for reasons which never became clear, his diarrhea stopped also, and two months later he terminated his treatment.

一位名叫西里尔的23岁高管前来接受治疗，腹泻是他的主要症状之一。有一天，他在小组讨论中提到自己晚上难以入睡。他会躺在床上辗转反侧，反复思考自己做出的决定和与员工的互动，挑剔自己的不足，并像收集邮票一样，细数着一天积累的愧疚、伤痛和愤怒。从他早年的病史来看，这一切都是他母亲的指令。这种“后遗症”通常会持续一个小时左右，特殊情况下甚至会持续两三个小时，之后他才能入睡。治疗师和其他小组成员允许他结束一天的工作后不再受“后遗症”的困扰，想睡就睡，尽管他那唠叨挑剔的母亲极力反对，他的失眠症状也随之消失了。不久之后，出于某种至今不明的原因，他的腹泻也停止了，两个月后，他结束了治疗。

Although reach-back and after-burn can each alone cause trouble in people with hard scripts, in most cases one or the other can be tolerated without serious consequences. It can be dangerous for almost anyone, however, if the after-burn of the last event overlaps the reach-back from the next one. This is most commonly seen in ‘overwork’ syndromes; in fact, this is a good definition of overwork. No matter how great the burden, as long as the work can be done without such an overlap occurring, there is no (mental) overwork. If such an overlap does occur, then the person is overworked, no matter how small his burden actually is. After yesterday, his Parent harasses him with guilts and doubts: he shouldn’t have done that , what will they think of him, why didn’t he do it the other way; and while all this is going round in his head like stale beer, his Child is worried about tomorrow: what mistakes he might make, what they might do to him, what he would like to do to them. These vinegary thoughts slosh into the others to form an unappetizing, depressing mixture. An example:

虽然“后遗症”和“后燃效应”本身都可能对习惯性思维的人造成困扰，但在大多数情况下，二者之一都可以被容忍，不会造成严重后果。然而，如果上一件事的后燃效应与下一件事的后遗症重叠，对几乎所有人来说都可能很危险。这种情况最常见于“过度劳累”综合症；事实上，这正是过度劳累的一个很好的定义。无论负担多么沉重，只要工作能够完成而不会出现这种重叠，就不存在（精神上的）过度劳累。如果这种重叠确实发生了，那么这个人就处于过度劳累状态，无论他实际的负担多么轻。昨天之后，他的“父母”用内疚和怀疑折磨着他：他不应该那样做，他们会怎么看他，为什么他不那样做；当所有这些想法像陈年啤酒一样在他的脑海里循环时，他的“孩子”则担心明天：他可能会犯什么错误，他们会对他做什么，他想对他们做什么。这些令人不快的想法与其他想法混杂在一起，形成一种令人倒胃口、压抑的混合物。例如：

Pebble, the accountant, works far into the night preparing the annual report. The figures do not balance, and after he gets home he lies awake worrying about it some more. When he finally falls asleep, figures still float before him in uneasy dreams and visions. When he gets up the next morning, nothing has been settled, and the after-burn of last night’s work is still with him. Now he starts worrying about what he is going to do at the office today, for meanwhile his regular tasks must go on, and they reach back with a powerful grip as he tries to talk to his family at breakfast. And underneath these urgencies, on a longer time scale, is the after-burn of the mistakes he made on last year’s report, for which he was rebuked by his boss; and the apprehensive reach-back of what might happen at this year’s annual meeting is already churning in his stomach. Meanwhile, with his mind in the pincers of these overlaps, he has no time, energy, or motivation left for his personal life, and things start to go bad at home. His relationships there are not helped by his irritability, his neglect, and his pessimism.

会计佩布尔为了准备年度报告，工作到深夜。账目不平衡，他回到家后辗转反侧，彻夜难眠。好不容易睡着了，梦里还是萦绕着那些数字，让他心神不宁。第二天早上醒来，一切依然悬而未决，昨晚工作的余波依然挥之不去。他开始担心今天在办公室该怎么办，因为日常工作必须继续，而这些工作像魔咒一样紧紧抓住他，让他难以与家人共进早餐。在这些紧迫事务的背后，还有更深层次的原因：去年报告中的错误让他受到了老板的严厉批评；而今年年会可能出现的状况也让他忐忑不安。与此同时，这些纷繁复杂的问题让他焦头烂额，根本没有时间、精力或动力去顾及个人生活，家庭也开始出现问题。他的易怒、疏忽和悲观情绪都对他的人际关系造成了不利影响。

In most such cases, the outcome will be determined by the balance between Pebble’s harsh driving Parent and his angry depressed Child. If his Parent is stronger, he will get the job done and then collapse and be hospitalized with an agitated depression. If his Child prevails, he will start to act oddly and give up before the task is finished, and come out with a schizoid or schizophrenic state. If his Adult is stronger than both, he may sweat it out and then lapse into a state of fatigue until he is restored by a few days’ rest or a vacation. Even in such favorable cases, however, if the strain goes on year after year, he may end up with a chronic physical disability. According to the information available at present, he will be a good candidate for an ulcer or high blood pressure.

大多数情况下，最终结果取决于Pebble性格中严厉的“父母”特质和愤怒抑郁的“孩子”特质之间的平衡。如果“父母”特质占上风，他就能完成任务，然后崩溃，因躁动不安而住院。如果“孩子”特质占上风，他就会开始行为怪异，在任务完成前放弃，最终出现精神分裂症或分裂样障碍。如果“成人”特质比两者都强，他或许能勉强完成任务，然后陷入疲惫状态，直到休息几天或度假后恢复过来。然而，即使在这些有利的情况下，如果压力持续多年，他最终也可能导致慢性身体残疾。根据目前掌握的信息，他很可能患上胃溃疡或高血压。

The menace in Pebble’s position lies in the way his time is structured. As we saw in Chapter Ten , there are two ways of scheduling a task. One is Goal Time, ‘I’ll work until I get this finished (no matter how long it takes).’ The other is Clock Time, ‘I’ll work until midnight (and then stop no matter what).’ Pebble could neither finish nor stop. He was on ‘Hurryup’ Time. He had to complete a certain task by a certain time, and this forced combination of Goal Time and Clock Time often imposes an almost impossible problem. This occurs in the fairy tale where the girl has to separate the grain from the chaff before dawn. She could do it all given enough time, or she could do a certain amount of it by working until dawn, but in order to do all of it within the time limit, she required magic help from the fairy or the elf or the birds or the ants. Pebble doesn’t have any elves or ants or other magic help, so he pays the penalty the girl would have paid if she had failed: he loses his head.

佩布尔的困境在于他时间安排的方式。正如我们在第十章中看到的，安排任务有两种方式。一种是目标时间，“我会一直工作直到完成（无论需要多长时间）”。另一种是时钟时间，“我会工作到午夜（然后无论如何都要停止）”。佩布尔既无法完成任务，也无法停止。他被置于“赶时间”之下。他必须在特定时间之前完成特定任务，而这种目标时间和时钟时间的强制结合往往会造成几乎不可能完成的问题。这在童话故事中也有体现：女孩必须在黎明前将谷粒与谷壳分离。如果时间足够，她可以全部完成；或者，她也可以工作到黎明完成一部分；但为了在规定时间内完成所有工作，她需要仙女、精灵、鸟儿或蚂蚁的魔法帮助。佩布尔没有任何精灵、蚂蚁或其他魔法帮助，所以他要承受女孩失败后将要承受的惩罚：失去脑袋。

The remedy for overlaps is a matter of arithmetic. Each person has a sort of standard ‘reach-back time’ and ‘after-burn time’ for various kinds of situations. The kinds of situations should be listed: domestic quarrels, examination or hearings, work deadlines, travel, visits from or to relatives, etc. The two worry times should be estimated from experience with each type of situation. With the information at hand, the prevention of overlap reduces to a simple calculation. If the estimated after-burn for situation A is x days, and the anticipated reach-back for situation B is y days, then the date set for B must be at least x+y+1 days after the date of A. If both events can be foreseen, this is easy to arrange. If A is unforeseen, the date of B must be postponed. If that is not practical, the second choice would be to hurry up with B so as to get both A and B over with in the shortest possible interval of overlap, hoping for the best. If B is immovable, the only alternatives left are to shape up or ship out.

解决时间重叠问题其实很简单，就是简单的计算。每个人对于各种情况都有自己标准的“回溯时间”和“余燃时间”。这些情况包括：家庭争吵、考试或听证会、工作截止日期、旅行、亲戚来访等等。这两种时间应该根据自身经验来估算。有了这些信息，避免时间重叠就简化成了一个简单的计算。如果情况 A 的预计余燃时间为 x 天，情况 B 的预计回溯时间为 y 天，那么 B 的日期必须至少在 A 之后 x+y+1 天。如果两件事都能预见到，那就很容易安排。如果 A 是无法预见的，那么 B 的日期就必须推迟。如果推迟也不现实，那么第二个选择就是尽快处理 B，争取在最短的重叠时间内完成 A 和 B，并祈祷一切顺利。如果 B 不可改变立场，那么剩下的唯一选择就是振作起来或者退出市场。

Mothers of small children, for the most part, are the best examples of people who manage to shape up rather than ship out. With amazing resilience, they assimilate numbers of little after-burns and dozens of daily reach-backs in their everyday living. If they fail to do so, they become harried, and the feeling of being harried is the first sign of unmanageable overlap, and the first indication that a vacation is needed. Overlap interferes with sexual activity in both sexes, acting as an anaphrodisiac. Conversely, sex is an excellent antidote for overlaps, and for many couples a week or even a weekend away from the children restores sexual desire and power, and replaces after-burn and reach-back with warm-up and afterglow. Most normal after-burns and reach-backs run their courses in about six days, so that a two-week vacation allows the superficial after-burns to burn out, after which there are a few days of carefree living before the reach-backs begin to creep in in unguarded moments and clutter up the situation again. For the assimilation of more chronic after-burns and deeper, repressed reach-backs, however, a vacation of at least six weeks is probably necessary. This formerly proceeded much more peacefully when the month in Europe was bracketed by restful six- or seven-day Transatlantic crossings, than it does now with jet planes and their time lags, which are in themselves strenuous experiences.

大多数有幼儿的母亲都是能够振作起来而不是逃避现实的最佳典范。她们拥有惊人的韧性，能够消化日常生活中无数次的“后遗症”和需要反复应对的琐事。如果她们无法做到这一点，就会感到疲惫不堪，而这种疲惫感正是难以承受的重负的第一个迹象，也是需要休假的第一个信号。重负会影响男女双方的性生活，起到抑制性欲的作用。相反，性生活是缓解重负的绝佳良药，对许多夫妻来说，哪怕只是离开孩子一周甚至一个周末，都能恢复性欲和活力，用温存和余韵取代“后遗症”和“需要反复应对”。大多数正常的旅行后遗症和回溯情绪会在六天左右消退，因此两周的假期足以让表面的旅行后遗症消散，之后可以享受几天无忧无虑的生活，然后回溯情绪会在不经意间悄然袭来，再次扰乱局面。然而，对于更持久的旅行后遗症和更深层次、更压抑的回溯情绪，至少需要六周的假期才能彻底消除。过去，当欧洲之行前后穿插着轻松的六七天跨大西洋飞行时，这种消退过程要平静得多；而现在，喷气式飞机及其带来的时差本身就是一种疲惫的体验。

Dreaming is probably the normal mechanism for adjusting after-burn and reach-back. Thus it happens that people who are deprived experimentally or punitively of the opportunity to dream eventually go into a state resembling psychosis. 12 Hence, normal sleep is important in preventing overlap and its bad effects. Since sedatives such as barbiturates reduce the amount of REM dream sleep in favor of other stages of sleep, they do not encourage the assimilation of after-burn and reach-back; the effect may be to ‘deposit’ the unassimilated overlap in some part of the body, leading to a ‘psychosomatic’ disorder. 13 That, however, may sometimes be preferable to the effects of prolonged and extensive insomnia.

做梦可能是调节后燃效应和回溯效应的正常机制。因此，那些因实验或惩罚而被剥夺做梦机会的人最终会进入类似精神病的状态。 12 因此，正常的睡眠对于预防重叠效应及其不良影响至关重要。由于巴比妥类药物等镇静剂会减少快速眼动睡眠（REM）的梦境睡眠，增加其他睡眠阶段的睡眠，它们不利于后燃效应和回溯效应的吸收；其结果可能是将未被吸收的重叠效应“沉积”在身体的某些部位，从而导致“心身”疾病。 13 然而，这有时可能比长期严重失眠的影响更好。

Many philosophers of living have recommended ‘living day by day.’ This should not mean living only for the moment, or living without organization or without planning for the future. Many of these same philosophers, such as William Osler, 14 were highly organized people with surpassingly successful planned careers. In the present language, living day by day means living a well-planned and organized life, and sleeping well between each day, so that the day ends without reach-back, since tomorrow is well planned, and begins without after-burn, since yesterday was well organized. This is an excellent way to overcome the disabilities which might otherwise arise from a bad script, and an equally good way to bring a good one to its happy fulfillment.

许多生活哲学家都提倡“活在当下”。这并非意味着只活在当下，或者漫无目的地生活，不为未来做任何规划。许多这样的哲学家，例如威廉·奥斯勒，本身就是生活井然有序、事业有成的人。用现代的话来说，“活在当下”意味着过着精心规划、井然有序的生活，并且每天之间都能睡个好觉，这样一天结束时就不会感到遗憾，因为明天已经做好了充分的准备；而新的一天开始时也不会感到疲惫，因为昨天已经安排妥当。这是一种克服糟糕人生剧本可能带来的种种弊端的绝佳方法，也是让美好人生剧本最终圆满实现的有效途径。

F • The Little Fascist

F • 小法西斯

Every human being seems to have a small fascist in his head. This is derived from the deepest layers of the personality (the Child in the Child). In civilized people it is usually deeply buried beneath a platform of social ideals and training, but with proper permissions and directives, as history has shown again and again, it can be liberated into full bloom. In the less civilized portion of the population, it is openly exposed and nurtured, and awaits only proper opportunities for periodic expression. In both cases it is a strong force in advancing the script; in the first case, secretly, subtly, and denied; in the second case, crudely or even proudly acknowledged. But it may be said that whoever is not aware of this force in his personality has lost control of it. He has not confronted himself, and cannot know where he is headed. A good example of this occurred at a meeting of ‘conservationists,’ where Conservo remarked how much he admired a certain tribe in Asia for taking such good care of their natural resources, ‘much better than we do.’ A humanist countered, ‘Yes, but they have a terrible infant-mortality rate.’ ‘Ho, ho,’ said Conservo, and several others joined in. ‘That’s all to the good, now, isn’t it? There are too many babies as it is.’

每个人的脑海里似乎都藏着一个小小的法西斯主义者。这源于人格最深层的层面（孩童中的孩童）。在文明人身上，它通常被深深地埋藏在社会理想和教养的庇护之下，但正如历史一次又一次地证明的那样，只要给予适当的许可和引导，它就能被释放出来，绽放光彩。而在那些文明程度较低的人群中，它则被公开地暴露和滋养，只待时机成熟便会周期性地爆发。无论在哪种情况下，它都是推动社会进程的一股强大力量；在前一种情况下，它隐秘、微妙且被否认；在后一种情况下，它则被粗暴地甚至骄傲地承认。但可以说，任何没有意识到自身人格中这股力量的人，都已经失去了对它的控制。他没有正视过自己，也无法预知自己将走向何方。一个很好的例子发生在一次“环保主义者”的会议上。会上，康瑟沃（Conservo）表示，他非常钦佩亚洲某个部落对自然资源的保护，“比我们做得好得多”。一位人道主义者反驳道：“没错，但他们的婴儿死亡率很高。”“呵呵，”康瑟沃说道，其他几个人也跟着附和。“这不正是好事吗？现在婴儿已经够多了。”

A fascist may be defined as a person who has no respect for living tissue and regards it as his prey. This arrogant attitude is no doubt a relic of the prehistory of the human race, still surviving in the gusto of cannibalism and the joys of massacre. For carnivorous anthropoids on the hunt, ruthlessness meant efficiency and greed was motivated by hunger. But as the human mind and brain evolved through natural selection, these qualities were not bred out. After they were no longer necessary for survival, they became detached from their original goal of bringing down the dinner meat and degenerated into ends in themselves, luxuries often indulged in and enjoyed at the expense of other human beings. Ruthlessness developed into cruelty, and greed into exploitation and theft. Since the prey – the flesh itself, and especially human flesh – was largely replaced by more compliant stomach-filling commodities, it began to be used to satisfy psychological hungers. The pleasures of torture replaced or preceded the pleasures of eating, and ‘He He’ took over from ‘Yum Yum.’ It became less important to kill him (or her) than to hear and watch him (or her) scream and grovel. This became the essence of fascism – a roving band seeking male or female prey to torment or deride – whose art lay in probing for the victim’s weakness.

法西斯主义者可以被定义为对活体组织毫无尊重，视其为猎物的人。这种傲慢的态度无疑是人类史前时代的遗迹，至今仍体现在食人行为的狂热和屠杀的快感之中。对于狩猎的食肉类人猿而言，冷酷无情意味着效率，而贪婪则源于饥饿。但随着人类心智和大脑通过自然选择进化，这些特质并未被淘汰。当它们不再是生存的必需品时，便脱离了最初获取猎物的目的，蜕变为目的本身，成为一种常常以牺牲他人为代价的奢侈享受。冷酷无情演变为残忍，贪婪演变为剥削和盗窃。由于猎物——尤其是人肉——在很大程度上被更容易满足口腹之欲的商品所取代，它开始被用来满足心理上的欲望。酷刑的快感取代或先于进食的快感，“嘿嘿”取代了“好吃好吃”。杀死他（或她）不再那么重要，重要的是聆听和观看他（或她）的惨叫和匍匐。这成了法西斯主义的本质——一群四处游荡、寻找男性或女性猎物进行折磨或嘲弄的团伙——他们的艺术在于探寻受害者的弱点。

There are two by-products of the grovel, both of them advantageous to the aggressor. The biological effect is sexual pleasure and excitement, with the victim available to indulge even the most ingenious perversions the favorite of record being anal rape. Torture brings about a peculiar intimacy between the torturer and the victim, and a profound insight into each other’s souls, an intimacy and insight which is often otherwise lacking in both their lives. The other by-product is a purely commercial one. The victim always has valuables which can yield a profit. For cannibals it may be strength derived from magic organs such as the heart or the testicles, or even the ear. For advanced peoples, the fat can be used to make soap, and golden tooth fillings can be salvaged. These yields are exploited after the furor of personal encounter has subsided, and they are ‘melted down’ into anonymity.

卑躬屈膝会带来两种副产品，而且这两种副产品都对施暴者有利。其生理效应是性快感和兴奋，受害者会任由施暴者摆布，甚至进行最变态的性虐待——其中最著名的就是肛交。酷刑会在施暴者和受害者之间建立一种特殊的亲密关系，让他们对彼此的灵魂有深刻的了解，这种亲密关系和洞察力在他们各自的生活中往往是缺失的。另一种副产品则纯粹是商业性的。受害者身上总有一些可以带来利润的贵重物品。对于食人族来说，这些物品可能是从心脏、睾丸甚至耳朵等“魔法器官”中汲取的力量。对于文明程度较高的民族来说，脂肪可以用来制作肥皂，金牙填充物也可以回收利用。这些“战利品”会在施暴的狂热过后被利用，最终被“熔化”成无名之辈。

As the human embryo grows, it relives the whole evolutionary tree. Sometimes it gets hung up and is born with relics of ancient stages, such as gill clefts. As children grow, they relive the prehistory of the human race and go through hunting and planting and manufacturing stages, and they may get hung up at any of these. But everyone retains some vestiges of all of them.

随着人类胚胎的生长，它会重温整个进化树。有时，它会停滞不前，生来就带有远古阶段的遗迹，例如鳃裂。随着儿童的成长，他们会重温人类的史前时期，经历狩猎、种植和制造等阶段，并且可能在任何一个阶段停滞不前。但每个人都会保留所有这些阶段的某些痕迹。

The small fascist in every human being is a little torturer who probes for and enjoys the weakness of his victims. If this comes out openly, he is a cripple-kicker, a stomper, and a rapist, sometimes with some excuse or other such as toughness, objectivity, or justification. But most people suppress these tendencies, pretend they are not there at all, excuse them if they show their colors, or overlay and disguise them with fear. Some even try to demonstrate their innocence by becoming the purposeful victims instead of the aggressors, on the principle that it is better to shed their own blood than that of others, but blood they must have.

每个人心中都潜藏着一个小小的法西斯主义者，他像个施虐狂，伺机寻找并享受受害者的弱点。如果这种倾向公开显露，他就会变成一个残暴的踢人者、践踏者、强奸犯，有时还会为自己的行为找借口，比如强硬、客观或正当理由。但大多数人压抑这些倾向，假装它们根本不存在，即使它们显露出来也会找借口，或者用恐惧掩盖和掩饰它们。有些人甚至试图通过主动成为受害者而不是施暴者来证明自己的清白，因为他们认为与其流别人的血，不如流自己的血，但他们又不得不流血。

These primitive strivings become interwoven with the injunctions, precepts, and permissions of the script, and form the basis for third-degree or ‘tissue’ games that draw blood. He who pretends that these forces do not exist becomes their victim. His whole script may become a project to demonstrate that he is free of them. But since he is most likely not, this is a denial of himself and therefore of his right to a self-chosen destiny. The solution is not to say, as many do, ‘It’s frightening,’ but rather ‘What can I do about it and what can I do with it?’ It is better to be a martyr than to be a troglodyte, that is, a man who refuses to believe he has ascended from an apelike creature because he hasn’t yet, but to know oneself is better than both.

这些原始的渴望与既定的规则、戒律和许可交织在一起，构成了那些会流血的、如同“血肉之躯”般的残酷游戏的基础。假装这些力量不存在的人，最终会成为它们的受害者。他整个人生轨迹或许会变成一个证明自己摆脱了这些力量的项目。但既然他很可能并非如此，那么这种做法便是否定自我，从而否定了他选择自己命运的权利。解决之道并非像许多人那样说“这太可怕了”，而是“我能做些什么？我能如何应对？”与其做一个穴居人——即一个因为尚未进化就拒绝相信自己已经从类猿生物进化而来的人——不如做一个殉道者，但认识自我则胜过两者。

It is important to realize that certain ‘genocidal’ aspects of human nature have remained unchanged during the past five thousand years regardless of any genetic evolution which has taken place during this period; they also remain immune to environmental and social influences. One of these is the prejudice against darker people which has persisted unchanged since the dawn of recorded time in ancient Egypt, whose ‘miserable people of Cush’ are still represented in oppressed Negro populations throughout the world. 15 The other is ‘search and destroy’ warfare. For example:

必须认识到，在过去五千年中，无论基因如何进化，人类天性中某些“种族灭绝”的方面始终未变；它们也不受环境和社会因素的影响。其中之一是对肤色较深人群的偏见，这种偏见自古埃及有文字记载以来就一直存在，古埃及的“可怜的库什人”至今仍在世界各地受压迫的黑人群体中有所体现。另一个例子是“搜寻并摧毁”式的战争。例如：

‘234 Viet Cong ambushed and killed’ and ‘237 villagers slaughtered in Viet Nam.’ (Both from U.S. Army reports, 1969.)

“234名越共士兵遭到伏击身亡”和“237名村民在越南被屠杀。”（均出自1969年美国陆军报告。）

Compare: ‘800 of their soldiers by my arms I destroyed; their populace in the flames I burned; their boys, their maidens, I dishonored. 1000 of their warriors’ corpses on a hill I piled up. On the first of May, I killed 800 of their fighting men, I burned their many houses, their boys and maidens I dishonored etc. (From the Annals of Assur-Nasir-Pal, Column II, about 870 B.C.E. )

比较：‘我以武力消灭了他们八百名士兵；我焚烧了他们的百姓；我羞辱了他们的男孩和少女。我将他们一千名战士的尸体堆在山上。五月一日，我杀死了他们八百名战士，烧毁了他们的许多房屋，羞辱了他们的男孩和少女，等等。’（摘自《阿舒尔·纳西尔·帕尔编年史》，第二栏，约公元前870年）

Thus for at least 2800 years there have been willing and eager corpse-counters. The good guys end up as ‘casualties;’ the bad guys as ‘bodies,’ ‘dead,’ or ‘corpses.’

因此，至少在过去的2800年里，一直都有乐于且热衷于统计尸体的人。好人最终会成为“伤亡者”；坏人则会成为“尸体”、“死者”或“尸体”。

G • The Brave Schizophrenic

G • 勇敢的精神分裂症患者

Besides the biological and psychological characteristics of the human organism which allow the preprogramed script to become the master of personal destiny, societies are set up in such a way as to encourage this lack of autonomy. This is done by means of the transactional social contract, which reads: ‘You accept my persona or self-presentation, and I’ll accept yours.’ Any abrogation of this contract, unless it is one specifically permitted in a given group, is regarded as rudeness. The result is a lack of confrontation: confrontation with others and confrontation with oneself, for behind this social contract lies a hidden individual contract between the three aspects of the personality. The Parent, Child, and Adult agree among themselves to accept each other’s self-presentation, and not everyone is courageous enough to change such a contract with himself when it is advisable.

除了人类机体的生物学和心理学特征使得预设的程序主宰个人命运之外，社会结构本身也在鼓励这种缺乏自主性。这种缺乏自主性是通过交易型的社会契约实现的，其内容是：“你接受我的人格或自我呈现，我也接受你的。”任何违背此契约的行为，除非是特定群体明确允许的，都会被视为无礼。其结果是缺乏对抗：缺乏与他人的对抗，也缺乏与自身的对抗，因为在这种社会契约背后，隐藏着人格三个面向之间的个体契约。父母、儿童和成人彼此约定接受对方的自我呈现，但并非每个人都有足够的勇气在必要时改变这种与自身的契约。

Lack of confrontation is seen most clearly in the case of schizophrenics and their therapists. The majority of therapists (in my experience) say that schizophrenia is incurable. By this they mean: ‘Schizophrenia is incurable by my kind of psychoanalytic therapy, and I’m damned if I’m going to try anything else.’ Hence they settle for what they call ‘making progress,’ and like the well-known electrical manufacturer, progress is their principal product. But progress means merely making the schizophrenic live more bravely in his crazy world, rather than getting him out of it, and so the earth is full of brave schizophrenics living out their tragic scripts with the help of not so brave therapists.

缺乏对抗在精神分裂症患者及其治疗师的案例中体现得最为明显。就我的经验而言，大多数治疗师都认为精神分裂症无法治愈。他们的意思是：“我的精神分析疗法治不好精神分裂症，我才不会尝试其他疗法呢。” 因此，他们满足于所谓的“取得进展”，就像那家著名的电器制造商一样，“进展”成了他们的主要产品。但所谓的“进展”仅仅意味着让精神分裂症患者在疯狂的世界里活得更勇敢，而不是让他们摆脱困境。因此，世界上到处都是勇敢的精神分裂症患者，在并不勇敢的治疗师的帮助下，上演着他们悲剧的剧本。

Two other slogans common among therapists are also common among the general population: ‘You can’t tell people what to do,’ and ‘I can’t help you, you have to help yourself.’ Both of these are outright falsehoods. You can tell people what to do, and many of them will do it and do it well. And you can help people, and they don’t have to help themselves. They merely have to get up, after you have helped them, and go about their business. But with slogans such as those, society (and I don’t mean Arsisiety, I mean all societies) encourages people to stay in their scripts and carry them through to their often tragic endings. A script merely means that someone told the person what to do a long time ago and he decided to do it. This demonstrates that you can tell people what to do, and are in fact telling them all the time, especially if you have children. So if you tell people to do something other than what their parents told them, they may decide to follow your advice or instructions. And it is well known that you can help people get drunk, or kill themselves, or kill someone else; therefore, you can also help them stop drinking, or stop killing themselves, or stop killing other people. It is certainly possible to give people permission to do certain things, or to stop doing certain things which they were ordered in childhood to keep doing. Instead of encouraging people to live bravely in an old unhappy world, it is possible to have them live happily in a brave new world.

治疗师中常见的另外两句口号在普通人群中也很常见：“你不能告诉别人该怎么做”和“我帮不了你，你得自助”。这两句话都是彻头彻尾的谬论。你可以告诉别人该怎么做，而且很多人会照做，并且做得很好。你也可以帮助别人，他们不必自助。在你帮助他们之后，他们只需要重新振作起来，继续过自己的生活。但是，正是因为有了这些口号，社会（我指的不是阿尔西西蒂，而是所有社会）才会鼓励人们固守既定的剧本，并最终走向悲剧的结局。所谓“剧本”，仅仅是指很久以前有人告诉这个人该怎么做，而这个人决定照做。这表明你可以告诉别人该怎么做，而且实际上你一直在告诉他们该怎么做，尤其是有孩子的时候。所以，如果你告诉别人做一些与他们父母告诉他们的不同的事情，他们可能会决定听从你的建议或指示。众所周知，你可以帮助人们酗酒、自杀或杀人；因此，你也可以帮助他们戒酒、停止自杀或停止杀人。当然，我们可以允许人们去做某些事，或者停止做某些他们在童年时期就被要求做的事情。与其鼓励人们在一个充满不幸的旧世界里勇敢地生活，不如让他们在一个崭新的世界里快乐地生活。

Thus we have listed above seven factors which make the script possible and encourage its continuation: the plastic face, the moving self, fascination and imprinting, silent influences, the reach-back and the after-burn, the little fascist, and the acquiescence of other people. But we have also listed a practical remedy for each one.

因此，我们上面列出了七个使这种剧本成为可能并促使其延续的因素：虚伪的面孔、善变的自我、迷恋与印记、无声的影响、回溯与余热、小法西斯主义，以及他人的默许。但我们也针对每一个因素列出了切实可行的应对方法。

H • The Ventriloquist’s Dummy

H • 腹语者的木偶

As psychoanalysis came into its own, it pushed aside much valuable work that had been done previously. Thus, free association replaced the centuries-long tradition of introspection. Free association was concerned with the contents of the mind, leaving it to the psychoanalyst to figure out from this how the mind worked. This could only be done when it did not work smoothly. There is no way to figure out how a closed machine (a ‘black box’) works as long as it works perfectly. This can only be found out if it makes mistakes, or is induced to make a mistake by throwing a monkey wrench into it. Thus, free association is only as good as the psychopathology behind it: the switches, the intrusions, the slips, and the dreams.

随着精神分析的兴起，它摒弃了许多先前卓有成效的研究成果。因此，自由联想取代了延续数个世纪的内省传统。自由联想关注的是心灵的内容，而精神分析师则需要从中探究心灵的运作机制。这只有在心灵出现故障时才能实现。如果一个封闭的机器（一个“黑匣子”）运行完美，我们就无法探究其运作原理。只有当它出现故障，或者人为地制造故障时，我们才能发现其运作机制。因此，自由联想的价值取决于其背后的心理病理：包括思维转换、闯入、口误和梦境。

Introspection, on the other hand, takes the cover off the black box, and lets the Adult of the person peer into his own mind to see how it works: how he puts sentences together, which direction his images come from, and what voices direct his behavior. Federn was the first psychoanalyst, I think, to revive this tradition, and to make a specific study of internal dialogues.

另一方面，内省则揭开了黑匣子的面纱，让成年人得以窥视自己的内心世界，了解其运作方式：如何组织语言，意象源自何处，以及哪些声音指引着自己的行为。我认为，费德恩是第一位复兴这一传统并对内心对话进行专门研究的精神分析学家。

Almost everyone has said ‘to himself’ at some time: ‘You shouldn’t have done that!’ and he may even have noticed that he answers ‘himself’: ‘But I had to!’ In this case, it is the Parent saying ‘You shouldn’t have done that!’ and the Adult or Child saying: ‘But I had to!’ This exactly reproduces some actual dialogue of childhood. Now what is really happening? There are three ‘degrees’ of such internal dialogue. In the first degree, the words run through Jeder’s head in a shadowy way, with no muscular movements, or at least none perceptible to the naked eye or ear. In the second degree, he can feel his vocal muscles moving a little so that he whispers to himself inside his mouth; in particular, there are small abortive movements of the tongue. In the third degree, he says the words out loud. The third degree may take over in certain disturbed conditions so that he walks down the street talking to himself, and people turn their heads to watch and are likely to think he is ‘crazy.’ There is also a fourth degree, where one or other of the internal voices is heard as coming from outside the skull. This is usually the voice of the parent (actually the voice of his father or mother) and these are hallucinations. His Child may or may not answer the Parental voices, but in any case they affect some aspect of his behavior.

几乎每个人都曾对自己说过：“你不该那样做！”他甚至可能注意到，自己会回答自己：“但我不得不那样做！”在这种情况下，是父母在说“你不该那样做！”而成人或孩子则在说：“但我不得不那样做！”这恰好重现了童年时期的一些真实对话。那么，这究竟是怎么回事呢？这种内心对话有三个“层次”。在第一层次，这些话语如同阴影般在杰德的脑海中闪过，没有肌肉运动，或者至少肉眼或耳朵无法察觉。在第二层次，他能感觉到自己的声带肌肉在轻微地活动，仿佛在嘴里低声自语；尤其明显的是，舌头会有一些轻微的、未完成的动作。在第三层次，他会把这些话大声说出来。在某些精神紊乱的情况下，第三阶段可能会出现，他会一边走在街上一边自言自语，路人会转头观看，并可能认为他“疯了”。还有第四阶段，在这种情况下，他会听到内心的声音，感觉像是从颅骨外传来。这通常是父母的声音（实际上是他父亲或母亲的声音），这些都是幻觉。他的孩子可能会回应这些父母的声音，也可能不会，但无论如何，这些声音都会影响他行为的某些方面。

Because people who ‘talk to themselves’ are thought to be crazy, nearly everyone has an injunction against listening to the voices in his head. This is a faculty which can be quickly recovered, however, if the proper permission is given. Then almost anyone can listen in on his own internal dialogues, and that is one of the best ways to find out the Parental precepts, the Parental pattern, and the script controls.

因为人们普遍认为“自言自语”的人是疯子，所以几乎每个人都被禁止倾听自己脑海中的声音。然而，如果给予适当的许可，这种能力是可以很快恢复的。届时，几乎任何人都可以倾听自己的内心对话，而这正是了解父母戒律、父母模式和脚本控制的最佳途径之一。

A sexually excited girl started to pray in her head so that she would be able to resist her boy friend’s seduction. She clearly heard herself directed by the Parental precept: ‘Be a good girl, and when you are tempted, pray.’ A man got into a fight in a bar and was very careful to fight skillfully. He clearly heard his father’s voice saying: ‘Don’t telegraph your punches!’ which was part of his father’s pattern: ‘Here’s how to fight in a bar.’ He got into the fight because his mother’s voice said provocatively: ‘You’re just like your father, some day you’ll get your teeth smashed in a bar fight.’ At the critical moment, a stockmarket speculator heard a demonic whisper telling him: ‘Don’t sell, buy.’ He abandoned his carefully planned campaign, and lost his entire capital – ‘Ha ha,’ he said.

一个性欲高涨的女孩开始在心里默默祈祷，希望能抵挡住男友的诱惑。她清晰地听到父母的训诫：“做个好女孩，遇到诱惑就祈祷。”一个男人在酒吧里与人打架，他非常小心地准备出手。他清晰地听到父亲的声音说：“出拳别太露馅！”这是他父亲惯用的伎俩：“这就是在酒吧里打架的规矩。”他之所以会打架，是因为他母亲挑衅地说道：“你跟你爸一样，总有一天你会在酒吧打架时被打得满嘴是牙。”在关键时刻，一个股票投机者听到一个恶魔般的低语告诉他：“别卖，买。”他放弃了精心策划的交易，结果血本无归——“哈哈，”他笑着说。

The Parental voice exerts the same kind of control as a ventriloquist. It takes charge of the person’s vocal apparatus, and he finds himself saying words which come from someone else. Unless his Adult steps in, he then follows the instructions given by this voice, so that his Child acts exactly like a ventriloquist’s dummy. This ability to suspend one’s own will, usually without realizing what has happened, and to let someone else take charge of the vocal muscles and the other muscles of the body, is what enables the script to take over at the appropriate time.

父母的声音如同腹语师一般，控制着人的发声器官，使他不由自主地说出别人的话。除非成年人介入，否则他就会按照这个声音的指示行事，以至于他的孩子就像腹语师的木偶一样。这种通常在不知不觉中放弃自身意志，任由他人控制发声肌和其他身体肌肉的能力，使得剧本能够在适当的时候接管一切。

The remedy for this is to listen to the voices in one’s head, and let the Adult decide whether to follow their instructions or not. In this way the person frees himself from the control of the Parental ventriloquist, and becomes master of his own actions. In order to accomplish this, he requires two permissions which he can give himself, but which may be more effective coming from someone else, such as a therapist.

解决之道在于倾听内心的声音，让内心的“成年人”决定是否遵从其指示。如此一来，个体便能摆脱“父母”的控制，成为自身行为的主人。为了做到这一点，他需要两种许可：一种是他自己可以给予的，另一种可能是来自他人（例如治疗师）的许可更为有效。

1. Permission to listen to his internal dialogue.

1. 允许他倾听自己的内心独白。

2. Permission not to follow the directives of his Parent.

2. 允许不遵守父母的指示。

There is some peril in this undertaking, and he may require protection from someone else if he dares to disobey the Parental directives. Thus, one job of the therapist is to give his patients protection if they act independently of their ventriloquist Parents and try to be real people instead of dummies.

这项尝试存在一定风险，如果他胆敢违抗父母的指示，可能需要他人的保护。因此，治疗师的职责之一就是保护他的病人，使他们能够独立于操控他们的“腹语父母”行事，并努力成为真正的人，而不是傀儡。

It should be added that while Parental voices tell him what he can or cannot do, it is Child pictures that tell him what he wants to do. Desires are visual, and directives are auditory.

需要补充的是，父母的声音告诉孩子他能做什么或不能做什么，而孩子的画面则告诉他他想做什么。欲望是视觉的，指令是听觉的。

I • More About the Demon

我 • 关于恶魔的更多信息

All the items mentioned so far are helpful in making the script possible, and most of them are matters beyond the person’s awareness. Now we come to the key item, which not only makes the script possible, but gives it the decisive push. That is the demon who sends Jeder naked on roller skates down the hill to his destruction just when he is on the verge of success, before he even knows what is happening to him. But looking back, even if he has never heard the other voices in his head, he will usually remember that one, the voice of the demon prompting irresistibly: ‘Go ahead and do it!’ Which he does, in the face of all the other forces warning him against it and vainly trying to call him back. This is Daemon, the sudden supernatural push that determines a man’s fate, a voice from the Golden Age, lower than the gods but higher than humanity, perhaps a fallen angel. That is what the historians tell us, and perhaps they are right. For Heraclitus, the Daemon in man was his character. But this Daemon, according to those who have known him or her, the losers who are just picking themselves up from their falls, speaks not in a loud command like the ghost of a mighty god, but in a seductive whisper, like a beckoning woman, like an enchantress: ‘Come, do it. Go ahead. Why not? What have you to lose but everything? Instead you will have me, as you once did in the Golden Age.’

前面提到的所有因素都有助于剧本的创作，而且大多数都超出了当事人的意识范围。现在我们来说说关键因素，它不仅使剧本得以实现，更赋予其决定性的推动力。那就是恶魔，它驱使杰德赤身裸体地穿着旱冰鞋从山坡上滑下，走向毁灭，就在他即将成功之际，甚至在他还没反应过来之前。但回首往事，即便他从未听过脑海中其他的声音，他通常也会记得那个声音，恶魔的声音不可抗拒地催促道：“去做吧！”于是他便去做了，全然不顾其他所有力量的警告和徒劳的劝阻。这就是“恶魔”，决定一个人命运的突如其来的超自然力量，来自黄金时代的声音，低于神明却高于人类，或许是一位堕落天使。历史学家们是这么说的，也许他们是对的。对赫拉克利特而言，人心中的“恶魔”就是人的性格。但据那些认识他/她的人——那些刚刚从失败中爬起来的失败者——所说，这个恶魔说话的方式并非像强大神灵的幽灵那样大声命令，而是像一个招手的女子，一个魅惑的女巫那样低声诱惑：“来吧，去做吧。去做吧。为什么不呢？你除了失去一切还能失去什么？你将拥有我，就像你在黄金时代曾经拥有的那样。”

This is the repetition compulsion which drives men to their doom, the power of death, according to Freud, or the power of the goddess Ananke. But he places it in some mysterious biological sphere, when after all it is only the voice of seduction. Ask the man (or woman) who owns one and knows the power of his demon.

这就是驱使男人走向毁灭的强迫性重复，弗洛伊德称之为死亡的力量，或是女神阿南刻的力量。但他却将其置于某种神秘的生物学范畴，而归根结底，它不过是诱惑的声音。去问问那些拥有这种力量并深知其恶魔威力的人（无论男女）吧。

The remedy against demons has always been cantrips and cantraps, and that is the case here. Every loser should carry it in wallet or purse, and whenever success looms in sight, that is the moment of danger. That is the time to pull it out and read it aloud again and again. Then when the demon whispers ‘Stretch out your arm – and put the whole wad on one last number, or have just one drink, or now is the time to pull your knife, or grab her (him) by the neck and pull her (him) toward you,’ or whatever the losing movement is, pull the arm back and say it loud and clear: ‘But mother, I’d rather do it my own way and win.’

对抗恶魔的良方历来都是咒语和陷阱，这里也不例外。每个失败者都应该把它放在钱包或手提包里，每当成功近在眼前时，危险也随之而来。这时就应该把它拿出来，一遍又一遍地大声朗读。当恶魔低语“伸出你的手臂——把所有的筹码都押在最后一个数字上，或者只喝一杯，或者现在是时候拔出你的刀，或者抓住她（他）的脖子把她（他）拉向你”，或者任何失败的动作时，就把手臂收回来，大声清晰地说：“但是母亲，我宁愿用我自己的方式去赢。”

J • The Real Person

J • 真人

The converse of the script is the real person living in a real world. This real person is probably the real Self, the one which can move from one ego state to another. When people get to know each other well, they penetrate through the script into the depths where this real Self resides, and that is the part of the other person they respect and love, and with which they can have moments of real intimacy before Parental programing takes over again. This is possible because it has happened before in the lives of most people, in the most intimate and script-free relationship of all: that between the mother and her infant. The mother can usually suspend her script during the nursing period if left to her own instincts, and the infant does not yet have one.

剧本的反面是生活在真实世界中的真实个体。这个真实的个体很可能就是真正的自我，一个能够从一种自我状态转换到另一种自我状态的自我。当人们彼此深入了解后，他们就能穿透剧本，直达对方内心深处真正的自我所在。这便是他们尊重和爱慕的那个自我，也是他们能够与之拥有真正亲密时刻的那个自我，直到父母本能再次占据主导。这之所以成为可能，是因为在大多数人的生活中，在最亲密、最不受剧本束缚的关系中，这种经历早已发生过：那就是母亲与婴儿之间的关系。如果让母亲顺从自己的本能，她通常可以在哺乳期暂时放下剧本，而婴儿当时还没有形成自己的本能。

As for myself, I know not whether I am still run by a music roll or not. If I am, I wait with interest and anticipation – and without apprehension – for the next notes to unroll their melody, and for the harmony and discord after that. Where will I go next? In this case my life is meaningful because I am following the long and glorious tradition of my ancestors, passed on to me by my parents, music perhaps sweeter than I could compose myself. Certainly I know that there are large areas where I am free to improvise. It may even be that I am one of the few fortunate people on earth who has cast off the shackles entirely and who calls his own tune. In that case I am a brave improviser facing the world alone. But whether I am faking on a player piano, or striking the chords with the power of my own mind and hands, the song of my life is equally suspenseful and full of surprises as it rolls off the pulsating sounding board of destiny – a barcarole that either way will leave, I hope, happy echoes behind.

至于我自己，我不知道自己是否依然受制于某种音乐的指引。如果是，我会满怀兴趣和期待——而非恐惧——等待下一个音符展开旋律，以及随后的和谐与不和谐。我的下一站将走向何方？在这种情况下，我的生命意义非凡，因为我正传承着先祖们悠久而辉煌的传统，由我的父母传授给我，这音乐或许比我自己谱写的更加动听。当然，我也知道，在广阔的领域里，我可以自由即兴发挥。或许，我是世上为数不多的幸运儿之一，彻底摆脱了束缚，可以自由谱写自己的人生乐章。如果是这样，我就是一位勇敢的即兴演奏者，独自面对这个世界。但无论我是在自动钢琴上假装弹奏，还是用我自己的思想和双手拨动琴弦，我的人生之歌都同样充满悬念和惊喜，如同从命运跳动的音板上滚落下来——一首无论如何都会留下快乐回响的船歌。

注释与参考文献

But compare Kales, et al. ‘Psychophysiological and Biochemical Changes Following Use and Withdrawal of Hypnotics.’ in Sleep: Physiology and Pathology (A. Kales, ed.) J. B. Lippincott & Company, Philadelphia, 1969. Also Rubin, R. T. and Mandell, A. J. ‘Adrenal Cortical Activity in Pathological Emotional States.’ American Journal of Psychiatry , 123: 387–400, 1966.
