#↩

CHAPTER FIFTEEN

第十五章

Transmission of the Script

脚本的传递

A • The Script Matrix

A • 脚本矩阵

The script matrix is a diagram designed to illustrate and analyze the directives handed down from parents and grandparents to the current generation. An enormous amount of information can be compressed very elegantly into this relatively simple drawing. Script matrices were drawn for some of the cases given in Chapters Six and Seven ( Figures 6 , 8 and 9 ) as accurately as the information given would permit. The problem in practice is to separate the decisive parental directives and the decisive patterns of behavior, the script theme, from the ‘noise’ or foreground confusion, which is made doubly difficult because not only the person himself, but all the people around him, contribute as much as they possibly can to these distractions. This tends to conceal the steps leading up to the script’s payoff, the happy or tragic ending, which in the language of biologists 1 is the ‘final display.’ In other words, people take great pains to conceal their scripts from themselves and from others. This is only natural. To return to a previous metaphor, a man sitting in front of a player piano and moving his fingers under the illusion that he is making the music himself does not want somebody telling him to look inside the piano, and the audience, which is enjoying the spectacle, doesn’t want it either.

脚本矩阵是一种图表，旨在阐明和分析父母和祖父母传承给当代人的指令。大量信息可以非常巧妙地压缩到这张相对简单的图表中。第六章和第七章中的一些案例（图6、8和9）都绘制了脚本矩阵，其精确度取决于所提供信息的多少。实践中的难题在于，如何将决定性的父母指令和决定性的行为模式（即脚本主题）与“噪音”或前景混乱区分开来。由于不仅当事人本人，而且他周围的所有人都会尽可能地制造这些干扰，因此这项工作变得尤为困难。这往往会掩盖导致脚本最终实现的步骤，即幸福或悲剧的结局，用生物学术语来说，就是“最终展示”。换句话说，人们会竭尽全力地向自己和他人隐藏他们的脚本。这完全是人之常情。回到之前的比喻，一个人坐在自动钢琴前，手指在钢琴上移动，以为自己在演奏音乐，他肯定不希望有人告诉他要看看钢琴内部，而正在欣赏这场表演的观众也不希望如此。

Steiner, who devised the script matrix, 2 follows the original scheme proposed by the writer, that usually the parent of the opposite sex tells the child what to do, and the parent of the same sex shows him how to do it (Cf. Butch). Steiner made important additions to this basic scheme. He carried it much further by specifying what each ego state in the parents does. He postulates that it is the Child in the parent who gives the injunctions and the Adult in the parent that gives the child his ‘program’ (which we have also called his pattern). And he added a new element, the counterscript, coming from the Parent of the parents. Steiner’s version of the matrix is derived mainly from work with alcoholics, addicts, and ‘sociopaths.’ These all have third-degree, hard, tragic scripts (what he calls ‘hamartic’ scripts). His matrix therefore deals with harsh injunctions from a ‘crazy Child,’ but it can be extended to include seductions and provocations, as well as injunctions that seem to come from the Parent in the parent rather than from the parent’s crazy Child. (Cf. Butch’s matrix, Figure 6 .)

施泰纳设计了脚本矩阵，他遵循了作者最初提出的方案，即通常异性父母告诉孩子该做什么，同性父母则示范如何去做（参见布奇）。施泰纳对这一基本方案进行了重要的补充。他进一步阐述了父母每种自我状态的作用。他假设，父母中的“孩子”发出指令，而父母中的“成人”则赋予孩子“程序”（我们也称之为模式）。他还添加了一个新的元素——反脚本，它来自父母中的“父母”。施泰纳的脚本矩阵版本主要源于他对酗酒者、瘾君子和“反社会人格者”的治疗工作。这些人都有着极其严重、难以改变的悲剧性脚本（他称之为“过错脚本”）。因此，他的矩阵处理的是来自“疯狂孩童”的严厉指令，但它也可以扩展到包括诱惑和挑衅，以及那些似乎来自父母自身而非来自父母疯狂孩童的指令。（参见布奇的矩阵，图 6。）

While there are several questions to be settled in the light of further experience, the setup shown in Figure 8 has been accepted by many people as an interim model, and is certainly of great value in clinical work, as well as in developmental, sociological, and anthropological studies, as will be shown shortly. This ‘standard’ matrix shows the injunctions and provocations coming from the Child of the parents, most commonly from the parent of the opposite sex. If this turns out to be universally true, it will be a crucial discovery concerning human destiny and the transmission of destiny from one generation to another. The most important principle of script theory could then be stated as follows: ‘The parent’s Child forms the Child’s Parent,’ or ‘The child’s Parent is the Parent’s Child.’ 3 This should be easy to understand with the aid of the diagram, remembering that ‘Child’ and ‘Parent’ with capital letters refer to ego states in the head, while ‘parent’ with a small ‘p’ and ‘child’ with a small ‘c’ refer to actual people.

尽管还有一些问题需要根据进一步的经验来解决，但图 8 所示的模型已被许多人接受为一个过渡模型，并且在临床工作以及发展心理学、社会学和人类学研究中无疑具有重要价值，这一点稍后将阐述。这个“标准”矩阵展示了来自父母子女（通常是异性父母）的指令和挑衅。如果这一结论被证实具有普遍性，那将是对人类命运以及命运代际传递的一个关键发现。脚本理论最重要的原则可以表述如下：“父母的孩子构成孩子的父母”，或者“孩子的父母就是父母的孩子”。 3 借助图表，这应该很容易理解，记住大写的“孩子”和“父母”指的是头脑中的自我状态，而小写的“父母”和小写的“孩子”指的是实际的人。

A blank script matrix, such as that shown in Figure 14 , can be painted on a blackboard and put to good use during group-treatment meetings and in teaching script theory. In analyzing an individual case, the parents are first labeled according to the sex of the patient, and then the slogans, patterns, injunctions, and provocations can be filled in with chalk along the arrows. This gives a clear visual representation of the decisive script transactions, and results in a diagram similar to Figures 6 , 8 and 9 . With the help of such a device, it will soon be found that the script matrix says things that have never been said before.

如图 14 所示，空白的脚本矩阵可以绘制在黑板上，并在小组治疗会议和脚本理论教学中得到充分利用。在分析个案时，首先根据患者的性别标记父母，然后沿着箭头用粉笔填写口号、模式、指令和挑衅性语句。这样就能清晰地呈现关键的脚本互动，最终得到类似于图 6、图 8 和图 9 的图表。借助这种方法，人们很快就会发现脚本矩阵揭示了许多以前从未被提及的内容。

People with good scripts may be interested in script analysis only in an academic way, unless they are going to be therapists. But with patients, in order to get them well, it is necessary to dissect out the directives in as pure a form as possible, and drawing an accurate script matrix is a useful tool in planning treatment.

拥有出色脚本能力的人可能只会出于学术目的对脚本分析感兴趣，除非他们打算成为治疗师。但对于患者而言，为了帮助他们康复，必须尽可能地剖析指令的本质，而绘制精确的脚本矩阵是制定治疗方案的有效工具。

The most likely way to elicit the information for filling in the script matrix is to ask the patient the following four questions: (a) What was your parents’ favorite slogan or precept? This will give the key to the antiscript. (b) What kind of life did your parents lead? This will best be answered by a long association with the patient. Whatever his parents taught him to do, he will do again and again, and the patter will give him his ordinary social character: ‘He’s a heavy drinker.’ ‘She’s a sexy girl.’ (c) What is your Parental Prohibition? This is the most important single question for understanding the behavior of the patient and for planning the decisive intervention which will free him to live more fully. Since his symptoms are a substitute for the prohibited act, and also a protest against it, as demonstrated by Freud, freedom from the prohibition will also tend to cure his symptoms. It takes experience and subtlety to pick out the decisive parental injunction from the ‘background noise.’ The most reliable clues are offered by the fourth question, (d) What did you have to do to make your parents smile or chuckle? This gives the come-on, which is the alternative to the prohibited behavior.

要获取填写脚本矩阵所需的信息，最有效的方法是询问患者以下四个问题：（a）您父母最喜欢的口号或格言是什么？这将揭示反脚本的关键。（b）您的父母过着怎样的生活？这个问题最好通过与患者长期相处来解答。无论父母教他做什么，他都会反复去做，而这些模式会塑造他普通的社会性格：“他是个酒鬼。”“她是个性感女孩。”（c）您的父母禁止您做什么？这是理解患者行为以及制定决定性干预措施以使其能够更充分地生活的关键问题。正如弗洛伊德所论证的，由于患者的症状既是对被禁止行为的替代，也是对被禁止行为的一种抗议，因此，摆脱这种禁止也有助于治愈他的症状。要从“背景噪音”中辨别出父母真正想要传达的禁令，需要经验和技巧。最可靠的线索来自第四个问题：（d）你做了什么才能让父母微笑或开怀大笑？这个问题暗示了父母的暗示，也就是被禁止行为的替代方案。

Steiner believes that the prohibition in the case of ‘alcoholics’ is ‘Don’t think!’ and that drinking heavily is one program for not thinking. 4 The absence of thinking is well shown in the drinking platitudes common among ‘Alcoholic’ players and their sympathizers, and even more so by the ones they foist on each other in ‘alcoholic’ group therapy. 5 What these all say is that ‘alcoholics’ are not real people and should not be treated like real people, which is not true. Heroin is even more addictive and sinister than alcohol, and Synanon has proved conclusively that heroin addicts are real people. The real person emerges in both cases after the alcohol or heroin addict cuts off the seductive voices in his head which are urging him to continue his habit, reinforced in due time by physical demands. It appears that tranquilizers and phenothiazines are effective partly because they smother the Parental voices which are keeping the Child agitated or making him confused with their ‘Don’ts’ and ‘Ha Ha’s.’

施泰纳认为，对于“酗酒者”来说，禁忌就是“不要思考！”，而酗酒正是逃避思考的一种方式。这种逃避思考的状态在“酗酒者”及其同情者之间常见的饮酒陈词滥调中体现得淋漓尽致，在“酗酒者”团体治疗中，他们互相灌输的那些陈词滥调更是印证了这一点。所有这些都表明，“酗酒者”并非真正的人，不应该被当作真正的人来对待，但这并非事实。海洛因比酒精更具成瘾性和危害性，而锡安农（Synanon）已经确凿地证明，海洛因成瘾者也是真正的人。无论是酒精成瘾者还是海洛因成瘾者，当他们切断脑海中那些诱惑他们继续沉迷于酒精或海洛因的声音（这些声音最终会因生理需求而得到强化）之后，他们才能展现出真实的自我。镇静剂和吩噻嗪类药物之所以有效，部分原因是它们压制了父母的声音，这些声音让孩子感到烦躁不安，或者用他们的“禁止”和“哈哈”让孩子感到困惑。

FIGURE 14

图 14

In short, then, what is needed to fill in the blank matrix in Figure 14 so that it will look like the completed ones in Figures 6 , 8 and 9 , is a Prescription or Inspiration (PI), a Pattern or Program of Instruction (AI), and a Parental Prohibition or Injunction (CI), along with whatever Provocations (CP) can be elicited.

简而言之，要使图 14 中的空白矩阵看起来像图 6、图 8 和图 9 中完成的矩阵一样，需要的是处方或灵感 (PI)、教学模式或方案 (AI) 和家长禁止或禁令 (CI)，以及任何可以引发的挑衅 (CP)。

The most forceful script directives are given during the family drama ( Chapter Three ), which in some respects reinforces what the parents have been saying, and in others demonstrates that they are hypocritical impostors. It is these scenes which bring home in the most poignant way what the parents want the child to learn about his script. And it should be remembered that loudly spoken words have just as profound and enduring an effect as so-called ‘nonverbal communication.’ 6

最有力的剧本指示出现在家庭剧（第三章）中，这在某些方面强化了父母之前所说的话，而在另一些方面则揭示了他们的虚伪和冒名顶替。正是这些场景以最深刻的方式，将父母希望孩子了解的关于他自身剧本的信息展现出来。我们应该记住，大声说出的话语与所谓的“非语言交流”一样，具有深刻而持久的影响。

B • The Family Parade

B • 家庭游行

The script matrices in Chapters Six and Seven show how the main elements of the script apparatus – the Parental precepts, the Adult patterns, and the Child script controls – were transmitted from the two parents to their offspring. Figure 7 shows in more detail how the most important element, the injunction, is transmitted to Jeder from one of his parents, usually the parent of the opposite sex. All this is good preparation for studying Figure 15 , which shows how an injunction may be transmitted from one generation to another. Such a series is called a ‘family parade.’ Here five generations are linked by the same injunction.

第六章和第七章的脚本矩阵展示了脚本机制的主要要素——父母的戒律、成人的模式和儿童的脚本控制——是如何从父母传递给子女的。图7更详细地展示了最重要的要素——训诫——是如何从父母中的一方（通常是异性父母）传递给杰德的。所有这些都为学习图15做好了充分的准备，图15展示了训诫是如何从一代传递到另一代的。这样的序列被称为“家族传承”。在这里，五代人通过同一条训诫联系在一起。

The situation shown in Figure 15 is not at all uncommon. The patient has heard or seen how grandmother was a loser; she knows very well that her father was a loser; she is in treatment because she is a loser; her son is going to the clinic because he is a loser; and her granddaughter is already showing signs at school that she is going to be a loser, too. Both the patient and the therapist know that this five-generation chain must be broken somewhere or it may go on indefinitely for more generations. This is a good incentive for the patient to get well, fn1 since if she does she can withdraw her injunction to her son, which she is probably reinforcing, in spite of herself, every time they meet. That will make it much easier for him to get well, which should have a beneficial effect on the whole future of the granddaughter, and presumably on her children, too.

图 15 所示的情况并非罕见。患者听说或亲眼目睹了祖母的失败经历；她非常清楚自己的父亲也是个失败者；她接受治疗是因为她觉得自己是个失败者；她的儿子去诊所也是因为他觉得自己是个失败者；而她的孙女在学校里也已经显露出将来也会成为失败者的迹象。患者和治疗师都明白，这五代人的恶性循环必须被打破，否则就会无限延续下去。这对患者来说是一个很好的康复动力，因为如果她康复了，她就可以撤销对儿子的禁令——尽管她可能每次见到儿子时都会不自觉地强化这种禁令。这将大大有助于她的儿子康复，从而对孙女的未来，乃至她的后代，都产生积极的影响。

One effect of marriage should be to dilute the injunctions and provocations, since husband and wife come from different backgrounds and will give different directives to their children. Actually, the results are the same as with their genes. If a winner marries a winner (as winners tend to do), their offspring may be even more of a winner. If a loser marries a loser (as losers tend to do), their offspring may be even more of a loser. If there is a mixture, the result will be mixed. And there is always the possibility of a throwback either way.

婚姻的一个作用应该是淡化父母之间的戒律和冲突，因为夫妻双方来自不同的背景，会给子女不同的教导。实际上，结果与基因的影响类似。如果成功者与成功者结婚（成功者往往会这样做），他们的后代可能更加成功。如果失败者与失败者结婚（失败者往往会这样做），他们的后代可能更加失败。如果双方结合，结果自然也会是混合的。而且，无论哪种情况，都存在基因倒退的可能性。

C • Cultural Transmission

C • 文化传承

Figure 16 illustrates the transmission of precepts, patterns, and controls through five generations. In this case we are fortunate enough to have the information bearing on a ‘good’ or winning script instead of a ‘bad’ or losing one. This life plan may be called ‘My Son the Doctor,’ and we have taken as our example the hereditary medicine man of a small jungle village in the South Seas. The explanation is as follows:

图 16 展示了戒律、模式和控制方法在五代人间的传承。幸运的是，我们掌握的信息与“好”的或成功的模式有关，而非“坏”的或失败的模式。这种人生规划可以称为“我的儿子是医生”，我们以南太平洋一个丛林小村庄的世袭巫医为例。解释如下：

FIGURE 15

图15

We start off with a father and a mother. Father, in generation 5, was born about 1860, and married the daughter of a chief. Their son, generation 4, was born about 1885, and did likewise. Their son, in generation 3, was born in 1910, and followed the same script. His son, in generation 2, born in 1935, followed a slightly different pattern. Instead of becoming a hereditary medicine man, he went to the medical school in Suva, Fiji, and became what was then known as a Native Medical Assistant. He, too, married a daughter of a chief, and their son, in generation 1, born in 1960, plans to follow in his father’s footsteps, except that due to historical developments he will be called an Assistant Medical Officer, or he might even go to London and become a fullfledged Medical Officer. Thus the son in each generation becomes the father (F) of the next generation, and his wife becomes the mother (M).

我们从一对父母开始。父亲，第五代，生于约1860年，娶了一位酋长的女儿。他们的儿子，第四代，生于约1885年，也做了同样的事情。他们的儿子，第三代，生于1910年，也遵循了同样的模式。他的儿子，第二代，生于1935年，遵循了略有不同的模式。他没有成为世袭的巫医，而是去了斐济苏瓦的医学院，成为了当时所谓的土著医疗助理。他也娶了一位酋长的女儿，他们的儿子，第一代，生于1960年，计划追随父亲的脚步，但由于历史的发展，他可能会被称为助理医务官，或者他甚至可能会去伦敦成为一名正式的医务官。因此，每一代的儿子都成为下一代的父亲（F），他的妻子则成为下一代的母亲（M）。

Each father and mother give the same precept or inspiration from the Parent in them to the Parent in their son: ‘Be a good medicine man.’ The father’s Adult transmits to his son’s Adult the secrets of his trade, which of course are not known to the mother. But the mother does know what she wants her son to do; in fact, she knew from her earliest years that she would want her son to be either a chief or a medicine man. Since he is obviously going to be the latter, she transmits from her Child to his Child (from her early childhood decision to him in his early years) the benevolent come-on, ‘Be a winner as a medicine man.’

父母双方都从自身内在的“父母”层面，向儿子内在的“父母”层面传递着同样的教诲或灵感：“成为一名优秀的巫医。”父亲的“成年”会将他技艺的秘密传授给儿子的“成年”，而这些秘密母亲自然无从知晓。但母亲却清楚自己希望儿子做什么；事实上，她从幼年起就知道自己希望儿子成为酋长或巫医。既然他显然会成为后者，她便将自己幼年时的决定传递给儿子的“孩子”，也就是儿子幼年时她对儿子的善意鼓励：“成为一名成功的巫医。”

In this case ( Figure 16 ) the family parade of Figure 15 is shown in a more complete form. It can be seen that father’s precepts and father’s program of instruction form two parallel lines going straight down the generations from 1860 to 1960. Mother’s precepts and mother’s injunctions (‘Don’t fail’) are also parallel, and come in from the side in each generation. This neatly demonstrates the transmission of ‘culture’ over a period of one hundred years. Similar diagrams could be drawn for any element of ‘culture’ or any ‘role’ in the village society.

如图16所示，图15中的家庭传承图以更完整的形式呈现。可以看出，父亲的教诲和教导体系构成两条平行线，从1860年到1960年，代代相传。母亲的教诲和训诫（“不要失败”）也与之平行，从每一代的侧面延伸而来。这清晰地展现了“文化”在一百年间的传承。类似的图表可以用于展示“文化”的任何要素或乡村社会中的任何“角色”。

FIGURE 16

图16

In a family parade of daughters, whose roles might be ‘mothers of successful medicine men,’ the diagram would look exactly the same except that the Ms and Fs would switch places. In a village where uncles or mothers-in-law were important influences on the children’s scripts, the diagram might be more complicated, but the principle would be the same.

在一个女儿辈出的家族中，她们的角色可能是“成功巫医的母亲”，那么图表看起来会完全相同，只是“女士”和“女性”的位置互换了。在一个叔伯或婆婆对孩子剧本影响很大的村庄里，图表可能会更复杂，但原理是一样的。

It should be noted that in this parade of winners, the scripts and antiscripts coincide, which is the best way to insure a winner. But if mother 3, for example, happened to be the daughter of an alcoholic chief, she might give her son a bad script injunction. Then there would be trouble, since there would be a conflict between his antiscript and his script. While her Parent was telling him to be a good medicine man, her Child might show fascination and glee when she told the boy stories about the stupidity and drinking prowess of his grandfather. Then he might get thrown out of Medical School for drunkenness, and spend the rest of his life playing ‘Alcoholic,’ with his disappointed father playing ‘Persecutor’ and his nostalgic mother playing ‘Rescuer.’ fn2

值得注意的是，在这场赢家的游行中，剧本和反剧本相吻合，这是确保成功的最佳方式。但例如，如果母亲3恰好是一位酗酒酋长的女儿，她可能会给儿子一个糟糕的剧本禁令。这样一来，就会出现问题，因为他的反剧本和剧本之间就会产生冲突。当她的母亲教导他要成为一名优秀的医生时，当她给儿子讲述他祖父的愚蠢和酗酒的故事时，孩子可能会表现出极大的兴趣和喜悦。然后，他可能会因为酗酒而被医学院开除，余生都在扮演“酗酒者”的角色，而他失望的父亲则扮演“迫害者”，他怀旧的母亲则扮演“拯救者”。

D • The Influence of the Grandparents

D • 祖父母的影响

The most intricate part of script analysis in clinical practice is tracing back the influence of the grandparents. This is illustrated in Figure 17 , which is a more detailed version of Figure 7 . There it can be seen that PC in mother is split into two parts, FPC and MPC. FPC represents the influence of her father when she was very little (Father Parent in her Child) and MPC represents the influence of her mother (Mother Parent in her Child). This split may look complicated and impractical at first sight, but it is not so to anyone accustomed to thinking in terms of ego states. For example, it does not take very long for patients to learn to distinguish between FPC and MPC in themselves. ‘When I was little, father liked to make me cry, and mother dressed me in a sexy way,’ said the weepy, pretty prostitute. ‘Father liked me to be bright and mother liked to dress me up,’ said the bright, well-dressed psychologist. ‘Father said girls were no good and mother dressed me like a tomboy,’ said the frightened beatnik in her boyish clothes. Each of these women knew very well when her behavior was guided by father’s early influence (FPC) or mother’s (MPC).When they were weepy, bright, or frightened, they were doing it for father, and when they looked sexy, well dressed, or tomboyish, they were following mother’s instructions.

临床实践中，脚本分析最复杂的部分在于追溯祖父母的影响。图17对此进行了说明，它是图7的更详细版本。图中可见，母亲的PC被分为两部分：FPC和MPC。FPC代表她幼年时期父亲的影响（父亲对孩子的影响），MPC代表她母亲的影响（母亲对孩子的影响）。这种划分乍看之下可能复杂且不切实际，但对于习惯于从自我状态角度思考的人来说并非如此。例如，患者很快就能学会区分自身存在的FPC和MPC。“我小时候，爸爸喜欢逗我哭，妈妈喜欢把我打扮得性感，”爱哭的漂亮妓女说道。“爸爸喜欢我聪明，妈妈喜欢把我打扮得漂漂亮亮的，”聪明、衣着得体的心理学家说道。 “爸爸说女孩子没用，妈妈就把我打扮得像个假小子，”穿着男装、惊恐万分的嬉皮士说道。这些女性都非常清楚自己的行为是受父亲早期影响（FPC）还是母亲早期影响（MPC）所引导。当她们哭泣、神采奕奕或惊恐不安时，她们是在迎合父亲；而当她们打扮性感、衣着得体或像个假小子时，她们则是在遵循母亲的指示。

Now remembering the tendency for the script controls to come from the parent of the opposite sex, FPC in mother is her electrode, and MPC in father is his ( Figure 10 again). Thus, mother’s script commands to Jeder come from her father, and so it can be said that ‘Jeder’s script programing comes from his maternal grandfather.’ Father’s commands to Zoe come from his mother, so Zoe’s script programing comes from her paternal grandmother. The electrode, then, is mother (grandfather) in Jeder’s head, and in the case of Zoe, father (grandmother) in her head. Applying this to the three cases above, the prostitute’s grandmother married and divorced several mean husbands, the psychologist’s grandmother was a well-known writer, and the tomboy’s grandmother was a crusader for women’s rights.

现在回想一下，脚本控制往往来自异性父母，母亲的FPC电极代表她的电极，父亲的MPC电极代表他的父亲（再次见图10）。因此，母亲对Jeder的脚本指令来自她的父亲，所以可以说“Jeder的脚本程序来自他的外祖父”。父亲对Zoe的指令来自他的母亲，所以Zoe的脚本程序来自她的祖母。那么，Jeder脑海中的电极是母亲（外祖父），而Zoe的电极则是父亲（外祖母）。将此应用于上述三个案例，妓女的祖母结过几次婚又离了几次婚，心理学家的祖母是一位知名作家，假小子的祖母是一位女权运动的倡导者。

FIGURE 17

图 17

It can now be understood why the family parade diagramed in Figure 15 alternated generations between the sexes – grandmother, father, female patient, son, and granddaughter. Figure 16 , on the other hand, illustrates how such a diagram can be adjusted to follow straight down the line with either male descendants or female descendants. It is just because of this kind of versatility that the script-matrix diagram is such a valuable instrument. It has properties which even its originator did not suspect. Here it offers a simplified method for helping to understand such complex matters as family histories, the transmission of culture, and the psychological influence of grandparents.

现在我们可以理解为什么图 15 所示的家族谱系图会交替呈现性别世代——祖母、父亲、女性患者、儿子和孙女。而图 16 则展示了如何调整这种谱系图，使其能够沿着直线排列，分别代表男性后代或女性后代。正是这种灵活性使得脚本矩阵图成为如此宝贵的工具。它甚至拥有其发明者都未曾预料到的特性。在这里，它提供了一种简化的方法，帮助我们理解诸如家族史、文化传承以及祖父母的心理影响等复杂问题。

E • Overscripting

E • 过度编写

There are two requirements for the transmission of the script. Jeder must be able, ready, and willing or even eager to accept it, and his parents must want to pass it on.

剧本传承有两个条件：杰德必须能够、准备好、并且愿意甚至渴望接受它；他的父母也必须愿意将它传承下去。

On Jeder’s side, he is able because his nervous system is constructed for the purpose of being programed, to receive sensory and social stimuli and organize them into patterns which will regulate his behavior. As his body and his mind mature, he becomes readier and readier for more and more complex types of programing. And he is willing to accept it because he needs ways to structure his time and organize his activities. In fact he is not only willing, he is eager, because he is more than a passive computer. Like most animals, he has a craving for ‘closure,’ the need to finish what he begins; and beyond that, he has the great human aspiration for purpose.

杰德之所以能够做到这一点，是因为他的神经系统天生就适合被编程，能够接收感官和社会刺激，并将它们组织成模式来调节自己的行为。随着身心发育成熟，他越来越能接受越来越复杂的编程。他乐于接受，因为他需要方法来安排自己的时间和活动。事实上，他不仅乐于接受，而且非常渴望，因为他不仅仅是一台被动的计算机。像大多数动物一样，他渴望“完成”，需要把开始的事情做完；除此之外，他还拥有人类对意义的强烈追求。

Starting off with random movements, he ends up knowing what to say after he says Hello. At first he is content with instrumental responses, and they become goals in themselves: incorporation, elimination, intrusion, and locomotion, to use Erikson’s terms. Here we find the beginnings of Adult craftsmanship, his pleasure in the act and its successful completion: getting the food safely off the spoon and into his mouth, walking on his own across the floor. Initially his goal is to walk, then it is to walk to something. Once he walks to people, he has to know what to do after he gets there. At first they smile and hug him, and all he has to do is be, or at most, cuddle. They expect nothing from him beyond getting there. Later they do expect something, so he learns to say Hello. After a while, that is not enough either, and they expect more. So he learns to offer them various stimuli in order to get their responses in return. Thus, he is eternally grateful (believe it or not) to his parents for giving him a pattern: how to approach people in such a way as to get the desired responses. This is structure hunger, pattern hunger, and in the long run, script hunger. So the script is accepted because Jeder is script hungry.

起初，他只是随意地移动，后来，在说了“你好”之后，他终于知道该说什么了。起初，他满足于工具性的反应，这些反应本身也成为了目标：用埃里克森的术语来说，就是吸收、消除、侵入和移动。在这里，我们看到了成人技艺的萌芽，他享受着行为本身以及成功完成行为的乐趣：安全地把食物从勺子上取下来放进嘴里，独自在地板上行走。最初，他的目标是行走，后来是走向某个地方。一旦他走向人群，他就必须知道到达那里之后该做什么。起初，人们会对他微笑并拥抱他，他只需要陪伴，或者最多是拥抱一下。除了到达那里之外，他们对他没有任何其他期望。后来，他们开始有所期待，于是他学会了说“你好”。过了一段时间，这仍然不够，他们期待更多。所以他学会了提供各种刺激，以获得他们的回应。因此，他（信不信由你）永远感激父母为他树立了榜样：如何与人相处才能获得想要的回应。这就是对结构、模式的渴望，从长远来看，是对剧本的渴望。所以，杰德接受了剧本，因为他渴望剧本。

On the parents’ side, they are able, ready, and willing because of what has been built into them through eons of evolution: a desire to nurture, protect, and teach their offspring, a desire which can only be suppressed by the most powerful inner and outer forces. But beyond that, if they themselves have been properly ‘scripted,’ they are not only willing, but eager, and derive great enjoyment from child-rearing.

父母一方之所以能够、准备好并且乐意为之，是因为亿万年的进化将养育、保护和教育子女的本能融入了他们的内心，这种本能只有最强大的内在和外在力量才能压制。不仅如此，如果他们自身也得到了正确的“引导”，他们不仅愿意，而且充满热情，并从养育子女的过程中获得极大的乐趣。

Some parents, however, are overly eager. Child-rearing for them is neither a drag nor a joy, but a compulsion. In particular, their need to pass on precepts, patterns, and controls far exceeds the children’s needs for such parental programing. This compulsion is a rather complex affair, dividing roughly into three aspects. (1) A desire for immortality. (2) The demands of the parents’ own scripts, which may range from ‘Don’t make any mistakes,’ to ‘Mess up your children.’ (3) The desire of the parents to get rid of their own script controls, and pass them on to someone else so as to be free themselves. Of course this extrajection doesn’t work, and so the attempt has to be made over and over.

然而，有些父母却过于热衷于此。对他们而言，养育子女既非负担也非乐趣，而是一种强迫。尤其值得注意的是，他们想要将各种准则、模式和行为规范传递给孩子的需求，远远超过了孩子对这类父母教化的需求。这种强迫症相当复杂，大致可以分为三个方面：（1）对永生的渴望；（2）父母自身行为准则的要求，这些准则可能从“不要犯任何错误”到“把你的孩子教坏”不等；（3）父母渴望摆脱自身行为准则的控制，并将它们传递给他人，从而获得自由。当然，这种外推是行不通的，因此他们必须反复尝试。

These continuous assaults on the child’s psyche are well known to child psychiatrists and family therapists, who call them by various names. From the point of view of script analysis, they are a form of ‘overscripting,’ and the excessive directives which are laid on the child, and surfeit him far beyond the cravings of his script hunger, may be called his episcript or overscript. Usually his reaction is to ward them off by some form of repudiation, but he may follow his parents’ policy and attempt to pass them on to someone else. For this reason, the episcript has been described by Fanita English 7 as a Hot Potato, and the continual attempts to pass it back and forth she calls the Hot Potato Game.

这些对儿童心理的持续冲击，儿童精神科医生和家庭治疗师都非常熟悉，他们用不同的名称来称呼它们。从脚本分析的角度来看，它们是一种“过度脚本化”，强加给孩子的过多指令，远远超出了孩子对脚本的渴望，可以称之为“超脚本”或“过度脚本”。通常，孩子的反应是通过某种形式的拒绝来抵御这些指令，但他也可能效仿父母的做法，试图将它们转嫁给其他人。因此，范妮塔·英格利希（Fanita English）将超脚本比作烫手山芋，而她将不断传递超脚本的行为称为“烫手山芋游戏”。

As she points out in her original paper on this subject, all sorts of people play this game, including therapists, and she gives the example of Joe, a psychology student, whose script payoff from his mother was: ‘Get locked up in a madhouse.’ Thus, he was in the habit of picking for his inept therapeutic attempts people who were good candidates for the state hospital, and he managed to help them along the way. Fortunately his supervisor observed his scripty smile whenever one of his patients verged on a breakdown, and put a stop to the whole procedure by persuading him to give up psychology, go into a business career, and seek treatment for himself. His script payoff was an episcript or ‘hot potato’ of his mother’s, who had spent her life trying ‘to stay out of the madhouse,’ as she frequently said. She received the directive to get locked up from one of her parents, and tried to get rid of it by passing it on to Joe, who in turn tried to pass it on to his patients.

正如她在关于此主题的原始论文中所指出的，各种各样的人都会玩这种游戏，包括治疗师。她举了心理学学生乔的例子，乔从他母亲那里得到的“剧本回报”是：“被关进疯人院”。因此，他习惯于挑选那些很可能被送进州立医院的人来做他拙劣的治疗，并且成功地帮助他们。幸运的是，他的导师注意到每当他的病人濒临崩溃时，他都会露出那种刻板的笑容，于是劝他放弃心理学，转行经商，并寻求自己的治疗，从而终止了整个治疗过程。他的“剧本回报”是他母亲留下的“烫手山芋”，他的母亲一生都在努力“远离疯人院”，正如她常说的那样。她从父母那里得到了“被关起来”的指示，并试图通过把它转交给乔来摆脱它，而乔又试图把它转交给他的病人。

Thus the parents transmit the script as part of their normal parenting, to nurture, protect, and encourage their children by showing them, to the best of their ability, how to live life. Overscripting may arise from various causes. The most pathological is an attempt to get rid of an episcript by passing it on to one of the children. The episcript, especially if it is a ‘hamartic’ or tragic one, becomes a hot potato which no one wants to hold on to. As English points out, it is the Professor, the Adult in the Child, who says: ‘Who needs it?’ and decides that it can be got rid of, like a curse in a fairy tale, by passing it on to someone else.

因此，父母在正常的育儿过程中会传递这些脚本，尽其所能地向孩子展示如何生活，以此来养育、保护和鼓励他们。过度脚本化可能由多种原因造成。最病态的情况是试图通过将其传递给某个孩子来摆脱某种脚本。这种脚本，尤其是当它是“过失的”或悲剧性的脚本时，就会变成烫手山芋，无人愿意接手。正如英格利希所指出的，是孩子内心深处的“教授”，也就是“孩子身上的成人”，会说：“谁需要它？”然后决定像童话故事里的诅咒一样，把它转交给别人，从而摆脱它。

F • Blending of the Script Directives

F • 脚本指令的融合

As the years go by and the script becomes adapted by experience, the controls, patterns, and prescriptions become blended so that it is hard to distinguish one from the other in the person’s behavior, and to determine which is a ‘final common pathway.’ He adopts a program or routine which synthesizes them all. The major script payoffs occur in the form of a ‘final display.’ If the payoff is a bad one, the script elements may be quite apparent to an experienced observer, as in cases of psychosis, delirium tremens, car-crashing, suicide, or murder. With good payoffs, it is more difficult to dissect out the script directives, partly because in such cases there are usually extensive permissions granted by the parents, which may obscure the directives.

随着岁月流逝，经验不断磨砺，行为模式、控制手段和行为准则逐渐融合，难以在个体的行为中区分彼此，也难以确定哪一种才是“最终的共同路径”。个体最终会形成一套综合所有这些要素的程序或惯例。主要的行为准则的执行往往以“最终表现”的形式呈现。如果执行结果不佳，经验丰富的观察者或许能够清晰地辨别出其中的准则要素，例如精神病、震颤性谵妄、车祸、自杀或谋杀等情况。而如果执行结果良好，则更难剖析出准则的指令，部分原因是父母通常会给予广泛的许可，这可能会掩盖准则的真正含义。

Consider the following real-life romance, taken from a news item in a small town newspaper:

以下是一段根据小镇报纸新闻报道改编的真实爱情故事：

ROMANTIC HISTORY IS REPEATED IN THE X FAMILY

X家族的浪漫故事正在重演

Fifty years ago an Australian soldier went to England to serve in the First World War. His name was John X, and he met and married Jane Y. After the war was over, they came to America to live. Twenty-five years later, their three children were vacationing in England. Tom X, their son, married Mary Z, of Great Snoring, Norfolk, and his two sisters married Englishmen. This fall, Tom and Mary X’s daughter, Jane, who spent her vacation in Great Snoring with an aunt, announced her engagement to Harry J, also of Great Snoring. Jane is a graduate of our local high school. After their marriage, the couple plan to live in Australia.

五十年前，一位名叫约翰·X的澳大利亚士兵前往英国参加第一次世界大战。他在那里遇到了简·Y，并与她结为夫妻。战后，他们来到美国定居。二十五年后，他们的三个孩子在英国度假。他们的儿子汤姆·X娶了诺福克郡大斯诺林镇的玛丽·Z，他的两个妹妹也嫁给了英国人。今年秋天，汤姆和玛丽·X的女儿简在大斯诺林镇的姑姑家度假期间，宣布与同样来自大斯诺林镇的哈里·J订婚。简毕业于我们当地的高中。婚后，这对新人计划定居澳大利亚。

It is an interesting exercise to try to dissect out the probable precepts, patterns, controls, and permissions that were passed down from John X and his wife Jane, through Tom and Mary, to the granddaughter, Jane.

尝试剖析约翰·X 和他的妻子简，通过汤姆和玛丽，传给孙女简的可能准则、模式、控制和许可，是一项有趣的练习。

It should be noted that script programing is a natural happening like the growth of weeds and flowers, and takes place without regard to morals or consequences. Sometimes script and antiscript feed into each other with the most dire results. The Parental directives may give the Child a license to inflict enormous damage on other people. Historically, such unfortunate combinations have given rise to leaders of wars, crusades, and massacres, and on a more individual level, to political assassinations. Mother’s Parent is saying ‘Be good!’ and ‘Be famous!’ while her Child is directing: ‘Kill everybody!’ Father’s Adult then shows the boy how to kill people, by teaching him how to handle guns, in civilized countries, and knives, in uncivilized ones.

需要注意的是，脚本编程是一种自然现象，如同杂草和鲜花的生长，它不考虑道德或后果。有时，脚本和反脚本相互影响，会造成极其严重的后果。父母的指令可能会赋予孩子对他人造成巨大伤害的特权。历史上，这种不幸的组合催生了战争、十字军东征和屠杀的领导者，在更具体的层面上，也催生了政治暗杀。母亲的父母角色说着“要善良！”和“要出名！”，而她的孩子却在指示：“杀光所有人！”父亲的成年人角色随后会向男孩展示如何杀人，在文明国家教他如何使用枪支，在不文明国家教他如何使用刀具。

Most people spend their lives comfortably embedded in their script matrices. It is a bed which their parents made for them and to which they have added a few trimmings of their own. It may have bugs in it and be lumpy, too, but it is their very own and they have been accustomed to it since their earliest years, and so, few people are willing to trade it in for something better built and more adapted to their circumstances. Matrix, after all, is just Latin for mother’s womb, and the script is as close and cozy as they can get once they have forever left the real thing. But for those who do decide to strike out for themselves, and say ‘Mother, I’d rather do it my own way,’ there are several possibilities. If they are lucky, mother herself may have included a reasonable release or spellbreaker in the matrix, in which case they may do it on their own. Another way is for their friends and intimates and life itself to help, but this is rare. The third way is through competent script analysis, from which they may get permission to put their own shows on the road.

大多数人安然地生活在自己的剧本矩阵中。这就像父母为他们铺好的床，他们自己也添置了一些装饰。它或许有些瑕疵，也可能凹凸不平，但它是他们自己的，他们从小就习惯了，因此，很少有人愿意用它去换取更坚固、更适合自己境遇的东西。毕竟，“矩阵”在拉丁语中就是“母亲的子宫”的意思，而剧本就是他们离开真实世界后所能找到的最亲近、最舒适的归宿。但对于那些决定独立自主，对母亲说“我宁愿按自己的方式生活”的人来说，有几种可能性。如果他们幸运的话，母亲可能在他们的剧本矩阵中预留了合理的解脱或破除咒语的途径，在这种情况下，他们或许可以独自完成。另一种方法是寻求朋友、亲人和生活本身的帮助，但这很少见。第三种方法是通过专业的剧本分析，他们或许能从中获得许可，开始自己的人生旅程。

G • Summary

G • 摘要

The script matrix is a diagram designed to illustrate and analyze the directives handed down from the parents and grandparents to the current generation. These will, in the long run, determine the person’s life plan and his final payoff. Current information indicates that the most decisive controls come from the Child ego state of the parent of the opposite sex. The Adult ego state of the parent of the same sex then gives the person a pattern which determines his interests and life course while he is carrying out his life plan. Meanwhile, both parents, through their Parental ego states, give him prescriptions, inspirations, or slogans which set up his counterscript. The counterscript occupies lulls in the forward movement of the script. If he makes appropriate moves, it may take over and suppress the script. The following table (from Steiner’s findings) 4 illustrates the elements in the case of one man with an ‘Alcoholic’ script. The first column gives the active ego state in each parent. The letters in parentheses give the receiving ego state in the protagonist, and the next two show the type of directive. The last two columns are self-explanatory.

脚本矩阵是一个图表，旨在阐明和分析父母和祖父母传承给当代人的指令。从长远来看，这些指令将决定一个人的人生规划及其最终结果。现有信息表明，最具决定性的控制因素来自异性父母的“儿童”自我状态。同性父母的“成人”自我状态则为个体提供了一种模式，这种模式决定了个体在执行人生规划时的兴趣和人生轨迹。与此同时，父母双方都通过各自的“父母”自我状态，给予个体处方、灵感或口号，从而构建出其反脚本。反脚本会在脚本前进的间隙出现。如果个体采取适当的行动，反脚本可能会接管并抑制脚本。下表（来自施泰纳的研究成果） 4 展示了一位拥有“酗酒者”脚本的男性的案例要素。第一列列出了父母双方的活跃自我状态。括号内的字母表示主人公的接收自我状态，接下来的两列表示指令类型。最后两列的含义不言自明。

Mother’s Child (C)
母亲的孩子 (C) 		Injunctions and Come-ons
禁令与催告 		Script
脚本 		‘Don’t Think, Drink.’
“别想，喝酒。”
Father’s Adult (A)
父亲的成年人（A） 		Program (Pattern)
程序（模式） 		Life Course
生命历程 		‘Drink and Work.’
“边喝酒边工作。”
Both Parents (P)
父母双方 (P) 		Prescription (Slogans)
处方（口号） 		Counterscript
反脚本 		‘Work Hard.’
“努力工作。”

Even if the origins (but probably not the insertions) of the script directives vary in individual cases, the script matrix nevertheless remains one of the most useful and cogent diagrams in the history of science, compressing, as it does, the whole plan for a human life and its ultimate destiny into a simple, easily understood, and easily checked design, which also indicates how to change it.

即使脚本指令的起源（但插入方式可能不同）因具体情况而异，脚本矩阵仍然是科学史上最有用、最清晰的图表之一，因为它将人类生活及其最终命运的整个计划压缩成一个简单、易于理解和易于检查的设计，并且还指明了如何改变它。

H • Responsibility of the Parents

H • 父母的责任

The dynamic slogan of transactional and script analysis is ‘Think sphincter.’ Their clinical principle is to observe every movement of every muscle of every patient at every moment during a group meeting. And their existential motto is ‘Transactional analysts are healthy, happy, rich, and brave, and get to travel all over and meet the nicest people in the world, and the same when they are home treating patients.’

交互分析和脚本分析的动态口号是“关注括约肌”。他们的临床原则是在小组治疗期间，观察每位患者每一刻每一块肌肉的每一个动作。他们的存在主义格言是“交互分析师健康、快乐、富有且勇敢，他们有机会环游世界，结识世界上最友善的人，在家治疗患者时也是如此。”

In the present connection, the bravery consists of attacking the whole problem of human destiny and finding its solution by the use of the dynamic slogan and the clinical principle. Script analysis is then the answer to the problem of human destiny, and tells us (alas!) that our fates are predetermined for the most part, and that free will in this respect is for most people an illusion. For example, R. Allendy 8 points out that for each individual who faces it, the decision to commit suicide is a lonely and agonizing and apparently autonomous one. Yet whatever vicissitudes it goes through in each individual case, the ‘rate’ of suicide remains relatively constant from year to year. The only way to make (Darwinian) sense of this is to consider human destiny to be the result of parental programing, and not of individual ‘autonomous’ decision.

就目前而言，真正的勇气在于直面人类命运的整个问题，并运用动态口号和临床原则来寻求解决之道。脚本分析正是解决人类命运问题的答案，它告诉我们（唉！），我们的命运在很大程度上是预先注定的，而自由意志在这方面对大多数人来说只是一种幻觉。例如，R. Allendy指出，对于每个面临自杀抉择的人来说，这是一个孤独、痛苦且看似自主的决定。然而，无论每个个体经历怎样的曲折，自杀率每年都相对稳定。要从达尔文主义的角度解释这一现象，唯一的办法就是将人类命运视为父母刻板印象的结果，而非个人“自主”决定的结果。

What, then, is the responsibility of the parents? Script programing is not their ‘fault,’ any more than an inherited defect is, such as diabetes or clubfoot, or an inherited talent for music or mathematics. They are merely passing on the dominants and recessives they got from their parents and grandparents. The script directives are being continually reshuffled, just as the genes are, by the fact that the child requires two parents.

那么，父母的责任是什么呢？孩子的“脚本程序”并非他们的“过错”，就像遗传缺陷（例如糖尿病、先天性马蹄内翻足）或遗传的音乐或数学天赋一样。他们只是将从父母和祖父母那里继承的显性基因和隐性基因传递给了孩子。由于孩子需要父母双方的共同努力，这些“脚本指令”就像基因一样，不断地被重新组合。

On the other hand, the script apparatus is much more flexible than the genetic apparatus and is continually being modified by outside influences, such as life experience and the injunctions inserted by other people. It is only rarely possible to predict when or how an outsider will say or do something that alters a person’s script. It may be a casual remark accidentally overheard at a carnival or in a corridor, or it may be the result of a formal relationship such as marriage, school, or psychotherapy. It is a common observation that spouses gradually influence each other’s attitudes toward life and people, and that these changes are reflected in the tonus of their facial muscles and their gestures, so that they come to look alike.

另一方面，脚本机制比遗传机制灵活得多，并且会不断受到外部因素的影响而改变，例如生活经验和他人的指令。我们几乎无法预测外人何时或如何说出或做出改变一个人脚本的事情。这可能是在嘉年华或走廊里偶然听到的一句闲话，也可能是婚姻、学校或心理治疗等正式关系的结果。我们经常观察到，夫妻会逐渐影响彼此对生活和人际关系的态度，而这些变化会反映在他们面部肌肉的张力和肢体语言上，使他们看起来越来越相似。

A parent who wishes to change his script so that he will not lay on his children the same directives that were laid on him should first of all become familiar with the Parent ego state and the Parental voices he carries around in his head, and which the children learn to ‘cathect’ by appropriate trigger behavior. Since the parent is older and presumably wiser in some ways than his offspring, it is his duty and responsibility to control his Parental behavior. Only if he brings his Parent under the control of his Adult can he accomplish this. Beyond that, he is just as much the product of his Parental upbringing as his children are.

一位希望改变自身教养模式，不再将自己曾被灌输的那些教条强加给孩子的父母，首先应该熟悉自己内心深处的“父母自我状态”和“父母之声”，孩子们会通过特定的触发行为来“接收”这些声音。由于父母年纪更大，在某些方面也可能比子女更有智慧，因此控制自己的“父母行为”是父母的责任和义务。只有当他能够将自己的“父母行为”置于“成人行为”的控制之下，才能做到这一点。除此之外，父母自身也和孩子一样，深受父母教养方式的影响。

One difficulty is that children represent facsimile and immortality. Every parent is openly or secretly delighted when his children respond the way he does, even when they follow his worst characteristics. This delight is what he must forgo under Adult control if he wishes his children to adapt to the solar system and all its ramifications better than he himself did.

一个难题在于，孩子既是自己的复制品，也是永恒的象征。每个父母都会在孩子模仿自己时，或明或暗地感到欣喜，即便孩子继承了自己最糟糕的特质。如果父母希望孩子能比自己更好地适应太阳系及其所有影响，那么在成人的掌控下，他们就必须放弃这种欣喜。

And now, we are ready to consider what happens when Jeder, who is Everyman and any man, wants to change that design, the tapes in his head, and the program they dictate, and becomes a special kind of man – Pat the patient.

现在，我们准备考虑一下，当杰德（Jeder）——一个普通人，任何一个男人——想要改变这种设计、改变他脑海中的磁带以及它们所规定的程序，并成为一个特殊的人——病人帕特（Pat）时，会发生什么。

Notes & References

注释与参考文献

1 Hendricks, S. B. ‘Metabolic Control of Timing.’ Science , 141:21–27, July 5, 1963.

1 Hendricks, S. B. ‘代谢控制时间’。科学，141:21–27，1963 年 7 月 5 日。

2 The script matrix in its present form was devised by Dr Claude M. Steiner, of the San Francisco Transactional Analysis Seminar, and first appeared in print in his article ‘Script and Counterscript,’ Loc. cit . In my estimation, its value cannot be overestimated, containing as it does the programing for a whole human life, as well as indicating how to change it. It is such an important invention that, without detracting from Dr Steiner’s perceptiveness, ingenuity, and creativity, I would like to claim a part in it. Its predecessors were the more primitive diagrams to be found on pages 201 and 205 of my book Transactional Analysis in Psychotherapy ( loc. cit .) The above article also marks the first appearance in print of the concepts of counterscript and injunction, which are further products of Dr Steiner’s insights.

2 目前的脚本矩阵是由旧金山交互分析研讨会的克劳德·M·施泰纳博士设计的，并首次发表于他的文章《脚本与反脚本》（同上）。在我看来，它的价值怎么强调都不为过，因为它包含了整个人生的程序设定，并指明了如何改变它。这是一项如此重要的发明，在不贬低施泰纳博士的洞察力、独创性和创造力的前提下，我也想在此分享我的贡献。它的前身是我著作《心理治疗中的交互分析》（同上）第201页和205页中更为原始的图表。上述文章也首次出现了反脚本和指令的概念，这些概念也是施泰纳博士洞见的产物。

3 Johnson and Szurek went as far as ‘superego lacunae’ in accounting for ‘acting out.’ That is, children ‘act out’ because there is something ‘missing’ in the parents. This was one of the first theoretical statements of how parents influence their children to ‘bad’ behavior. (Johnson, A. M. and Szurek, S. A. ‘The Genesis of Anti-Social Acting Out in Children and Adults.’ Psychoanalytic Quarterly , 21:323–343, 1952.) We have broadened the problem from ‘acting out’ to real living, and have tried to include all forms of behavior, whether ‘anti-social’ or not. Erikson approaches the script concept very closely but veers away. (Erikson, E. Identity and the Life Cycle. Loc. cit .) As already mentioned, Freud speaks of the ‘destiny compulsion’ as a biological phenomenon, without specifying its psychological origin; while Adler talks of life style. The injunction principle stated in the text, therefore, may be regarded as supplementing the observations of all these writers. Cf. Jackson, D. D. ‘Family Interaction, Family Homeostasis and Some Implications for Conjoint Family Psychotherapy.’ in Individual and Familial Dynamics (J. H. Masserman, ed.). Grune & Stratton, New York, 1959.

3. 约翰逊和苏雷克甚至提出了“超我缺失”的概念来解释“行为化”。也就是说，儿童之所以“行为化”，是因为父母身上存在某种“缺失”。这是最早关于父母如何影响儿童“不良”行为的理论阐述之一。（Johnson, A. M. 和 Szurek, S. A.，《儿童和成人反社会行为化的起源》，《精神分析季刊》，21:323–343，1952。）我们将问题从“行为化”扩展到现实生活，并试图涵盖所有形式的行为，无论是否具有“反社会”特征。埃里克森非常接近脚本概念，但又有所偏离。（Erikson, E.，《身份与生命周期》，同上。）如前所述，弗洛伊德将“命运的强迫”视为一种生物学现象，而没有具体说明其心理起源；阿德勒则谈到了生活方式。因此，文中阐述的禁令原则可以被视为对所有这些作者观点的补充。参见 Jackson, D. D.，《家庭互动、家庭稳态及其对联合家庭心理治疗的一些启示》，载于《个体与家庭动力学》（J. H. Masserman 编），Grune & Stratton 出版社，纽约，1959 年。

4 Steiner, C. M. ‘The Treatment of Alcoholism.’ Transactional Analysis Bulletin , 6:69–71, July, 1967. Also ‘The Alcoholic Game.’ Quarterly Journal of Studies on Alcohol . 30:920–938, December, 1969, with discussion by six eminent authorities on alcoholism. Dr Steiner’s book on this subject, Games Alcoholics Play , has recently been published (Grove Press, 1971).

4. Steiner, C. M.，《酒精中毒的治疗》，载《人际沟通分析公报》，第6卷，第69-71页，1967年7月。另见《酒精中毒的游戏》，载《酒精研究季刊》，第30卷，第920-938页，1969年12月，其中收录了六位酒精中毒研究权威的讨论。Steiner博士关于此主题的著作《酒精中毒者的游戏》（Games Alcoholics Play）近期已出版（Grove出版社，1971年）。

5 Karpman, S. ‘Alcoholic “Instant Group Therapy”’. Transactional Analysis Bulletin , 4:69–74, October, 1965.

5 Karpman, S. ‘酒精成瘾者的“即时团体治疗”’。《人际沟通分析公报》，4:69–74，1965 年 10 月。

6 Berne, E. ‘Concerning the Nature of Communication.’ Psychiatric Quarterly , 27: 185–198, 1953.

6 Berne, E.‘关于沟通的本质’精神病学季刊，27：185-198，1953。

7 English, F. ‘Episcript and the “Hot Potato” Game.’ Transactional Analysis Bulletin , 8:77–82, October, 1969.

7 English, F. ‘Episcript 和“烫手山芋”游戏。’ Transactional Analysis Bulletin, 8:77–82, 1969 年 10 月。

8 Allendy, R. Le problème de la destinée, étude sur la fatalité intérieure . Librairie Gallimard, Paris, 1927. L. du Nouy, on the other hand ( Human Destiny . Signet Books, New York, 1949), puts more weight on external forces as seen by a religious scientist.

8 Allendy, R.《命运问题：关于内在宿命论的研究》。巴黎伽利玛出版社，1927 年。另一方面，L. du Nouy（《人类的命运》。纽约 Signet Books，1949 年）则从宗教科学家的角度，更加重视外部力量。

fn1 Through the family parade it was possible to trace the games and script of a woman patient (whose great grandmother lived to a very advanced age with her memory unimpaired) back to the Napoleonic Wars, and to project them forward through her grandchildren to the year 2000.

fn1 通过家族传承，可以追溯一位女病人的游戏和剧本（她的曾祖母活到了很高的年纪，记忆力却丝毫未减），一直追溯到拿破仑战争时期，并通过她的孙辈们将其延续到 2000 年。

fn2 Actually, the family parade described above is partly based on anthropological and historical material, and partly on the family trees of some American doctors.

fn2 实际上，上面描述的家族游行部分基于人类学和历史资料，部分基于一些美国医生的家谱。

#↩

PART IV

第四部分

The Script in Clinical Practice

临床实践中的脚本

#↩

CHAPTER SIXTEEN

第十六章

The Preliminary Phases

初步阶段

A • Introductory

A • 引言

Since the script influences begin before birth, and the ‘final display’ or ultimate payoff occurs at death or later it is only rarely that the clinician will have an opportunity to follow a script through from beginning to end. Lawyers, bankers, family doctors, and clergymen, especially those who practice in small towns, are the people most likely to know all the secrets of someone’s life over such a long period. But since psychiatric script analysis itself is only a few years old, there is in fact not a single example of clinical observation of a complete life course or script. The best way at present to get a long term view is by means of biographical books, but these are usually lacking in many important respects; few of the questions mentioned in the previous sections can be answered from the usual academic or literary biographies. The first attempt at something approaching script analysis was Freud’s book on Leonardo da Vinci. 1 The next landmark is Ernest Jones’ biography of Freud himself, 2 and Jones had the advantage of knowing his subject personally. Erikson has studied the life plans and life courses of two successful leaders, Martin Luther and Mahatma Gandhi. 3 Leon Edel’s continuing biography of Henry James, 4 and Zeligs’ study of the Hiss-Chamberlain relationship 5 also reveal many of the script elements. But in all of these cases, most of the early directives can only be guessed at.

由于剧本的影响始于出生之前，而“最终展现”或最终结果则发生在死亡或之后，临床医生极少有机会完整地追踪一个人的人生剧本。律师、银行家、家庭医生和神职人员，尤其是那些在小城镇执业的，最有可能了解一个人在如此漫长的人生历程中的所有秘密。但由于精神病学剧本分析本身也只有几年的历史，实际上还没有一个完整的人生历程或剧本的临床观察案例。目前获得长期视角的最佳方法是通过传记书籍，但这些书籍通常在许多重要方面存在不足；前几节中提到的问题很少能从常见的学术或文学传记中找到答案。最早尝试进行脚本分析的是弗洛伊德关于达·芬奇的著作。 1 下一个里程碑是欧内斯特·琼斯为弗洛伊德本人所作的传记， 2 琼斯的优势在于他与传主本人相识。埃里克森研究了两位成功领袖——马丁·路德和圣雄甘地——的人生规划和人生历程。 3 莱昂·埃德尔继续撰写的亨利·詹姆斯传记， 4 以及泽利格斯对希斯-张伯伦关系的研究， 5 也揭示了许多脚本元素。但在所有这些案例中，大多数早期指令只能靠猜测。

The closest approach to a scientific study of scripts comes out of the work of McClelland. 6 He studied the relationship between stories heard and read by children, and their motives in living. His work was followed up by Rudin 7 many years later.

对剧本进行科学研究的最接近于科学方法的研究来自麦克莱兰（McClelland）的工作。他研究了儿童听到和阅读的故事与他们的生活动机之间的关系。多年后，鲁丁（Rudin）继续开展了这项研究。

Rudin studied the causes of death among those who were motivated by such stories. Because ‘achievers’ have to be ‘good,’ they tend to keep their feelings under careful control, and they often suffer from ulcers or high blood pressure. He contrasted this group with those who had a desire for ‘power’ and expressed themselves freely in action in order to attain it; they had a high death rate from what we could call ‘scripty’ causes: suicide, homicide, and cirrhosis of the liver from drinking too much. The ‘achievers” scripts were based on success stories, while the ‘power’ people’s scripts were based on tales of risk, and Rudin tells us what kinds of deaths they were courting. This is a twenty-five-year survey and easily fits into the framework of script analysis as given here.

鲁丁研究了那些受此类故事激励的人的死因。由于“成功者”必须“善良”，他们往往会小心翼翼地控制自己的情绪，因此常常患有溃疡或高血压。他将这类人与那些渴望“权力”并为了获得权力而自由行动的人进行了对比；后者死亡率很高，死因可归结为“脚本性”因素：自杀、他杀以及因酗酒导致的肝硬化。“成功者”的脚本基于成功故事，而“权力”追求者的脚本则基于冒险故事，鲁丁告诉我们他们正在走向何种死亡。这是一项长达二十五年的调查，完全符合本文所述的脚本分析框架。

Even with studies such as this, script analysis cannot attain the precision and certainty of mouse psychology, or bacteriology. What script analysts have to do in practice is read biographies, keep track of their friends’ successes and their enemies’ failures, see large numbers of patients with various types of early programing, and project backward and forward in the lives of people they are clinically acquainted with for a reasonably long period. A clinician who has been in practice for twenty or thirty years, for example, and keeps in touch with his former patients either by periodic visits or even through Christmas cards, begins to feel more and more secure in his script analyses. With such a background, he knows better what to do with the patients he is currently seeing, and how to get the maximum amount of information as quickly as possible with new patients. The more quickly and accurately the script can be understood in each case, the more quickly and effectively its antithesis can be applied by the therapist, thus avoiding a waste of time, energy, lives, and new generations.

即使有了这样的研究，脚本分析也无法达到小鼠心理学或细菌学那样的精确性和确定性。脚本分析师在实践中需要做的是阅读传记，关注朋友的成功和敌人的失败，接诊大量具有各种早期编程特征的患者，并对他们临床接触较长时间的人的生活进行回顾和展望。例如，一位从业二三十年的临床医生，如果通过定期回访甚至圣诞贺卡与之前的患者保持联系，就会对自己的脚本分析越来越有信心。有了这样的经验，他就能更好地了解如何对待当前的患者，以及如何从新患者身上尽快获取尽可能多的信息。对每个案例中的脚本理解得越快越准确，治疗师就能越快越有效地应用其对立面，从而避免浪费时间、精力、生命，甚至影响下一代。

Psychiatric practice, like all branches of medicine, carries with it a certain mortality rate and a certain disability rate, and the first aim of the therapist must be to reduce those, whatever else he accomplishes besides. Overnight suicide by drugs, and long-term suicide by alcohol or high blood pressure have to be averted. His slogan must be ‘Get better first and analyze it later,’ otherwise he will have some of his most ‘interesting’ and ‘insightful’ patients either the smartest people in the morgue or the smartest people in the state hospital or penitentiary. The first problem, then, is: what are the ‘script signs’ that occur during treatment? He should know what to look for, where to find it, what to do about it after he finds it, and how to tell whether he is doing it effectively, and that is what we shall take up in the next chapter. The second problem is to check his observations and impressions and put them into some sort of systematic order so that he can talk about them to others. For those purposes the Script Check List beginning on here should be of some help.

精神科诊疗，如同所有医学分支一样，都存在一定的死亡率和致残率，治疗师的首要目标必须是降低这些死亡率和致残率，无论他还能取得其他什么成就。必须避免因药物导致的短期自杀，以及因酒精或高血压导致的长期自杀。他的座右铭必须是“先治好病情，后分析问题”，否则他那些最“有趣”和“有洞察力”的病人，要么会成为太平间里最聪明的人，要么会成为州立医院或监狱里最聪明的人。因此，首要问题是：治疗过程中会出现哪些“脚本信号”？他应该知道要观察什么，在哪里找到这些信号，找到后该如何处理，以及如何判断自己是否有效，这些内容我们将在下一章讨论。第二个问题是检验他的观察和印象，并将它们系统地整理出来，以便与他人交流。为此，从这里开始的脚本检查清单应该会有所帮助。

Many of the patients who come to transactional analysts do so after going to other kinds of therapists. If not, they go through, with the transactional analyst, the phases they would otherwise go through in ‘preliminary’ therapy. It is therefore convenient to consider two phases in clinical script analysis: the preliminary phase, and the phase of script analysis. Whatever form of therapy is used, similar phases will occur, and they are not peculiar to script analysis. The script analyst may see the failures of other therapists, but he does not see their successes. Conversely, other therapists see the failures of script analysis and do not usually see the successes.

许多前来接受交互分析师治疗的患者，都是在尝试过其他类型的治疗师之后才来的。即便没有尝试过其他类型的治疗师，他们也会在交互分析师的指导下经历原本会在“预备”治疗中经历的各个阶段。因此，将临床脚本分析分为两个阶段是比较方便的：预备阶段和脚本分析阶段。无论采用何种治疗方法，都会出现类似的阶段，这些阶段并非脚本分析所独有。脚本分析师可能会看到其他治疗师的失败之处，但却看不到他们的成功之处。反之，其他治疗师也往往能看到脚本分析的失败之处，却通常看不到它的成功之处。

In the previous section we considered the development of human beings in general, trying to pick out universals, and the subject was called Jeder. We will continue to call him that except when he is actually in the office or on the ward, and then we will call him Pat, and his therapist Dr Q.

在上一节中，我们探讨了人类发展的一般规律，试图找出其中的普遍规律，并将研究对象称为杰德（Jeder）。我们将继续这样称呼他，除非他真的在办公室或病房里，那时我们会称他为帕特（Pat），他的治疗师是Q医生。

B • The Choice of Therapist

B • 治疗师的选择

Nearly every therapist likes to think that the patient chose him and his profession because in this choice at least he was rational, intelligent, and discriminating, no matter how confused he might be about everything else. This feeling of being chosen, on merit – the merit of one’s profession and personal merit as well – is a healthy one, and is one of the rewards of our vocation. Every therapist, therefore, is entitled to bask in it and to enjoy it to the utmost – for about five or seven minutes. After that, he should put it on the shelf with his other trophies and his diplomas, and forget it permanently if he wants to get the patient well.

几乎每位治疗师都喜欢认为，病人之所以选择他和他的职业，是因为至少在选择这件事上，病人是理性、聪明且有辨别力的，无论病人在其他方面多么困惑。这种被选中的感觉——既是因职业的功劳，也是因个人能力——是健康的，也是我们职业带来的回报之一。因此，每位治疗师都有权利沉浸在这种感觉中，尽情享受——大概五到七分钟。之后，如果他想让病人康复，就应该把这种感觉和其他奖杯、证书一起束之高阁，永远忘却它。

Dr Q may be a very good therapist, and he may have the diplomas and the reputation and the patients to confirm it. He may think that is the reason the patient comes to him, or the patient may tell him so. He should be sobered, however, by the thought of all the patients who do not choose him. According to the available statistics, forty-two per cent of troubled people go first to their clergyman, and not to a psychiatrist, and nearly all the rest go to their family doctors. 8 And only about one patient out of five who needs psychiatric care is getting it, either in a hospital, in a clinic, or in private practice. 9 In other words, four out of every five disturbed people do not choose psychiatry as their treatment, even though in almost all cases it is available at the state hospital, if nowhere else. In addition, a very large percentage of patients who have a choice deliberately choose the second best therapist rather than the best, and a quite large percentage choose the worst . The same thing happens in other branches of medicine. It is also well known that a large number of people spend more money destroying themselves with liquor, drugs, and gambling, than they would on the psychotherapy which might save them.

Q医生或许是一位非常优秀的治疗师，他拥有相应的文凭、声誉和患者数量来证明这一点。他或许认为这就是患者前来就诊的原因，或者患者可能也这样告诉他。然而，想到还有那么多患者没有选择他，他应该感到清醒。根据现有统计数据，42%的心理困扰者首先会去找他们的牧师，而不是精神科医生，而几乎其余的人都会去看家庭医生。 8 而在需要精神科治疗的患者中，只有大约五分之一的人能够得到治疗，无论是在医院、诊所还是私人诊所。 9 换句话说，五分之四的心理困扰者没有选择精神科治疗，尽管在几乎所有情况下，公立医院都能提供这种治疗，即便其他地方没有。此外，很大一部分有选择权的患者会刻意选择次好的治疗师而不是最好的，还有相当一部分人会选择最差的治疗师。其他医学领域也存在同样的情况。众所周知，很多人花在酗酒、吸毒和赌博上自毁的钱，远远超过了他们花在心理治疗上的钱，而心理治疗或许能拯救他们。

Given a free choice, the patient will choose a therapist according to the needs of his script. In some places, he has no choice, but has to go to the local witch doctor, shaman, or angakok. 10 In other places, he has a choice between a traditional doctor and a modern one, 11 and will choose the magic of tradition or the magic of science according to local custom 12 and political pressure. In China and India, traditional and modern approaches are often combined, as in the mental hospital in Madras 13 where Ayur-Vedic medicine and Yoga exercises were used in conjunction with modern treatments for psychoses. In many cases his choice is forced by financial considerations.

如果可以自由选择，病人会根据自身情况选择治疗师。在某些地方，他别无选择，只能去找当地的巫医、萨满或巫师。在另一些地方，他可以在传统医生和现代医生之间选择，并根据当地习俗和政治压力来决定是选择传统的“魔法”还是现代的“魔法”。在中国和印度，传统和现代疗法常常结合使用，例如马德拉斯的一家精神病院，那里将阿育吠陀医学和瑜伽练习与现代精神病疗法结合使用。在许多情况下，他的选择是出于经济原因。

In America, most patients do not have a free choice of therapists, but are referred or assigned by various ‘authorities’ to one type or another: psychiatrists, psychologists, psychiatric social workers, psychiatric nurses, counselors, and even sociologists. A patient in a clinic, social agency, mental hospital, or government hospital may be assigned to any of these professions. A schoolboy is sent to the school counselor, and a person on probation is sent to a probation officer who may have no therapeutic training at all. If the patient has no prior knowledge or fantasies about psychotherapy and he likes his first therapist, he will often favor that therapist’s profession if he seeks treatment elsewhere.

在美国，大多数患者没有自由选择治疗师的权利，而是由各种“权威机构”转介或指派给某一类治疗师：精神科医生、心理学家、精神科社工、精神科护士、咨询师，甚至社会学家。诊所、社会机构、精神病院或公立医院的患者都可能被指派给上述任何一种专业人士。学生会被送到学校辅导员那里，缓刑人员会被送到缓刑监督官那里，而这些监督官可能根本没有接受过任何治疗方面的培训。如果患者对心理治疗一无所知，或者没有任何幻想，而且他喜欢他的第一位治疗师，那么当他在其他地方寻求治疗时，他往往会倾向于选择这位治疗师的职业。

It is in private practice where free choice does exist that the ‘scripty’ selections begin to emerge, particularly in the choice between psychiatrists, psychoanalysts, psychologists, and psychiatric social workers, and between the competent and the incompetent members of these professions. Christian Scientists, for example, if they do go to a medical therapist, often choose a less competent one, since their scripts prohibit them from being cured by a medical person. There are also subdivisions and schools in these professions to choose among. Among psychiatrists, for example, there are types colloquially called ‘shock treaters,’ ‘drug-givers,’ ‘shrinks,’ and hypnotists, and if the patient makes his own choice among these, as he often does, he will choose the one that suits his script. If he is referred by the family doctor, the doctor may well choose the one that fits in with his own script. This is most clearly seen when the patient seeks or is referred to a hypnotist. If he calls a psychiatrist to request hypnosis and that psychiatrist does not use hypnosis, the ensuing conversation becomes very scripty as the patient insists that he must be put to sleep before he can get better. Some people automatically (i.e., by script directive) go to the Mayo Clinic and others to the Menninger Clinic. Similarly, in choosing a psychoanalyst, some, for script reasons, select the most orthodox one possible, others prefer more flexibility, and still others go to ‘analysts’ belonging to splinter schools. Sometimes the age or sex of the therapist is important for scripty reasons, such as a need to seduce or a fear of seduction. Rebels often go to rebellious therapists. People with failure scripts pick the worst possible therapists, such as chiropractors or outright quacks. 14 H. L. Mencken once remarked that the only relics of Darwinian natural selection left in America, where everyone is ‘taken care of,’ are chiropractors, because the more widely they are allowed to practice, the more quickly will unfit members of the human race be eliminated by their treatment.

在私人诊所这种存在自由选择的环境中，“预设模式”的选择开始显现，尤其是在精神科医生、精神分析师、心理学家和精神科社工之间，以及在这些专业人士的资质水平上。例如，基督教科学派信徒如果去看医学治疗师，往往会选择资质较差的，因为他们的预设模式不允许他们接受医学治疗。这些专业领域内也存在不同的分支和流派可供选择。例如，精神科医生中就有一些俗称“电击疗法医生”、“药物治疗医生”、“心理医生”和催眠师的类型，如果患者像通常那样自行选择，他会选择符合自己预设模式的那一类。如果患者是由家庭医生转诊，那么医生很可能会选择符合自己预设模式的那一类。这一点在患者寻求或被转诊至催眠师时表现得最为明显。如果他打电话给精神科医生要求催眠，而这位医生不使用催眠，接下来的对话就会变得非常程式化，因为病人会坚持说他必须先睡着才能好转。有些人会不由自主地（也就是按照既定的模式）去梅奥诊所，有些人则会去门宁格诊所。同样，在选择精神分析师时，有些人出于既定的模式，会选择最正统的，有些人则更喜欢灵活的，还有些人会选择属于小众流派的“分析师”。有时，治疗师的年龄或性别也会因为既定的模式而变得重要，例如，病人需要被诱惑或害怕被诱惑。叛逆者往往会去找同样叛逆的治疗师。那些抱有失败感的人会选择最糟糕的治疗师，比如脊椎按摩师或彻头彻尾的庸医。H·L·门肯曾说过，在美国这个“人人都被照顾”的地方，达尔文自然选择的唯一遗迹就是脊椎按摩师，因为他们的执业范围越广，不适宜的人就会越快被他们的治疗淘汰。

There are clear indications that three factors are determined by the patient’s script directives. (1) Whether he seeks help at all, or just lets things run their course; (2) the choice of therapist, where there is a choice; (3) whether or not the therapy is destined to be successful. Thus a person with a loser’s script will either not go to a therapist, or may choose an incompetent one. In the latter case, when the treatment fails, he not only remains a loser, as his script calls for, but also has various other satisfactions from his misadventure; for example, he can blame the therapist, or obtain a Herostratic 15 satisfaction from being the ‘worst’ patient, or boast that he had ten years of therapy with Dr X at a cost of Y thousands of dollars with no benefit.

有明确迹象表明，患者的“失败者脚本”指令决定了三个因素：(1) 他是否寻求帮助，还是任由事态发展；(2) 如果有选择，他是否会选择治疗师；(3) 治疗是否注定成功。因此，一个抱持“失败者脚本”的人要么根本不会去看治疗师，要么可能会选择一个不称职的治疗师。在后一种情况下，当治疗失败时，他不仅会像他的“失败者脚本”所暗示的那样继续保持失败者的形象，还会从这种不幸的经历中获得其他方面的满足感；例如，他可以责怪治疗师，或者从成为“最糟糕的”患者中获得一种“英雄式”的满足感，或者吹嘘自己花了数千美元在X医生那里接受了十年的治疗却毫无效果。

C • The Therapist as a Magician

C • 治疗师如同魔术师

To the patient’s Child, the therapist is a magician of sorts. He is likely to choose the same kind of magical figure that he knew in childhood. In some families, the revered figure is the family doctor, a medical man; in others the revered is the clergyman. Some doctors and clergymen are serious figures out of tragedy, like Tiresias, who will tell them the bad news and perhaps give them a cantrap, amulet, or draught for salvation; others are jolly green giants who protect children from harm by comforting them and reassuring them, and flexing their giant muscles. When Jeder grows up, he will usually look for help from a similar person. If his experience was unhappy, however, he may rebel and find some other kind of magic. One puzzle is why people choose psychologists to fill this role in their scripts, since comparatively few people so far have had a friendly neighborhood psychologist as the family magician in early childhood. From a fairy-tale point of view, the therapist is the dwarf, the witch, the fish, the fox, or the bird who gives Jeder the magic means to attain his ends: the seven-league boots, the cloak of invisibility, the magic chest that produces on command gold or tables laden with cakes and dainties; or some apotropaion to ward off evil.

对病人的孩子来说，治疗师就像某种魔法师。他很可能会选择与童年时期熟悉的魔法人物类似的角色。在一些家庭里，受人尊敬的是家庭医生，一位医者；而在另一些家庭里，受人尊敬的是神职人员。有些医生和神职人员是因悲剧而显得严肃的人物，比如提瑞西阿斯，他们会告诉孩子们坏消息，或许还会给他们一些咒语、护身符或灵药来拯救他们；另一些则是和蔼可亲的绿色巨人，他们通过安慰和鼓励孩子，并展示他们巨大的肌肉来保护他们免受伤害。当杰德长大后，他通常会向类似的人寻求帮助。然而，如果他的经历并不愉快，他可能会反抗，并寻找其他类型的魔法。一个令人费解的问题是，为什么人们会选择心理学家来扮演他们故事中的这个角色，因为迄今为止，很少有人在童年早期拥有过一位和蔼可亲的邻家心理学家作为家庭魔法师。从童话故事的角度来看，治疗师就像是矮人、女巫、鱼、狐狸或鸟，为杰德提供实现目标的魔法手段：七里靴、隐形斗篷、可以随心所欲变出金子或摆满蛋糕和美味佳肴的桌子的魔法宝箱；或者一些辟邪的护身符。

Roughly speaking, the patient can choose between three kinds of magic in selecting a therapist, and he can select each one for success or for failure. He can also play one against the other if his script requires that. These are known as ‘science,’ ‘chicken soup,’ and ‘religion.’ Any profession can offer all three, but typically a certain type of psychologist offers ‘modern science,’ a certain type of psychiatric social worker offers ‘chicken soup,’ and a certain type of pastoral counselor offers ‘religion.’ A well-trained therapist in each of these professions is prepared to offer any of them if occasion demands, and some offer two in combination. Science and religion, chicken soup and science, or religion and chicken soup, are common farragoes for the patient who seeks more than one kind of magic. The practical difference between ‘science,’ ‘chicken soup,’ and ‘religion’ on the one hand, and a scientific, a supportive, and a religious approach to therapy is in knowing when to stop. The therapists who use the first three do not know when to stop, since each one’s brand of magic is part of his own script, while those who use the last three do know when to stop, because they know what they are doing. The first group, is playing ‘I’m Only Trying to Help You,’ while the others are helping people.

粗略地说，患者在选择治疗师时，可以在三种“魔法”之间进行选择，每一种都可能带来成功或失败。如果剧情需要，他甚至可以将其中一种与其他两种结合起来。这三种“魔法”分别是“科学”、“心灵鸡汤”和“宗教”。任何职业都可以提供这三种“魔法”，但通常来说，某种类型的心理学家提供“现代科学”，某种类型的精神科社工提供“心灵鸡汤”，而某种类型的牧师咨询师提供“宗教”。每种职业中训练有素的治疗师都准备好在必要时提供其中任何一种，有些治疗师甚至会结合两种。对于那些寻求多种“魔法”的患者来说，科学与宗教、心灵鸡汤与科学，或者宗教与心灵鸡汤，都是常见的混搭。一方面是“科学”、“心灵鸡汤”和“宗教”，另一方面是科学的、支持性的和宗教性的治疗方法之间的实际区别在于，后者懂得何时停止。使用前三种疗法的治疗师不知道何时该停止，因为每种疗法的“魔法”都属于他们自己的一套“剧本”；而使用后三种疗法的治疗师则知道何时该停止，因为他们清楚自己在做什么。第一组治疗师是在玩弄“我只是想帮你”的游戏，而后一组治疗师则是在真正地帮助他人。

D • The Preparation

D • 准备工作

In his preliminary ventures into therapy, the patient gets ‘couch-broken,’ which means that he learns to play his own games lying down, literally or figuratively, 16 and he also learns to play the therapist’s games well enough to keep the doctor happy. This is best seen on psychiatric in-patient wards, where the patient is taught the rules of mental illness well enough so that he can choose at will between (1) staying on indefinitely (or as long as the family finances hold out), (2) being transferred to a less demanding environment such as a state hospital, or (3) going home whenever he is ready. He also learns how to behave in order to be readmitted.

在接受治疗的初期，患者会逐渐“适应”治疗，这意味着他学会了躺着玩游戏（无论是字面意义上的还是比喻意义上的），同时也学会了如何配合治疗师的“游戏”，以博得医生的欢心。这种情况在精神科住院病房最为常见，患者在那里被灌输了精神疾病的种种规则，以便能够自由选择：（1）无限期地留院（或直到家庭经济状况允许为止）；（2）转到压力较小的环境，例如州立医院；（3）随时准备回家。他还会学习如何表现才能再次入院。

After several stays in the hospital, such patients become adept at ‘training’ younger therapists and psychiatric residents. They know how to cater to the doctor’s hobbies, such as dream interpretation, and how to indulge in their own particular hobbies, such as ‘producing interesting material.’ All this confirms the basic assumption that patients are good sports. There are a few exceptions, however. Some refuse to play the ward games or the doctor’s games by maintaining that they are innocent of mental illness. Others stubbornly or sulkily refuse to get well even though they admit that there is something wrong or actively complain about it. Some of these can be placated by allowing them to rest up for a week or two before demanding that they get better. There is a small number of unfortunates who would like to be good sports, but are helpless in the grip of organic conditions such as Pick’s disease, or quasi-organic illnesses like ‘process’ schizophrenia, agitated melancholia, or mania. Once the latter receive adequate doses of medication such as phenothiazines, dibenzazepines, or lithium, however, they usually become as tractable as need be. Some hospitals, deplorably, use shock treatment to whip headstrong patients into shape.

经过几次住院治疗，这类患者逐渐熟练地“指导”年轻的治疗师和精神科住院医师。他们懂得如何迎合医生的爱好，比如解梦，也懂得如何沉浸于自己的爱好，比如“制造有趣的素材”。这一切都印证了患者善于配合的基本假设。然而，也有一些例外。有些人拒绝参与病房里的“游戏”或医生的“游戏”，坚称自己没有精神疾病。另一些人则固执地或闷闷不乐地拒绝康复，即使他们承认自己有问题，或者积极地抱怨。对于其中一些人，可以让他们休息一两周，然后再要求他们康复，以此来安抚他们。还有少数不幸的人，他们也想表现得像个好人，但却无力抵抗诸如皮克氏病之类的器质性疾病，或是诸如“过程性”精神分裂症、激越性忧郁症或躁狂症之类的准器质性疾病。然而，一旦后者接受了足量的药物治疗，例如吩噻嗪类、二苯并氮杂卓类或锂剂，他们通常就能变得足够温顺。令人遗憾的是，有些医院竟然使用电击疗法来强制桀骜不驯的患者服从管教。

In any case, the first stage in the hospital treatment of psychiatric patients should be to discuss the various aspects of tractability in ward meetings attended by patients, staff, and visiting clinicians. Any of these may offer valuable suggestions if they understand that the object of psychotherapy is not to get patients out of the hospital, but to get them well. If such meetings are conducted with the proper attitude, not only are numerous games short-circuited very quickly, but ‘making progress’ may be given up in favor of getting well and staying well, with the exceptions mentioned above. Furthermore, almost all the patients are grateful for this frank approach. After the meeting nearly always some of them come up to shake hands with the therapist and perhaps remark: ‘This is the first time a doctor has treated me like a real person and talked straight to me.’ This happens because hospital games are by no means ‘unconscious.’ The patient knows very well what he is doing and why he is doing it, and appreciates an understanding therapist who is not taken in by it. Even if he does not admit this on the first try, the patient is grateful because this approach relieves the tedium of conventional psychotherapy.

无论如何，精神病患者住院治疗的第一步应该是召开病房会议，讨论患者、工作人员和来访的临床医生共同参与的各种治疗方案。如果他们理解心理治疗的目的不是让患者出院，而是让他们康复，那么他们中的任何人都可能提出宝贵的建议。如果以正确的态度召开此类会议，不仅可以迅速阻止许多“游戏”，而且除了上述例外情况外，还可以放弃“取得进步”的执念，转而专注于康复和保持健康。此外，几乎所有患者都对这种坦诚的态度表示感激。会后，几乎总会有一些患者上前与治疗师握手，并可能说道：“这是我第一次遇到一位医生把我当成一个真正的人来对待，并直截了当地和我交谈。”之所以会出现这种情况，是因为医院里的“游戏”绝非“无意识的”。患者非常清楚自己在做什么以及为什么这样做，并且感激一位理解他们、不被其蒙蔽的治疗师。即使他第一次没有承认这一点，病人也会心存感激，因为这种方法减轻了传统心理治疗的枯燥乏味。

For those who are more comfortable thinking that their patients have ‘weak egos,’ I should say that I would not hesitate to read the above paragraph at my very first encounter with a group of psychiatric in-patients, even very disturbed ones, after only a very short period of preparation and getting acquainted (say thirty minutes), and I would have no doubt of its beneficial effects, since I have said just those things on many occasions under such circumstances. 17

对于那些更倾向于认为他们的病人“自尊心弱”的人，我想说，即使是面对精神状况非常糟糕的住院病人，我也会在第一次见面时，在很短的准备和熟悉时间（比如三十分钟）后，毫不犹豫地朗读以上段落。我确信它会有益处，因为我曾在很多类似情况下说过类似的话。

When a patient who has previously been to one or more therapists or psychiatric hospitals comes to a transactional analyst, as an out-patient or a private patient, the proper procedure is as follows. During the first interview the therapist makes sure he gets the script background, unobtrusively as far as possible, swinging along with the patient’s conversation; but later, if there are omissions, making a clear point of filling them in. First, he gets a medical and psychiatric history. In the course of this, he asks for a dream – any dream, because that is the quickest way to get a picture of the patient’s script protocol and his world view. Then he inquires about each of the previous therapists: why the patient went to him, how he selected him, what he learned from him, why he left, and under what circumstances. From these inquiries, the script analyst gets many clues. He follows some of them up by asking about other activities: how Pat selects jobs or spouses, and why and how he quits or gets a divorce. If this is done competently, the patient will not terminate therapy prematurely, as he often does if the therapist is apprehensive about the transference and hides his fear behind a poker face, a ritualistic courtesy, or a tape recorder. Nothing is as reassuring as competence.

当一位曾接受过一位或多位治疗师或精神病院治疗的患者以门诊或私人患者的身份前来接受人际沟通分析师的治疗时，正确的流程如下。在第一次面谈中，治疗师会尽可能不引人注意地了解患者的脚本背景，并顺着患者的谈话自然进行；但如果之后发现有遗漏，则会明确地补充说明。首先，治疗师会询问患者的病史和精神病史。在此过程中，他会询问患者的梦境——任何梦都可以，因为这是了解患者脚本模式和世界观的最快捷径。然后，他会询问患者之前的每一位治疗师：患者为什么去找他们，如何选择他们，从他们那里学到了什么，为什么离开，以及在什么情况下离开。通过这些询问，脚本分析师可以获得许多线索。他会进一步询问患者的其他活动：例如，患者如何选择工作或配偶，以及他辞职或离婚的原因和过程。如果治疗师能够胜任，患者就不会像通常那样过早终止治疗。如果治疗师对移情感到担忧，并试图用扑克脸、刻板的礼貌或录音机来掩饰自己的恐惧，患者往往会这样做。没有什么比专业能力更能让人安心。

A common situation is where the patient is obviously collecting failures in therapy and elsewhere in order to justify a psychotic or suicidal script payoff, and quits with ‘Now He Tells Me’: that is, by springing some major surprise without previous discussion, and quitting without notice. At the end of the thirtieth session, for example, when everything appears to be going well and Pat is making ‘progress,’ he may say casually as he rises to leave: ‘By the way, this’ll be my last visit because I’m going to commit myself to the State Hospital this afternoon’ – something he has not previously brought up. If Dr Q has taken a careful history, he will abort this in the third session by saying: ‘Now what I think you’re heading for is to come here for six months or a year, and then quit suddenly.’ If Pat objects, Dr Q responds: ‘But that’s what you did on your two last jobs, and with three of your former therapists. It’s all right with me if you want to go through with it, because I can always learn something meanwhile, but if you really want to get well, that’s the first thing we have to talk about. Otherwise you’ll just waste six months or a year of your life. But if we can thrash it out right now, you’ll save that much time and we can go ahead.’ Alcoholics who crave absolute control or complete surrender are most likely to take umbrage at this abortion of their games, while patients who want to get well will be grateful. If the patient nods or laughs, the prognosis is very good.

一种常见的情况是，患者显然在治疗和其他方面不断积累失败案例，以此来为精神病发作或自杀倾向寻找借口，然后突然宣布退出，就像“他现在才告诉我”一样：也就是说，在事先没有任何讨论的情况下，突然抛出一个重大消息，不告而别。例如，在第三十次治疗结束时，当一切似乎都很顺利，帕特也取得了“进步”时，他可能会在起身离开时漫不经心地说：“对了，这将是我最后一次来，因为我今天下午要去州立医院。”——这是他之前从未提及的事情。如果Q医生仔细了解了病史，他会在第三次治疗时就阻止这种情况发生，并说：“我认为你现在的计划是来这里治疗六个月或一年，然后突然退出。”如果帕特反对，Q医生会回应说：“但你之前的两份工作，以及你之前的三个治疗师，不都是这么做的吗？”如果你想继续下去，我没意见，因为我也可以从中学习一些东西。但如果你真的想康复，这是我们首先要谈的。否则，你只会浪费六个月甚至一年的时间。但如果我们现在就把这个问题解决，你就能节省这么多时间，我们也可以继续进行下去。那些渴望绝对控制或彻底臣服的酗酒者很可能会对这种游戏的终止感到愤怒，而真正想康复的病人则会心存感激。如果病人点头或大笑，预后非常好。

E • The ‘Professional Patient’

E • “职业病人”

Patients who have had a long term of previous therapy, or who have been to several previous therapists, usually come on like ‘professional patients.’ There are three criteria which give the diagnosis of ‘professional patient.’ One is that Pat uses long words and diagnoses himself, the second is that he refers to his pathology as ‘Childish’ or ‘immature,’ and the third is that he looks solemn throughout the interview. By the end of the second visit, he should be told that he is a professional patient, if he is one, and instructed to stop using long words. Since he is well aware of the situation, it is only necessary to say: ‘You’re a professional patient, and I think you should give it up. Stop using long words and speak English.’ If this is done properly, he will stop using long words very quickly and start to speak English, except that now he will talk in clichés. He is then told to stop using clichés and talk like a real person. By this time he will have stopped looking solemn and will smile or even laugh occasionally. He can then be told that he is no longer a professional patient, but a real person with some psychiatric symptoms. He should also understand by this time that his Child is here to stay, and is not ‘childish’ or ‘immature’ in the stuffy senses of the words, but is confused, and that beneath the confusion is all the charm and spontaneity and creativity of an actual child. The progression here should be noted: from couch-broken precocious Child to cliché-throwing Parent to straight-talking Adult.

那些接受过长期治疗或看过好几位治疗师的患者，通常表现得像个“职业病人”。判断一个人是否是“职业病人”有三个标准：一是帕特会使用生僻词汇并进行自我诊断；二是他会用“幼稚”或“不成熟”来形容自己的病症；三是他在整个面谈过程中都显得很严肃。如果帕特确实是“职业病人”，那么在第二次面谈结束时，应该告诉他，并要求他停止使用生僻词汇。由于他很清楚自己的情况，所以只需要说：“你是个职业病人，我觉得你应该放弃这种做法。别再用生僻词汇了，说英语吧。”如果处理得当，他很快就会停止使用生僻词汇，开始说英语，只是现在他会说一些陈词滥调。这时，应该告诉他停止使用陈词滥调，像个正常人一样说话。这时，他不再愁容满面，偶尔会微笑甚至大笑。这时就可以告诉他，他不再是职业病人，而是一个有精神症状的活生生的人。他也应该明白，他心中的那个“孩子”会一直陪伴着他，并非传统意义上的“幼稚”或“不成熟”，而是感到困惑，而在这困惑之下，隐藏着一个孩子特有的魅力、天真和创造力。值得注意的是，他从最初在沙发上如履薄冰的早熟孩童，到如今满口陈词滥调的父母，再到如今直言不讳的成年人，他的转变过程是怎样的：

F • The Patient as a Person

F • 患者作为人

In script-analysis terms, the patient is now, we hope, ‘out of his script’ during his treatment hours and behaves like a real person, called colloquially ‘a card-carrying member of the human race.’ If he relapses, the therapist in individual therapy, or the other group members in group treatment, will so inform him. As long as he can stay out of his script he can examine that script objectively and the script analysis can proceed. The chief difficulty to be overcome is the pull of the script, something like the ‘Id resistance’ of Freud. Professional patients adopt that role because they decided when they were very young, with encouragement from their parents, to be mental cripples, and may have been helped along by their previous therapists. This is usually a family script, and the brothers and sisters and parents may also be in treatment. A typical example is where a brother or sister is in a psychiatric hospital, where he or she continually ‘acts out’ (as the staff calls it), or ‘acts crazy,’ as Pat now learns to call it. Pat is a little huffy, and will soon say quite frankly that he is jealous of his brother or sister, because he or she is in a hospital while Pat has to be contented with out-patient therapy. As one man put it, ‘How come my brother is in a nice plushy mental hospital on the East Coast while I have to be contented with this lousy little therapy group? I was enjoying it much more when I was a professional patient.’

用脚本分析的术语来说，我们希望患者在治疗期间能够“跳出脚本”，表现得像个真正的人，也就是俗称的“一个合格的人类成员”。如果他复发，个体治疗中的治疗师或团体治疗中的其他成员会告知他。只要他能跳出脚本，就能客观地审视自己的脚本，脚本分析也能继续进行。需要克服的主要困难是脚本的拉力，类似于弗洛伊德的“本我抵抗”。职业患者之所以扮演这种角色，是因为他们很小的时候就在父母的鼓励下决定成为精神残疾人，而且之前的治疗师可能也助长了这种倾向。这通常是一种家族脚本，兄弟姐妹和父母也可能正在接受治疗。一个典型的例子是，兄弟姐妹在精神病院里，他们不断地“行为失常”（工作人员是这么说的），或者像帕特现在学会的那样，“表现得像个疯子”。帕特有点儿闷闷不乐，很快就会直言不讳地说他嫉妒自己的兄弟姐妹，因为他们住在医院里，而他自己却只能接受门诊治疗。正如一位男士所说：“为什么我哥哥能在东海岸一家舒适的精神病院里，而我却只能待在这个破烂的治疗小组里？我以前当职业病人的时候可比现在开心多了。”

While such things are said jokingly, they are the core of the resistance against getting well. First of all, Pat is losing all the advantages of being in a hospital and all the fun of acting crazy. But more than that, he says quite frankly (after he begins to understand his script), his Child is scared to get well and cannot accept the permission offered by the therapist and the other group members to do so, because if he does his mother (in his head) will desert him. No matter how miserable he is with all his fears, anxieties, obsessions, and physical symptoms, he is still better off, he thinks, than being out in the world on his own without his Parent to protect him. At this point there is a phase where script analysis becomes almost indistinguishable from psychoanalytic probing. The protocol of his script becomes the subject of investigation, and the early influences which led him to decide on a not-OK position and way of life come under scrutiny. Here his pride at being a neurotic, a paranoid schizophrenic, an addict, or a criminal will begin to emerge, and he may bring in his diary or talk about his plans for writing an autobiography, as so many of his predecessors have done. Even people who are cured of ‘mental retardation’ may have some nostalgia for their previous condition.

虽然这些话听起来像是玩笑话，但它们却是他抗拒康复的核心所在。首先，帕特失去了待在医院的所有好处，也失去了装疯卖傻的乐趣。但更重要的是，他坦率地说（在他开始理解自己的“剧本”之后），他内心的“孩子”害怕康复，无法接受治疗师和其他组员给予的康复许可，因为如果他康复了，他的母亲（在他看来）就会抛弃他。无论他多么痛苦，多么被恐惧、焦虑、强迫观念和身体症状折磨，他仍然觉得，这总比独自一人、没有“父母”保护地生活在外面要好得多。此时，剧本分析几乎与精神分析探究难分彼此。他的“剧本”模式成为研究对象，而那些导致他选择这种“不正常”的立场和生活方式的早期影响因素也受到审视。此时，他作为神经质患者、偏执型精神分裂症患者、瘾君子或罪犯的自豪感会开始显露出来，他可能会拿出日记，或者像他的许多前辈一样，谈论他撰写自传的计划。即使是那些被治愈的“智力低下”患者，也可能对他们之前的状态怀有一些怀旧之情。

注释与参考文献

12 An interesting confrontation in this respect can be found in Black Hamlet , by Wulf Sachs (Geoffrey Bles, London, 1937), where a modern psychotherapist has an African witch doctor as his patient.

12 在这方面，沃尔夫·萨克斯的《黑人哈姆雷特》（杰弗里·布莱斯，伦敦，1937 年）中有一个有趣的对比，书中一位现代心理治疗师的病人是一位非洲巫医。

13 Berne, E.“一些东方精神病院。”美国精神病学杂志，106：376-383，1949。

14 Steiner, L. Where Do People Take Their Troubles? Houghton, Mifflin & Company, Boston, 1945.

14 Steiner, L. 人们把烦恼带到哪里去？霍顿·米夫林公司，波士顿，1945 年。

15 The trick about Herostratus, or Eratostratus, is to ask ‘Have you ever heard of him?’ I hadn’t, and was introduced to him by Dr Paul Federn. He burned down the Temple of Diana at Ephesus (now a ruin outside of Kushadasi, Turkey) on the same night that Alexander the Great was born, when Diana was too busy officiating at the confinement to take proper care of her shrine. He did this solely for personal publicity. As a punishment fitting the crime, it was decreed that his name should be totally erased from all records. But somehow Plutarch got wind of it nevertheless, and so the name of Herostratus became a symbol of gruesome notoriety.

15 关于赫罗斯特拉图斯（或埃拉托斯特拉图斯），诀窍在于问自己：“你听说过他吗？” 我之前从未听说过，是保罗·费德恩博士向我介绍的。在亚历山大大帝诞生的当晚，赫罗斯特拉图斯放火烧毁了以弗所的狄安娜神庙（如今是土耳其库沙达斯郊外的一片废墟）。当时狄安娜正忙于主持亚历山大的分娩仪式，无暇顾及神庙的安宁。赫罗斯特拉图斯这样做纯粹是为了博取个人名声。作为对其罪行的惩罚，他的名字被下令从所有记录中彻底抹去。然而，不知何故，普鲁塔克还是得知了此事，于是赫罗斯特拉图斯的名字便成了骇人听闻的恶名的象征。

16 Berne, E. Games People Play. Loc. cit .

16 Berne, E.《人们玩的游戏》。同上。

17 Berne, E. ‘The Staff-Patient Staff Conference.’ American Journal of Psychiatry , 125: 286–293, September, 1968.
